Reviews.Title: “Feeling at Home at the Grand Bohemian”
Reviews.Author: RCTIII
Reviews.Content: David Friederich General Manager Grand Bohemian Hotel 325 Orange Avenue Orlando, FL 32801 Dear David, I just wanted to send you a brief note to let you know how much my wife, Vicki, and I enjoyed our recent weekend visit to your hotel in downtown Orlando. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, so much so that we hope that you will allow us to make the Grand Bohemian our home away from home during future trips to Orlando. We have had the good fortune to travel throughout Europe, N. America and Asia and in those travels stayed in hotels billed as the “premier” properties, but never have we truly felt like friends had invited us into their home. The pride you have in the hotel and in your staff will keep us coming back, as long as you will have us, for more of the Grand Bohemian! It is truly a shame that we don’t live closer. Best Regards, Richard C. Tarbox III President & CEO

Reviews.Title: “My Kind of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksbrownutah
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grand Bohemian for a business trip and loved my stay. First of all, I love that this is a Marriott property and I'm treated to the same perks I get when I stay at a full-service Marriott property. The art in the hotel is amazing. I love that as you walk down each hallway, you have a sensory, artistic experience. I could have roamed down each of the hallways on the guest floors, but didn't want to seem like a deviant! In any case, the art in every part of the hotel was amazing. The room is beautiful and I love the Bose sound system with the hotel's own soundtrack. There is a nice sitting area to relax away from the comfortable bed. The concierge lounge was amazing--a great view and a beautiful space to spend time. This will definitely be my hotel choice if business takes me back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: johnathan v
Reviews.Content: Every year I host a business/educational seminar at this property and each time I am completely satisfied! The enjoyable experience even starts while scheduling each event with Eric Enriquez, Director of Exceptional Events. From the time I arrive until the time I depart, this property differentiates themselves from the competitition by being so unique, clean, and service oriented. There's no doubt this is the premier property in downtown Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Artsy and Cute, Needs Some Updates...”
Reviews.Author: Chash19
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel over the weekend for a business trip. I live in Miami and I guess you could say I'm a bit of a hotel snob.I appreciate five star hotels and usually try to find one when I travel, either for business or pleasure. That being said, I also used to be an Orlando native and I'm very familiar with the hotel scene there. Unfortunately, downtown Orlando doesn't provide much of a selection for 5-star hotels. The true luxury properties like the Ritz Carlton, Waldorf, or Gaylord Palms are down South in the attractions area, and I needed to be downtown for this particular trip. The Grand Bohemian is pretty much it for "luxury (ish)" downtown. Priced just slightly under the other 5 star properties in Orlando, but also priced significantly more than Embassy Suites and The Sheraton...it's kind of in a league of its own. But nonetheless, I was excited to check it out and see just how trendy Orlando could possibly be. The lobby is the best part, the location is also perfect. Very central walking distance to great restaurants and bars in downtown. I really enjoyed the lounge and live music at night. The rooms definitely need an update in a big way. Everything is very dark - and the old lamps have got to go. They boast a chic lobby, but the old appearance of the furniture, lighting, and bathroom just don't fit. You would expect a trendy hotel to have the sleekest and cleanest bathrooms, an Ipod dock in the rooms (please remove the 1995 CD players), and some lighting that allows you to see while you're getting ready. I read some good reviews about the beds - but honestly, nowadays, all the boutique trendy properties have stepped it up a notch with cool things like a pillow menu, better linens, and a better TV. This hotel is trendy by 1995 standards...can someone please bring it up to date? And...about 4:30pm I get a knock on the door, followed by a housekeeper immediately opening up the door - without even giving me time to answer - (and after my room had already been clean for the day), to say, "Everything ok?" It was very strange. Why is someone coming into my room at all at 4:30pm?? I can understand in the morning to clean, but entering without even giving me a chance to answer is just unacceptable. I come to Orlando often, wish I could give this place a second chance...but Mr. Kessler has some room renovations to do first.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed more than a Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awayofoffice
Reviews.Content: We recently attended a conference in Orlando and had the pleasure of staying at your hotel. Both of us are business and travel professionals and were quite impressed with not only the décor, but the outstanding service by your staff. Each member, from the front desk, valet, dining rooms and others gave exceptional service with genuine warmth each and every encounter. Each of our offered thanks was responded to with “my pleasure” and we really felt they meant it. Certainly in all our travels, which are many, this level of service was among the best. We loved the small details such as having the jazz music playing when we entered the room and having it there any time we wanted to listen. We dined often in the hotel and the food was exceptional as well. We extended our stay in Florida to take in the Disney Animal Kingdom Park and stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. It took 4 phone calls and 3 hours just to get two wine glasses to our room in that hotel. We also experienced several broken amenities in the Disney room and could not help but compare that stay to the Grand Bohemian. We defiantly will stay with you again on our next travels to Florida and be pleased to pass on our recommendations of your hotel. Our only regret was we meant to pick up a copy of the Kessler CD that played in our room! Thank you and best regards to you and your wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simonadamien
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel. I was pleasantly suprised as it looked a little "goth-ish" from the pictures. But turns out the decor is fabulous - think happy Tim Burton. Such a nice and refreshing change from all those other upscale hotels with their aespetisized design. This hotel's deco is warm and romantic. Service at the hotel was just fine. Beds are amazing (all my fellow travelers said so too). Breakfast is good as well. And the bar is a nice lively place at night (but not too loud). So I would recommend this hotel if you are staying on business in Orlando and don't want to stay in a resort-y type place. My only comment (and I'm not sure it's even negative) is the pool area. It looks like it was designed for circa 2003 parties, but it's starting to feel oldish with it's 4 foot deep party pool and white chandeliers. There weren't any parties when I was there, so the whole thing felt kind of sad. And the hotub was not working when I went. One last thing: when I was there they were using one ply toilet paper. A small thing I know, but still very annoying. Use two ply!! All in all a great experience and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “the place to saty downtown”
Reviews.Author: Sportsteamcoach
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Bohemian for a conference. I would easily recommend this hotel if you wish to stay in downtown Orlando. The room was very nice and clean. The staff was very helpful. The restaurant was good and reasonably priced. It may not be close to the tourist attractions but this certainly exceeded all my expectations for a downtown hotel. Would stay again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tia F
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel. I stayed here for vacation after a recommendation from a friend, and I was not disappointed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Greta B
Reviews.Content: Super fun experience here. The location was great, bed was comfy, staff was accomodating. The only weird thing I noticed was that the lighting in the room is so low! Had access to the club room for breakfast which was delicious!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, hip hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: KVTexas
Reviews.Content: I found the room to be very clean, good size, and overall a good place to stay for business purposes. The breakfast was outstanding and my waitress was extremely friendly (so much so, that I had to tell the day manager personally how nice she was). The bar pours a great drink, too. Were I to visit Orlando again on business, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Janet D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Bohemian recently. I was not feeling well do to an accident a week before so needed help. The staff at the hotel was great, very friendly, and could not have been more helpful. What ever I needed they found for me. The room was great, very comfortable, very good condition, and very clean. WE arrived late so didn't eat until morning but I must say the food was wonderful and the coffee perfect (even at 5 star hotels you can get so so coffee) but here everything was great. If you're going to be in Orlando this would be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: jjohnson911
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience! Perfect getaway for my girlfriend and I. Not sure what the other negative reviews are about...? We wanted something nice but away from all the tourists. Beautiful hotel with a great location downtown. They have a real Starbucks in the lobby, not one of those fake "brewed by Starbucks" places. Anyways, we loved it. What a beautiful hotel! Lots of gorgeous artwork. Very authentic. Didn't feel at all like it had been Disney-fied. Very nice pool with hot tub that gets sun. Its up on the rooftop so you have privacy. Very quiet and relaxing. Fitness center was a little on the small side, but I didn't need it because the weather was perfect and I did my run through the beautiful downtown. Concierge gave me jogging directions to Lake Eola which had a perfect 1 mi loop around the lake. Anyways, here was our experience.... We checked in on a Thursday. We pulled up and were immediately greeted by the valet attendant who got a bellman to take our luggage. There was a doorman waiting to hold the door who greeted us. The only other places I've experienced everything on point like this are at Ritz Carlton and Waldorf-Astoria. But this felt so much warmer and genuine. We got there earlier than check-in time(4pm), but that wasn't a problem. I'm a Marriott Rewards member and I was upgraded to a 1-bedroom jacuzzi suite which was perfect for the couple's getaway. The girl at the front desk was great and immediately welcomed us. Very knowledgable about the area. (I've stayed in Orlando before and like to see what the staff knows and what they recommend) Check-in was quick and painless just the way it should be. Bellman escorted us to our room. I think his name was Jeff. Very professional. Told us all about the hotel and how the owner is an art collector and personally picks out all the pieces that are featured throughout the hotel. He recommended that if we were interested we should take a trip down to the level with the meeting rooms. Its set up just like an art gallery. We took him up on the suggestion later and he was right! I've never seen a hotel with this kind of art and decor before! The gf loved it too. We probably spent an hour looking at all the different kinds of paintings. Anyways, back to the room, when we arrived the lights were on and jazz music was playing in the room. Nice touch. (the bellman explained that their tagline is "yours in Art and Music") The room: Great space in the room. Separate bedroom. huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub that opens up into the bedroom. Our room overlooked the city. Amazing architecture in the downtown area. Cool lights at night. Great soundproofing. We couldn't hear any of the downtown traffic or the weekend crowd. The king bed was super comfortable with lots of pillows. Upon further examination, I saw that the jazz music was coming from a Bose Soundmachine. They have one in every room. Very cool. I was able to hook up my iphone and listen to music, but I actually listened to the music CDs that were provided in the room. We liked them so much we took them with us (for a fee of course). Thursday night we had tickets to the Orlando Magic game. They have a brand new arena that is very close to the hotel. Walking distance so we never had to get the car. Saved on additional parking charges, and we saved on cab fare. For the win! We did room service for breakfast the next morning. We had ordered the night before with those menus you hang on your door. Everything arrived exactly how we had asked (I had made a note to use Egg Beaters for my order) and it arrived on-time and the food was hot. Perfect! On Friday we met friends at EPCOT for the day. It was a 30 minute drive from the hotel to EPCOT. Right down I-4. Not bad. Again, we didn't want a hotel in the middle of the tourist areas. We stayed until the park closed so when we came back to the hotel we just wanted to sleep. Upon return to the room we saw that "turndown service" had been provided. Our room had been cleaned up, the bed was ready for us, and the curtains had been pulled. Another nice touch. Saturday was a pool and relax day for us. We also explored the downtown area. The concierge was great. She recommended we go checkout a festival that was taking place at Lake Eola. We had a blast. Lots of local food and wine. There was a concert going on as well. It was all local people and it was great! No screaming kids and strollers! Saturday night we had reservations at La Boheme, the restaurant at the Grand Bohemian (see how that worked? ;) Anyways, AMAZING FOOD. I have never had a more amazing ribeye steak. I could barely eat it all. The service was perfect. The decor was gorgeous just like the rest of the hotel. Very deep rich reds and more artwork. That night we did test out the hot tub and it worked perfectly. I recommend pairing with a nice bottle of Veuve champagne. ;) Sunday morning: Brunch at La Boheme. Live piano on the grand piano they have? Wow, thats really nice. With live Sax as well?? Talk about a wow factor. The buffet was setup in the rotunda around the grand piano. (Thats what I love about this place, you are ALWAYS surrounded by amazing decor, artwork, music, style, etc). The food was incredible. And even though it was a buffet, the staff was still amazing. They had chefs preparing omeletes and seafood dishes right in front of you. Unlimited champagne with brunch is a nice touch. That was our trip! We had to leave after brunch unfortunately. What an amazing stay. This hotel has an amazing boutique feel to it with all the amenities you expect from the big boys and I still got my Marriott points! Honestly, this hotel should be training others, especially in the Orlando area. Every single staff member we encountered was great! We were warmly greeted by everyone. Every interaction seemed genuine. Everyone seems to love working there and that makes for a great guest experience! We will come back! Remember to ask about the art gallery in the meeting rooms if they are open! Well worth the side trip.

Reviews.Title: “No service present at this hotel - Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: LVpj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it seems like service was never present at this hotel. Wherever you go you have to wait forever until anybody takes care of you. To get a drink and a simple snack in the lounge it took us at two occasions at least 30 minutes until we were serviced. Pool was closed almost every evening due to private events and even if there was time to use it, there were no chairs available because they only have 10 chairs for the whole hotel. Rooms weren't cleaned until 5pm in the evening and bath amenities like shower gel and soap wasn't refilled once during the whole stay. Although our room was 5 rooms away from the elevator we heard the elevator noise all night. We even heard the TV of our neighbor room. Breakfast in the restaurant was the slowest breakfast service I ever experienced, it took us 1 hr from arriving at the restaurant to staring to eat. The only real good thing was the Valet Parking service which was as fast and efficient as it should be, very pleasant experience. I will never choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Nailcutter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a Marriott Rewards event. Check in was smooth as was the valet. This is a true downtown hotel and is a few blocks from the Amway Center and many bars. The rooms very comfortable with nice beds and large bathrooms. Flatscreen televisions in each room. Breakfast buffet very good with everything on the buffet you need. There is a connecting Starbucks, a wading pool and a fitness center with treadmills, weights and ellipicals. The Dallas Mavericks were staying here at the same time we were so you know this must be a quaility property.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Avoid Avoid”
Reviews.Author: gabrielmurphy
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever had the displeasure of visiting. Internet service is as slow as dial-up service in Uganda. Everything is overpriced. If you want a cocktail waitress at the pool, be prepared to wait until next week before she shows up. Well before then, you will have been removed from the pool area because they close it twice a day for weddings and other private events. The management does not care about the service issues their guests encounter. Do not stay at this hotel unless you like waiting 30 minutes for a website to load, 3 hours for a waitress to show up at the pool or $25 cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: jkbeasley
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! What a horrible hotel. We were assured early check-in, but the room wasn't ready until almost 4pm. Then, we get room 615. 615 is next to the workout room on one side, the ice machine for the floor immediately outside the door, and right off the pool elevators. Didn't get any sleep the entire night between ice machines, people yelling outside our door, and then people working out and banging around on the other side. Couldn't get anyone's attention in the lobby--the staff can't hear anything. Pool area was a mess. Chairs falling apart, dirty pool. The valet staff were the best part of the hotel, but that's only because they are outside and can acutally hear.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptious and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: bellatraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend away with my boyfriend in Orlando, where I managed to find an excellent deal for this stunning property. Rooms are spacious and appointed beautifully, even if the paintings in the hallway were a little eccentric. This hotel was full of character and staff were friendly and welcoming. The pool was a little cool and the sun wasn't out for long but then again it is February! Had Sunday (jazz) brunch in the restaurant which was decadent, and sumptious - the price was a little high however it included unlimited mimosas & some items of the ala carte menu (though those portions were rather small). We also had a few drinks in the bar during happy hour which was definitely well worth the price. Don't be surprised to see NBA stars staying in the hotel as the Magic play so close to the hotel and other celebs who may be performing close by. Downtown Orlando was pretty quiet but there are some delicious (Kres Chophouse, particularly) restaurants a VERY quick walk away on West Church Street and a Starbucks for that perfect pick-me up in the morning attached to the hotel. . When back in Orlando, I hope to stay again at the decadent Bohemian!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: phillyvisitor
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend just stayed here for a weekend for a wedding. The hotel is in a really good location, within walking distance to lots of restaurants, bars and clubs. The lobby bar has a cool vibe and had live entertainment on Friday and Saturday night. The rooms are very large - a standard room has an area with a couch and desk so it's a good amount of space for two people. The staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. At the front desk we asked for a running route suggestion and they had a laminated card with 3 and 5-mile path maps and turn by turn directions - best running experience via a hotel ever! I'm taking off one star because of a weird incident. We were sitting in our room on Saturday afternoon when a staff member knocked on the door (which I didn't hear). They proceeded to pop their head in and ask if they could check the mini bar. I thought this was a bit of an invasion of our space, they should have just waited until we left or checked it the next day when we left.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome dose of decadence in downtown Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: helenmarie63
Reviews.Content: There are some places where it makes sense to avoid an authentic local experience & downtown Orlando is one of them. The area has seen better days & there are a lot of empty lots from building boom projects that never happened. And the downtown nightlife scene took a fatal hit when Disney opened its adults only venues. But The Bohemian is a little gilded world unto itself, with a giant bar/lounge done up like a New Orleans circus and a Sunday brunch that draws both guests & a diverse local crowd. My 18 year old daughter & I toured area colleges by day & then hung out at the hotel. The staff was courteous & friendly, the food good and the jewel toned, Carnival decor was a welcome respite from the bland, sun bleached scene outside. Not sure what would bring me back to downtown Orlando but I know for sure where I'd stay....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Downtown Orland - The most stylish in the city”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Cantrell
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stay at the Grand Bohemian about once or twice a year when we attend evening functions or on the weekend when we want a nice place to crash out. The rates at this hotel are really very competitive for a 4+ star hotel. Do your research and check the direct website for some really good AAA / etc rates. There is Valet Parking only. This isn't really a big deal. If you've been to Downtown Orlando with a car, then you know that you could be blocks and blocks away to get to the nearest public parking lot. It's a swanky place with a lovely entrance. Even when we take the uber-gas sensible Toyota Corolla; we still valet. It makes for a much nicer and smother entrance to the hotel I can assure you. Since the building is sort of a "high rise" and in the high rise area of Downtown, you have to kind of drive into the first floor. I only mention this because there are a lot of one way street in that area, so you could get turned around or not be able to figure out how to approach the valet entrance. It is really quite a discrete area to keep the hotel nice and clean looking. Just keep it in mind, it's not a huge deal. Once you get out of the car it's a few steps to the front door and about 3-4 steps to your reception area. All in all, I believe I've stayed at this hotel 15 times and not once have I received poor service checking in. The staff is very nice, knowledgeable and eager to assist you. After you've checked in, it's just a few more steps and you're at the elevators to take you to your floor. The layout of the hotel is pretty simple and easy to navigate to your room. You will see an outrageous amount "real" art that is for sale all over the walls. There is a very impressive body of works on display, so make sure you take your time to soak it all in if you're in art buff. Let's get to the rooms....nice, comfortable and great beds. That sums it up in 4 words. Now in more detail, we stayed in a one bedroom suite during our November stay. WOW! The regular rooms are quite lavish with excellent bathrooms and fantastic decor throughout the room. This was our first suite at the Grand Bohemian and boy oh boy...was it grand. Now, don't start envisioning the presidential suite at Cesar's Palace. It has a different layout than the normal rooms as it in on the rotunda corner of the building. This area is a fantasic spot for watch the TV, hanging out on the couch, sitting down to eat or just soak in the view and enjoy a book. The bathrooms are always elegant, but not overdone. Beds are so comfortable that I'd like to take one home. Attached pictures will give you an idea of how the room looks. A couple of last things to mention. The bar / lounge in the lobby often has a great jazz band on Saturday nights and can make for a nice romantic evening without leaving the hotel at all. It's rather lush with a huge focus on art in the decor, rather breathtaking at times. There is also a fabulous restaurant on site, however I can't remember the name. I've only eaten there for Sunday Brunch and it's.......mouth watering. This was the first place I've ever had roasted Smoked Applewood Bacon cut to order, sinfully delicious. If you are able to book a reservation for any of the major holidays like mothers or fathers day...book it. It's probably going to run you in the range of $50 per person, however it's worth every penny. Often times the price of the brunch is inclusive of champagne or even wine. So, in some ways, it's a pretty good value for the money. There IS a pool. I can't remember what floor it's on (maybe 7). It's a nice little lap pool with spitting lion heads into it. There are excellent quality loungers on the deck, a hot tub and quite a fancy shmancy tented area with tables underneath it. I would assume it's a function area, but it was really nice with fantastic chandeliers hanging inside and all. There is a fitness and spa...I've not had the pleasure of using either. All in all, this is one of my favorite hotels in Orlando. If you have to be close to or anywhere north of Downtown, then stay here. What an absolute gem in downtown Orlando...who would have known?

Reviews.Title: “Most Stylish Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: jasonpoynter
Reviews.Content: I stay here a few times a year, and always get the same great feeling each time. This hotel has enough style for the rest of the boring hotels in downtown Orlando. The staff is also very accomodating. Don't be surprised if you see a pro athlete or concert performer in the lobby or in the valet line. It's pretty routine for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Orlando”
Reviews.Author: SunseekerOrlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to celebrate our anniversary. We were very happy with the room and were upgraded when we checked in. The rooms are quiet and clean, just as I would have expected from a upscale hotel. Close walk to many downtown Orlando attractions. No Disney influence (very nice!) The outdoor pool is nice with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: pierlady1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you would like excellent service and a quality experience. This hotel is definitely the top of the line. Staff and ambiance were the best. Nice pool and numerous other tasteful amenities. Close to downtown restaurants and other cultural experiences. A 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jazzsmin
Reviews.Content: Party of 7, (3 children 4 adults) upgraded to concierge level for both rooms with connecting doors. (were Marriott members) included breakfast, snacks, & free internet. The minute we pulled up we knew we had made a wonderful choice. The hotel is gorgeous. The artwork is incredible, they even have Klimt originals. Service is high, very high. Valet is on point! Gym is nice, pool a little small but also very nice. Rooms clean, and the bed, omg the beds!!! Marriotts have it down packed for the beds. They even have dual shower heads. Jeff the manager gave us a small tour of the art and brief history of the grand piano just because. Thanks Jeff!! If you appreciate art this is the place for you. We went to Orlando to go to the parks its a little drive but so worth it. After 3 days at the parks it was nice to be in a grown up hotel. Nearby are walking distance restaurants and bars try out Pine Twenty 2. My entire family even my 7 year old loved this hote. My kids touched some of the minibar food, it charges automatically, they removed no questions asked. Everyone at this hotel is 100% professional. Thank you for making our trip to Disney even better u guys are GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: Renaissanceman58102
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place - excellent lobby and staff, Had a corner room on 8th floor with jacuzzi and lounge room. Double blinds open from jacuzzi to bedroom which is nice. Very nice shower and really a treat to see all of the unique art in hotel and their gallery. Place has the feel of a classic hotel. Nice outdoor pool. Seems to be a VERY secure hotel with cards needed for elevator access and room safes. Room had plenty of space in it. Room service food was good and Sunday brunch was good albiet expensive. The valet parking is a little hard to find and a touch smaller than one would like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with perfect location Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a 5 day visit at the hotel and from the outset it was an amazing time. Miriam was a joy and went above and beyond to ensure our stay was exceptional. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and anyone who appreciates art should not think twice about staying here. We particularly enjoyed being able to bring our 2 dogs and having the surrounding neighborhood and Lake Eola to walk them. We cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and will be staying here on any future visits to Orlando. Thanks again to all the staff at the Grand Bohemian!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: carribeandreams
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in downtown Orlando. We booked an executive suite and was very pleased. The guest service/staff were amazing, the art was wonderful and the rooms were nicely appointed. The bathroom was very large was a nice tube. The concierge's lounge was one of the nicest (in a Marriott) that I have seen. The breakfast was not bad but not great. I took my daughter and two of her girlfriends on a trip for a weekend music festival and we all loved the hotel! Would stay again with out hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Miriam Was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PaddywagonsD
Reviews.Content: One of my best friends was at the Bohemian celebrating her birthday (which I was supposed to fly into Orlando for) and I was unable to make it last minute. I called the front desk and spoke to Miriam, asking her if she could help me send a gift and a note to the room. She could not have been more helpful. Within five minutes, she had written a card and sent an amenity to the room. On top of that, all of my friends there texted me all night telling me what an amazing hotel/birthday trip I was missing. When I am in Orlando, I will DEFINITELY stay at the Bohemian!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Pharmacyfrau
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and was really psyched based on other reviews. When I arrived the place was like a giant frat party...very loud and noisy with parties on various floors and several of my companions actually switched their rooms so they could sleep. On Sunday Starbucks was closed. The location is in downtown Orlando ...don't stay here if you plan on going to the parks or the restaurants down near the convention center. There are many restaurants within walking distance however.The beds are very comfy and it would have been heavenly if it was quiet. As is typical with any Marriott property, no free wi fi unless you are gold level or higher. The pool area was closed more often than not because of private functions. The sfaff if very pleasant but my real gripe was despite having my "please make up room sign in the door," my room didn't get made up unti 5pm! That was also the case for other meeting attendees. The rooms are on the dark side and although I like art, it became a sensory overload after staying there 24 hours...by hour 72, I was ready to scream

Reviews.Title: “One night stay for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: taxman53
Reviews.Content: Went for a stay to visit a nearby CNL office. Certainly very convenient to the draws of downtown Orlando (whatever those might be...lol). The lobby and bar were great and the staff at the desk and bell staff were great. We ate dinner and breakfast as part of a group meeting.... The breakfast buffet was pretty typical, but the dinner food was really good for group food, and well presented too!! The room was very clean, and had a nice chair/sofa to recline on. TV was great, the bathroom was very clean, and the bed was quite comfortable. No complaints. i would stay again if I ever had need to go to downtown Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “They had me at Hello...”
Reviews.Author: JDCNECSCV
Reviews.Content: I live in Los Angeles and was going to Orlando for a business trip. I was given choices of hotels to choose from and I am very picky about where I stay. I called the night before to the front desk to ask about the size of the safe for my laptop and Shawn took the time to measure it for me which was a perfect fit. Now that is service. I then called again about a spa appointment and unfortunately with the 3 hour time difference they were closed, but instead of saying sorry they are closed, he asked me about my flight, any layovers and reminded me of the 3 hour time difference and that I could call during my layover. Genius and innovative! By the time I arrived, I was greeted immediately at the valet, my luggage already waiting for me and low and behold, I see SHAWN at the front desk. I had never met him, yet I felt we were already friends. He took extra special care and unfortunately I had to cut my trip short as I found out my dad had been taken to the intensive care unit back in Los Angeles and I had to return the next day. Shawn made my stay extra special knowing I would miss out on the week in Orlando for work and pleasure and upgraded me to a suite, which was exquisite, eccentric and beautifully decorated. My next encounter was Jun the bellman who helped me with my luggage. He was offering suggestions on where to go, there was a concert going on and it was the last night and showed me the amenities of the suite during which time, I shared I would put my water bottles in the fridge. He immediately got on the radio and called someone to bring a refrigerator for cold bottles of water. I was quickly again pleasantly surprised. The refrigerator came within minutes and Jun brought me 3 bottles of water for my stay after asking about settling in. I ordered room service for dinner and Arta came in and similar to Shawn and Jun immediately engaged me in conversation which was authentic and genuine in which I told her so. She shared that her 1 year anniversary with the Grand Bohemian Hotel was coming up and she shared how proud she was that she has this job because of the # of interviews and people she met she knew that this hotel took pride in who they hired. Wow! Happy Anniversary Arta! I felt at home, not only by my experience before, during and after my stay, but because of the feeling of being welcomed from the moment I booked my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: jason r
Reviews.Content: I stayed at fistly with work last year and went back this year as it was a great hotel. The rooms are of a good standard, and the bar and restaurant are first class. The staff in the hotel are very helpful and willing to help. The hotel pool is small but clean and functional. The gym is again small with only a limited amount of equipment. There are plenty of restaurant and great bars in the surronding area within walking distance. At the weekend the night life is fantastic with very busy and buzzing bars. Check out as many bars as you can are there are some very good ones. Try the roof bar in the basketball stadium (180 degrees), a little potentious but well worth a visit. i would stay here again, but usually for 3 to 4 night as this is enough to visit all the surround downtown area (but i recommend staying over a weekend if you want to party)

Reviews.Title: “Almost great & perfect for Amway Center”
Reviews.Author: bandbfans
Reviews.Content: We came for one night for the Josh Groban concert and picked the Bohemian because it's walking distance to the Amway Center and it's upscale. We normally stay at the Ritz-Carlton. Good: Beautiful artwork, great atmosphere, courteous and friendly staff, GREAT 'hand-made' cocktails (no sour mix here) and great food in bar, quiet for a downtown location (we were on the 14th floor), very comfortable bed and crisp, clean, high thread count sheets. The requested extra foam pillows were in the room when we arrived. Bad: Concierge Level - don't waste your money, until they get a handle on this extra. Website stated 'Continental Breakfast, afternoon tea, hors d'oeuvres, cocktails for a fee, staffed from 5:30 - 9:30 p.m., all day free snacks - water - soda'. The breakfast was okay - fruits, oatmeal, individual seriously overcooked quiches, etc. There was NO afternoon tea. The hors d'oeuvres were GONE by 6:00 p.m., napkins were gone, no diet sodas and several other items were already depleted. The small club room was mobbed and one woman was working the tiny bar. My husband waited 15 minutes for one cocktail and a glass of wine. The 'free snacks' were NutriGrain bars, under-ripe oranges and green apples. There were 4 or 5 bottles of water, several each of ginger ale, club soda, lemon-lime, etc. in the small refrigerator. That's the extent of the 'free' items. TIP: Bring your own bottled water because the bottled waters in your room are $5. TIP: Don't even touch anything in the mini-bar, because it's electronic and will charge you if you just pick it up to look at it! (Tell the desk and they'll remove the charge, if it happens.) Also, turn-down service is included, but we didn't get one, so dirty glasses and towels remained with us the whole time. We also did not get a newspaper. At sunrise, the dust on the furniture was very visible, too. If the hotel is busy, make dinner AND brunch reservations. We couldn't get either at an acceptable time once we arrived. Concierge desk has a handout with a 2 for 1 Brunch coupon for hotel guests -nice savings, but don't wait to make reservations! At 8 on Sunday morning, the earliest available was 12:15. Dinner was either 5:00 or 7:00 - neither worked for us since we had to be at Amway by 7:30 and we'd had a wonderful appetizer in the bar at 2:30. We did meet with Front Desk management and she was very receptive, attentive and interested in our comments. She gave us a $50 credit which is the amount of the extra charge for the 'Concierge Level', even though we didn't expect it. Again, the staff was great - Taylor, Jun, Jennifer, female bartender in lobby lounge (name?). With some training and upgrading here and there, this could be much better!

Reviews.Title: “Poseidon Spa at Grand Bohemian”
Reviews.Author: mayyum
Reviews.Content: I went to the Grand Bohemian spa, called Poseidon Spa, and absolutely loved it! The serene and quiet atmosphere made me feel so relaxed. The massage therapist gave a wonderful detailed massage that I will never forget! The hotel is beautifully warm and inviting. I will be returning for more and more spa services there!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, but the lobby bar leaves something to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: PHXJeremy
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm getting older - but I'm NOT a fan of lobby bars that are SO loud you can't hear the waitress when taking your order, or the person sitting less than 2' from you. I have to say, the lobby bar really spoiled my opinion of this otherwise cool property. It's hard to find non-kid oriented properties in Orlando. The rooms here are well equipped, the location is perfect - right off of I-4. The workout facility was well equipped. The valet was a constant cluster - for no good reason. Not being able to call down for your vehicle from your room is a bummer. It's these little things that separate great from good in terms of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very neat hotel with great art”
Reviews.Author: testmachine
Reviews.Content: Was there for company retreat. the artwork, style and staff at the hotel created an extremely relaxed atomosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Orlando”
Reviews.Author: wllsu
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Orlando on business. It was also very close to a great "business meeting" steakhouse, i forget the name but the folks at the front desk can certainly tell you. The service here was great - very friendly staff. I've already booked my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Bohemian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYToTampaGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quick 25th Anniversary getaway and were delighted with our stay at the GBH. Check in was easy and we loved the fact that you needed a room key to access any of the floors in the hotel. Rooms were spacious and very clean. The bed was to die for!! Had an amazing sleep the entire weekend. If you love art, this hotel is for you! We enjoyed looking at the art all over the hotel. Every employee was amazing as far as trying to please. I need to send a big thank you to one of the concierge Christine(I think that's her name), When my husband and I were thinking of where to have dinner one night, he mentioned to her that he wanted grouper. She called approximately 10 restaurants looking to see if they had it on the menu. She called us to tell us that one restaurant had 10 remaining. She definitely went above and beyond for us. We eventually had dinner in the hotel restaurant. Besides unfortunately having to listen to some stuffed shirt in a suit trying to get something for nothing, our dinner was absolutely amazing. The food, wine, service was exceptional. Our room was very quiet even though the hotel was full. We overlooked the pool and never heard a single noise. Only one small issue: We chose the breakfast package and weren't given the vouchers at check in or explained how it worked until we were at breakfast the next day. No big deal, just a little inconvenient. One suggestion to Management, charging $22/day to park and $10/day for internet is a little ridiculous. This is a high end hotel and they should reduce the parking and have the internet access free of charge. All in all, we had a great stay and will return for our next getaway weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, sexy & fun - plus EXCELLENT downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandSam
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty spectacular! We stayed here for my 30th birthday celebration and it was the perfect choice. When you think of Orlando, you think of Disney World and the attractions... and family hotel this is not (which is probably why we loved it)! After they found out it was a celebration, we were upgraded at check-in to a luxurious suite, with access to the concierge suite - complete with free nibbles, exclusive bar & sweeping views! Our hotel room was huge, luxurious and comfortable (the beds are incredible). We had dinner at the restaurant and it was SO good! The place is swanky, sexy & we had excellent service. We were even treated to a complimentary dessert and two glasses of champagne as it was my birthday! We will definitely go back there. The only reason I'm not giving the G.B. five stars is for a few small reasons. Service in the lounge was not good - the female bartender had a bit of an attitude and was not all too friendly. The pool service was also lacking - there was a server taking drink orders and after being at the pool for 2 hours, we were never approached by her once (and we really wanted to get our drink on - it was my BIRTHDAY, after all!). And, the valet staff confirmed that I could park in a specific spot on the street for free, and I ended up finding a ticket on my car the next day. However, none of these issues will keep me from returning. This place rocks & we will definitely go back! I should also mention the location is PERFECT if you're heading out on the town - walking distance to great bars, restaurants and clubs! Other positives: The artwork throughout the hotel is beautiful, front desk staff were very helpful, & the price was VERY reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel w/ superior customer service”
Reviews.Author: Adonis H
Reviews.Content: It gives me great pleasure to express my personal experience at The Grand Bohemian this past weekend. The staff from our arrival to checkout were amazing. I’ve never seen so many employees that seem to truly enjoy what they do … courteous, appreciative and attentive are words that come to mind, yet none gives justice to what was displayed. We had one issue during our stay; the first night we had neighbors that were extremely noisy in the hallway outside our door around 3am, figuring it would only last a few moments, we didn’t act, decided to mention it the next morning to the front desk. Taylor was extremely apologetic and immediately acted by investigating the proximity of the noise to our room and noticed all the neighbors would be the same throughout our stay, so we were moved, although it may have been a small act, it was clear she as well as the entire staff cared about improving our experience. I will be traveling to Orlando more frequently in the coming months due to work and pleasure, I look forward to future stays at The Grand Bohemian, my new hotel of choice. Special thanks to Taylor, Marian & Christine Extremely Satisfied Customer, Adonis

Reviews.Title: “Systemic Problems”
Reviews.Author: pcs107
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a close to home get-away for the night. Lots of dama in our lives recently and just needed a quiet evening out. Dinner in the restaurant was very nice. (Service was a bit slow, but my wife reminded me we were there to "slow down" for an evening.) The real issues started after midnight. We had taken a room on the concierge level believing that the experience there would be a step above. Party goers all night kept us awake. Halls are loud and unmanaged. So with no sleep we arose late to shower for Sunday brunch and .........no hot water. You've got to be kidding me! No hot water in a four star hotel! Needless to say, we skipped brunch, lodged our complaint w/ mgmt and checked out. Next time we'll drive a bit further, pay a bit more and stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaniSan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just beautiful, for someone who loves art it will be perfect, I personally enjoyed walking around just to see them. The location is great with walking distance to restaurantes and pubs, rooms are big and comfortable, another plus is the Starbucks Coffee next to the lobby inside the hotel which makes a great place for breakfast and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, So far......”
Reviews.Author: Keenun B
Reviews.Content: Well, I just got off the phone with them. My husband booked the room without my knowledge.....I did ask him to book a room and we are "Marriott people", so I assumed it would be a Marriott. He is flying in from Dubai tommorow and our daughters are participating in art classes at the Orlando Museum of Art. I told him to book a hotel that would satisfy all of our needs. He booked this hotel and I freaked out when I read some of the reviews from other websites. Some of the reviews made it sound as though children were unwelcome. This was a surprise to me as we have had our kids at every Marriott we have ever stayed in and we did have ONE experience that made our kids feel a bit uncomfortable, but that was it. Normally, our kids are very well taken care of by the Marriott staff.....they always feel so special and our 8 year old even asked if we could LIVE at Marriott! Anyway, I called the front desk and spoke with Ms Hooks. (???? hope I got that right!!!) She was wonderful and she made me feel so much better. She mentioned that the hotel has an Art Gallery on the 5th floor and that would really help with adding to the depth of the art classes our daughters were taking at the museum. She explained the benefits if the pool area and didn't bat an eye when my phone died......she knew who I was when I called back 10 minutes later and she was so cordial. She makes me feel so welcome! Not only has she put my mind at ease, but she also kept my husband out of trouble! We can't wait to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkennedy10
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel frequently for work and love it! The decor is interesting, the staff remembers my name, the bar and restaurant servers are friendly. I don't think I have ever had a bad experience. I am usually upgraded to a jacuzzi suite but have stayed in all of the various types of rooms. All are well appointed with luxurious and comfortable bedding. They also all have at least a small sitting area so I can recline on the couch to watch TV. The concierge lounge is great and has an adequate breakfast but it's a little awkardly arranged. The bar in the lobby is fantastic and even has live jazz music several nights per week. There is also a Starbucks attached to the lobby, which is a nice touch. The main restaurant has great food in an interesting atmosphere. The valet parking is pricey but in that area is about the same as the other parking garages. The valet staff are outstanding. My one suggestion would be to change up the room service menu. There are only a few health conscious choices and I would like some variety. Overall though, love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Super Service, outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: peng4711
Reviews.Content: On some trips to Florida we either fly to Miami or Orlando. We have stayed 4 times in the Bohemian and all times it is outstanding and this is why. -easy to reach from and to airport, -valet parking, -friendly staff, -very nice and spacious rooms, -super comfy bed, -nice restaurant with a special "LED"menu, -good wines, -walking distance into "old" orlando, -very nice price/quality ratio, if you look for a hotel on before you leave and want a good night, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dukeklaus
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel with a very attentive staff. The pool was beautiful however it was closed on Saturday evening due to a wedding. Since the hotel is so beautiful I'm sure this happens often. What a lucky couple who could get married here. Very Romantic:)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl6
Reviews.Content: In Orlando for business and had a great stay. Clean, comfortable room, very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, couldn't understand all the high reviews.”
Reviews.Author: RoamWorld
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a couple of days for a conference. Based on our experiences in Orlando we were looking forward to this hotel that is promoted as very chic and part of the Marriott "Autograph" collection. We are big Marriott fans, but this place was a total letdown. We stayed on the 12th floor of the hotel. Our room had several spots of paint missing on the wall, a large black scuff mark on the wall as you walked in and very old and moldy rugs. My allergies really kicked in! Vacationing there during 95 degree heat and humidity I was stunned to find no fan in the bathroom. Terrible! Although the roomy is large, it was very shabby. The chair to the desk had three rips on the seat cushion. The "art" on the wall reminded me of the haunted mansion at Hollywood Studies. Everything in the hotel requires your room key, from the business center, to the pool, to the bathroom to using the elevator. Clearly there are safety issues with the area the hotel is located in. Although they promote themselves as a key conference location, they offer no complimentary shuttle service. The price for a cab is about $44 and a limo price is about $95. One of the real stunners was to find that if you move a drink or remove a drink from the fridge there is a sensor that automatically charges your room tab....whether you drink it or NOT. The fridge was lukewarm. I think the hotel really needs to step up. The few staff I saw around the dirty pool area were hiding on the side smoking. And, the pool...or should I say wading pool. It definitely is heated....so hot we couldn't swim. No worries though, we physically could not swim as the deepest area of the pool was 3 ft 6 inch with about 6-8 inches of water missing. Really, this can't be Marriott's best go of it. We'd never return. Although we did venture out and about, the half hour we were outside we were approached by two pan-handlers. Of all the places for conferences in Orlando, this isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSF_TravelinFools
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Grand Bohemian with my wife and infant daughter. It definitely has the look and feel of a high end hotel (there was a Ferrari at the valet as we pulled up). The valet folks were quick and friendly, loading up all our bags and passing them to the bellman. As we moved into check in, the lobby seemed very dark. I think the hotel is going for that feel, but it almost had a Goth feel to it. Check it was quick and painless; however the young woman attempted to make a joke that didn’t land too well about my fancy Ritz Carlton Rewards card. My wife tells me not to be offended by it, and I’m not, but it caught me a little off guard. I think someone else may have taken legitimate offense to it, but I guess she was only joking. The room was very nice, and well decorated. The purple velvet-esque couch was also a nice touch. We had a nice view of the pool and the downtown area. We didn’t eat at the hotel, originally were going to order room service (hoping for something small) but the menu didn’t really offer it. I did want the key lime pie, but it didn’t become available until late night, so we passed. Next time we may try to the in hotel restaurant or lobby bar... The area was great. A ton of restaurant options are close by. I will likely stay there again when we come back in March to buy a house, as the proximity can’t be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Truly elegant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: roscher
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Reminded us of the 4-5 star hotels in Europe. Personnel were very helpful. Cocktail lounge was really unique. A fine art collection in the gallery. The rooms were lovely and the Conceirge lounge was excellent. A bit difficult to find the hotel in downtown Orlando ,but well worth the hassle of one way streets.

Reviews.Title: “Business/Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: scalderin2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Bohemian on a business trip and loved it, the rooms were very clean (im very picky), very spacious, The bathrooms were spacious and clean as weel. The property was well taken care of, the hotel seemed to be running a fresh scented air fresner through the air system because everywhere i went it smelled clean and fresh, The food was delicious and room service was quick. The staff was very friendly and always there to help. on the other hand, yes Parking is valet only at $22 a night (no way around it, no other parking nearby) and the price for the room service is a little high but you are getting what you pay for. overall it was a great place very nice hotel, the pool view is amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Simply one of the nicest hotels bolstered by the best service in orlando”
Reviews.Author: david f
Reviews.Content: I am always on the road and often in orlando. I always stay at the Grand Bohemian, the hotel is comfortable, great art and cool music, very clean and modern without being gaudy. Best of all the service is top notch and the management actually cares about the guests. Recently I bumped into a manger who went out of her way to make a trivial issue go away. Not only did she follow up with professional status updates she saw the issue all the way through to completion. I travel allot and am never needy but I have never seen such a professional staff that takes care of minor details the way they do at the GB. I would definitely recommend them. I always stay there and will continue to do so. -dave

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best Hotel in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: finnygo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the majority of the Summer due to a work-related event. The hotel is beautiful and showcases impressive artwork, for which it is famous. The hotel staff holds no equal in Orlando and Central Florida: amazingly professional,outstanding, courteous, and intelligent ( Jennifer Newtown Foo, one of the managers of the hotel is a super star). The restaurant and the lobby bar are very sophisticated, and downright impressive. I will come back again and again and again. One of the best hotels, I have ever stayed in.- Fin

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Funky in Downtown O-town”
Reviews.Author: sarah2000
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando for a quick trip with friends. We wanted to avoid the typical Orlando tourist areas so we decided to stay at the Grand Bohemian. The hotel is very nice! There is no Disney / Sea World / Universal theme park, tourist feel to this place! There is a ton of interesting art work all around the hotel. The lobby is small yet comfortable. The rooms were spacious & quiet. The beds were very comfortable. We enjoyed the spa. Overall we had a relaxing & fun time at the Orlando Grand Bohemian!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but customer service was "off"”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to visit a friend for a few days this past weekend. It really is a beautiful hotel with beautiful amenities. The room was large and spacious, the pool area beautiful. I am lucky enough to have a job that affords me the opportunity to stay in hotels such as this one so I feel confident reviewing one of this level. The pool area: beautiful, but the water was so hot. I doubt there is anything that can be done in AUGUST in Orlando! The issues I had though were mainly customer service: 1) When I called to see when the bar at the pool was open, the front desk informed me "They don't really have a schedule. or at least not one they give to us." Odd. 2) I stayed for 4 nights. The first night we were awakened by an alarm going off in the room next door (alarm clock) at 5 AM. I called security who came up and shut it off. It happened again the next night. My friend called security and said this was the second time this had happened. It was shut off promptly. The third night it happened again, and I called downstairs, furious that they had simply been turning it off without TURNING IT OFF. That afternoon I asked the front desk to send someone up and sure enough, it was all set to happen again the next day. Unusual. 3) Upon check in, we were given a newsletter with an internet access code and informing us about the concierge lounge, "available to all" (was written verbatim in the newsletter). WHen we tried to visit it, our keys did not work and the front desk scolded us in front of other customers.. saying she'd let us in.. but it was very expensive.. and as they aren't really Marriott they can't honor these things. Being honest: I don't think I had enough points to qualify for the lounge, but given that I had been offered it, and it was in the paper they gave me, she made me feel like I owed her my firstborn for getting access and it was just condescending and incredibly rude. She should have just said no rather than schooling me in a public lobby adn telling me what a screw up her colleague was that had checked me in. The first rule of customer service is not to insult your colleagues, I thought. 4) The last night we headed downstairs for drinks only to see the lobby bar tented and loud renovations happening. I thought it was customary to be infomed upon checkin about these things happening. 5) We had the usual runaround with the minibar/stuff had accidentally been moved/the bar's electrical system was broken. The charges were removed promptly but not after being on hold for 15 minutes. In short, we had a lovely time. I would absolutely stay here again, but I would know to expect Courtyard Marriott customer service, not a four diamond property. And I would ask upon check in - have all alarms been turned off - when are renovations scheduled - will you be rescinding your offer of the concierge lounge -- and inform them, by the way, I will not touch the minibar and I'll BYOB with the pool bar. :)

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhkfreespirit
Reviews.Content: This is quite a unique hotel in that it makes you feel that you are staying in a "Beetlejuice" version of a hotel! Abstract paintings adorn every wall and there are dark macabre furniture and heavy fabrics throughout the hotel and restaurants. Your room has the same style but is also very clean,updated and comfortable. I would stay here again if I need to be in downtown Orlando....I just wish the surrounding area had more to do in the evenings since I can honestly say it is eerily deserted and quiet. (Beetlejuice theme is therefore quite appropriate for the hotel I guess!)

Reviews.Title: “stayed 11 straight weekends”
Reviews.Author: ddylan11
Reviews.Content: one of my favorite hotels and i travel quite a bit , there is really nothing to dislike here,although for the south the price is steep. i have stayed in both suites and regular rooms and both are exquisitely furnished,the most comfortable beds in the world the hotel is iwned or managed by a serious art collector and there are touches everywhere,from when you drive in the impressive equine statuary,to the kessler fine gallery,to even the magnifigant european piano in the bar.on another note the food is very good,the concierges the best in orlando and the bar on the 15th floor,only available to some has snacks every day including sometimes superb lamb chops,and all for free if i had to stay in orl for a month this would be it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, exceptional service, wonderful restaurant, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Caliente1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the area, and this was our second stay at the Grand Bohemian in Orlando. Our families and we stayed last year during our wedding weekend, and everyone raved about how beautiful and perfect the hotel was. This last weekend, my husband and I decided to have a weekend getaway to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We stayed two nights, three days. To begin with, the service is beyond exceptional at this hotel. Everyone, from the bellboy to the concierge to the housekeeping staff to the waitstaff at the restaurant, was more than kind and accommodating to our every need. A perfect example of the service provided by the staff at this hotel happened during our first night at the hotel. During dinner at the restaurant, one of the chefs actually came out to our table to clarify a special menu request I had. Aside from the quiet and romantic ambience at the restaurant, the food is wonderful as well!! The room we stayed in during our wedding weekend last year were very nice, but it was a suite with a jacuzzi tub in the room, so of course it would be nicer than a regular room! This weekend, in our regular room, I was not as impressed as I was with the suite. This room had some hairs on the floor around the toilet area, and the air conditioning in the room never seemed to get cool enough. We were on the top floor of the hotel, and it was a very hot weekend, but I would expect the room to be cooler. The thermostat had no way to be read, so we never knew what the temperature was in our room. The rest of that floor felt about the same temperature, but down on the first and fifth floor it was much cooler. Lastly, I want to talk about my visit to the spa. Being pregnant, I had some special requests during my visit, and I must say that I was highly impressed. I've had facials, massages, and prenatal massages all over the country, and I'd rank this massage and facial at the top of my list. My spa esthetician was Rhonda. She did an excellent job and I have never felt more relaxed! Another plus of this hotel is its location. It is within a few blocks (about 5-10 minutes walking) of many great restaurants, a huge movie theater, nightclubs and bars, and other entertainment. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an upscale hotel experience in downtown Orlando, and if you stay, you must visit the restaurant restaurant and spa too!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: MCTMCO
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Friendly front staff. We have stayed at these properties before and always impressed. Problem: room service. We came in late from a show at Amway Center and ordered dinner. They were out of pizza's, chocolate molten brownies and ice cream. So I ordered a club sandwich. We also ordered a Chef's salad and key lime pie. The club sandwich was terrible. It seems as though it was airport food it was cold (been stored in the refrigerator), the bread was not toasted and fries were cold. The chefs salad was dismal, it came with no dressing, and wasn't worth calling back for. I can't imagine they would have made a "fresh" one, just another from the fridge. The key lime pie (mind you we are in Florida) was awful. Not fresh, not tasty, and just bad. I always stay positive, but for $42, I am appalled. Otherwise, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel ans staff! Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: lauridav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here despite that friends had chosen a lesser priced hotel nearby. We wanted to be a little indulgent. I made two pre-arrival telephone calls, both times helped by Joseph who was very polite, helpful and knowledgeable, requesting early arrival, mini- fridge, and late checkout, he noted our reservation and made me feel as if he was HAPPY to help. A rare thing these days! Upon arrival, same helpful attitude from valet, front desk, and bellman, who also gave us all kinds of information about the hotel on the way to our room, which was a kind upgrade as well. George in guest relations was over the top in helping us with the room, as well as a assistance with directions. The hotel is gorgeous, decorated impecably, and the art is everywhere. It was like staying in a gallery. Everywhere you look there is a beautiful or interesting view. (Actually, we are still at the hotel despite that I began my review in the past tense.) I do not write reviews usually but felt that I must in this particular instance. Thank you to all the excellent staff, bar none, and to Kessler and Marriott for one of my very best hotel stays. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL NEVER BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest48
Reviews.Content: First we were told we did not have a reservation. A couple of minutes later they said they found it. Then they said our room was not ready at check-in time ( 4PM). We asked for a reason, they just simply said the room has not been cleaned and etc... Remind you it was 4PM. Asked for a manager to speak with, and she wouldn't even come out to talk for 10minutes. How unprofessional! Of course she did not have any explanation for the room not ready for us. The $350 Suite was not even a nice room either. Oh and I could hear someone's pet barking so loudly in entire hallway. Will never stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for business in Orlando. I was ready to give the hotel a perfect score, but then I had an incident with my bill that upset me very greatly and was ready to downgrade the score. After letting a little time pass, I got over the extreme anger and was able to objectively give the hotel very high marks. First, I will go over the many good points. The hotel is located right downtown and is in walking distance to a number of bars and restaurants. The lobby is wonderfully appointed. The hotel has a tremendous "art" theme on every single floor and even has its own gallery. The art work was great throughout the whole hotel including the rooms. The front desk staff was friendly and knowledgeable. I had a king bed room and it was plenty large with a pretty large bathroom as well. The bathroom had dual shower-heads. The room had a large flat screen TV and a CD of cool music playing when I walked in. The bed was very comfortable. There was a large, extended sitting chair. The concierge lounge was very nicely appointed and the snacks/breakfast were just fine. The outdoor pool area was very nice on the 6th floor of the hotel and the fitness room was nice as well with ellipticals, treadmills, nautilus and free weights. The valet brought cars quickly. Now for the very few "bad" things. A relatively minor issue was that the air conditioning temperature control was one of those old style controls with no digital display and you just put in on cool with hi or low fan. Even with it on cool and "hi", it was not cool enough in the room for my taste. Such a nice hotel should have a more modern temperature control. The real "bad" thing was looking at my bill in the morning. I was extremely surprised to see charge after charge after charge after charge for perhaps 15 items from the mini-bar. I did not consume a single item from the mini-bar. The only thing I had done was take out two waters from the minibar and put in two small diet coke bottles for the night. I replaced the waters in the morning. After I got the bill, I went back and noticed for the first time a small sticker on the door of the minibar indicating that items would be charged automatically when removed. As indicated, all I removed were the water bottles. In the process, I had knocked over some beer bottles inside the minibar and simply straightened them out right away. They never left the cooler. Yet, they were all still on this bill. This "automatic" billing minibar has to be one of the worst pieces of hotel technology I have ever seen. It clearly did not work right. I have to believe the hotel has received many, many complaints about it. Their "stated" purpose of not having items removed to store other items is understandable, but the technology just doesn't work right and caused me much grief and anger. I called the front desk. They did quickly agree to remove the items, but I have not seen my adjusted bill yet to verify it was done. I didn't need that hassle. So, with the exception of those few things, the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Try the Courtyard at lake lucern”
Reviews.Author: RobAiers
Reviews.Content: I have to say as a seasoned world traveler how disappointing and expensive my 1 night stay was at the "Grand" Bohemian. If grand means expensive its right on the money. If grand means special it certain the was not, tap hanging off the lounge sink lights not working properly, so much so that I could not see to iron in my $380 a night suite. A quick phone call however made not the slightest difference man came did nothing. I moved to a small country type Courtyard at lake lucern a couple of blocks away 75 bucks a nigh incl breakfast and head and shoulders above the Bohemian who didn''t even ask how my stay was. You do the sums!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sr_Atlanta2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in June for business. I found the staff from the time I walked in till I checked out to be very helpful. The hotel is very nicely decorated with lots of art everywhere (part of their theme) my room was a very roomy (king bed) with a very of the pool. It was my first visit to downtown Orlando (have stayed in the Disney and convention center areas previously). Downtown Orlando was a pleasant surprise with plenty of nice bars and restaurants and the Grand Bohemian made it a great visit!.

Reviews.Title: “Awe-inspiring!”
Reviews.Author: bambi101
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit, I tried to get a room at the last minute a few weeks prior too….but no luck. This time we had reservations, the journey from the lobby to the room was a pleasant one! Fine art awaits you in a very chic atmosphere. I ordered room service which was wonderful and then enjoyed a Triple Venti Mocha at their Starbucks the following morning. I am looking forward to my return, from Atlanta!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business venue”
Reviews.Author: man44a
Reviews.Content: I visited Grand Bohemian for a business conference on site. Rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The conference areas were well equipped, comfortable with good acoustics. All in all an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Downton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StartingOurTravels
Reviews.Content: The Grand Bohemian in downtown Orlando is gorgeous. It has a rooftop pool which is amazing and being only a few city blocks from all the action downtown can't be beat. The room was really clean and the bed was very comfortable, and my son slept well in the crib that was brought to the room. The front desk staff was also very helpful and nice. The only thing I didn't like and this is very minor is that the mini fridge in the room was full of the items that would be charged to the room. It would be nice to at least leave half the fridge available for use, we had nowhere to keep my son's milk cold during our stay, which was a pretty big inconvenience having to keep it on ice the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “best romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Fl0ridab0y
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little hard to find near Church Street Entertainment area. The hotel is small with spa, gym, pool, restaurant and bar. The rooms are fair in size but nicely decorated. The downside is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: YaraFernandez
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Grand Bohemian Hotel in Orlando and we had an excellent experience. The front desk staff are VERY polite and helpful. The room was very spacious and clean. The bed and pillows were fabulous. The food was excellent. Overall we had a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I have ever visited.”
Reviews.Author: nutrigator
Reviews.Content: I hosted a business meeting in Orlando for colleagues from across the country. The staff at teh Grand Bohemian are professional and the service is excellent. They exceeded my expectations and made sure all fo our needs were met throughout our whole stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious stay in th Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, needs to improve customer service”
Reviews.Author: kisbel23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 days in April and then 3 days first week in May and I must say it's absolutely a gorgeous luxurious hotel with amazing pieces of art work, great bar and rooftop pool!!!!! However, the customer services at the front desk was very poor both times. Personnel at the front desk are not welcoming or inviting. The woman who checked me in, although, respectful, was not friendly or helpful, did not offer me help with my luggage and when I asked her for help she looked dumb-founded. Usually when I check in at a hotel, the front desk will quickly go over all the amenities the hotel has to offers and ask if I have any questions, not this front desk. The evening staff were much better but I wouldn’t has great. Luckily, valet staff were amazingly friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, great artwork, nice rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: carolynvm
Reviews.Content: Our stay got off to a bad start when the front desk said it had no record of our reservation. I had booked our room on the hotel's website, but had apparently missed a button at the very bottom of the page to click and confirm. The clerk said that happened often - well, if that's the case maybe they should change the reservation page. Anyway the rate I was given at the hotel was more expensive than the on-line rate I had gotten, but what was I supposed to do?? The room itself was quite large and very clean. We ordered lunch to be delivered to the pool. That was a mistake - the food was mediocre and cost $70 for 2 sandwiches and bottles of water. We should have gone to the deli across the street! The pool was lovely but does get a bit shady beginning about 3:00pm. The hotel was very cool, funky and hip - filled with art everywhere which was great! It is in the heart of downtown with restaurants and a movie theater nearby, however it's not close to the theme parks. If my travels bring me back to downtown Orlando again I would definitely stay at the Grand Bohemian!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well-managed hotel in heart of downtown Orlando”
Reviews.Author: SeattletravellerUW
Reviews.Content: We stayed three night at the Grand Bohemian while attending a two-day conference at the hotel. We had an amazing experience and the hotel is absolutely beautiful. We took a red-eye flight and got to thehotel at 8 am the day we were supposed to check in. The front desk agent was so helpful and arranged for us to check in to our room early which definitely made our day as we were so tired from our flight. We were so pleased with the comfort and cleanliness of the room and loved the plush robes and the beds are extremely comfortable. The pool area is absolutely beautiful and everything was decorated nicely and so well done. Everyone at the hotel could not have been nicer, including the valets and restaurant staff. When the battery in our TV remote ran out we called the front desk and were brought a replacement remote right away. We had our car retrieved four separate times and each time the valet was very speedy and polite. I loved the location and everything inside the hotel as well as the neighborhood surrounding was so clean and we felt safe. While my husband attended the conference the concierge gave me a running map and I explored the surrounding area including Lake Eola which was a cute park with geese and ducks and a great three-mile run. There is a Publix grocery store about half a mile away where we purchased bottled water and fruit. I ate breakfast and lunchw with my husband at the conference and the food was very delicious, and the staff was very polite and efficient. We also had the Sunday brunch which was very pricey but good. It you want to splurge I'd say go for it. We went to Universal Studios one day and it was about a 20 minute drive, so I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you're wanting to go to the amusement parks but if you have business in downtown Orlando, this place cannot be beat. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ycullen5
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in downtown Orlando and couldnt have been happier with my hotel selection when I selected Grand Bohemian.
