Unfortunately we were only able to stay one night, but it was such a wonderful short stay. The agents at the desk were so friendly and accommodating, Tyler and Sean. They gave us a beautiful room with a georgeous view of the city. The room was spacious, comfortable, plush, and exceptionally clean. That evenening we went to a show but stopped at the lobby bar afterward, where we were taken care of like royalty by Megan and Obrad. They made us feel so special and at home at the same time. I believe any hotel can have beautiful fixtures and decor, but having staff that really know how to take care of their guests is priceless. Great job to the management at Grand Bohemian for selecting some of the best staff I have ever come across. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “It's like visiting a European art gallery, then retiring to the highest quality Hotel Room you can immagine”
Reviews.Author: andrecrisp
Reviews.Content: When my driver pulled into the vallet area, the art popped immediately. The beautiful decor really made me feel comfortable and I said to myself..."I like the new Orlando"! Walking into the entry, I was welcomed by amazing, world-class wall-art and life-size sculpture art. Truly reminded me of being in Florance or Rome...except higher end. When I went into the Hotel room the Bose stereo in the room was playing the "Kessler Lounge Collection" CD...VERY nice touch! The bed, AMAZING...the size of the standard King room, very spacious. The bar downstairs, very high end...great vibe, full of people until past midnight, great crowd. Highly recommend this amazing hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and a feast for the eyes!”
Reviews.Author: stlanne
Reviews.Content: This landmark hotel offers luxury and a fabulous art collection from the moment you walk through the doors! There is a vibe here that emanates fun and sophistication . It is also whimsical and charming! The room was perfect - the color palette sophisticated and comfortable. I loved the brown tones and black woodwork and purple chaise.The bathroom had the BEST shower = two shower heads and high end hair products. The bed was very comfortable. NO outside noise. WE loved it - we only stayed one night here but would come back and visit next time in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “We found another guest in our room...”
Reviews.Author: JennyRuthM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Valentine's weekend for a quick getaway. We had wanted to stay here during our honeymoon, but couldn't, so we were very much looking forward to this stay. The hotel was gorgeous, though the staff seemed a little pretentious and inexperienced. Unfortunately, when we got up to our room, we encountered a man already in there! We had to trek all the way back down to the front desk, wait in line again, and explain the situation. The staff did not apologize, but rather said that they didn't know how it could be possible and blamed it on the man in our room. In my opinion, it should not have been possible for both us and him to have a working key to the same room if the staff and system were organized. I would never expect this from the Grand Bohemian! Soon after we got settled into our new room, we were interrupted by a hotel manager, who thought that this room was unoccupied still! We then received a phone call asking for our last name because they didn't know who was in which room. The staff didn't seem to know what was going on in their own hotel at all. Three days after our stay we also found out that the hotel had not put our breakfast check on our travel gift card as requested. They did fix the situation over the phone, but yet again, failed to even apologize! The staff would say, "it's our pleasure to fix this" as if they were doing us a service instead of owning up for their mistakes. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up to Grand Bohemian in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: LesLee_11
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st Grand Bohemian/Kessler Collection Hotel experience. This hotel has a cool, hip, old hollywood vibe. The decor and art collections were outstanding; staff was helpful; and valet parking (although an additional charge) essential for a number of reasons. The Sunday brunch was delightful as well. In addition, the Concierge Lounge was a definite bonus. The only compliant I have is that even though we had late checkout and were still in our room (THANKFULLY WE WERE DRESSED), housekeeping staff entered our room without knocking. Although she apologized saying she didn't have our room listed as a late check-out, this had the potential for being a real embarassement for all parties involved. Please let your housekeeping staff know to knock and wait BEFORE entering (even if room is not listed on the "late-checkout list") - No matter - I STILL give Grand Bohemian Hotel Orlando 5-stars

Reviews.Title: “The hotel promises more than it can deliver.”
Reviews.Author: Jacckkii
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and efficient. Upon entering our room we were pleased, but once settled the imperfections were apparent. Our "heavenly" headboard was cracked and peeling, and the sheets had that burnt smell I've so often experienced in hotels. Comfort of the bed was spot on however. Food is delicious, but we had one of the rudest waitresses during cocktails and appetizers Saturday night. It was loud in the bar (and fun), but when we politely asked our server about a third appetizer she actually snapped responded with "I don't have 3 hands so you'll have to wait". Our party is nothing buy nice and down to earth people so everyone was pretty shocked. It seemed that all of the wait staff had a bit of attitude. The tv in our room was and older set, other friends staying at the hotel commented that they had a flat screen in their room. All in all our stay was pleasant, but I couldn't help but think that the grand bohemian website description is a bit fabricated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with hidden fees...”
Reviews.Author: MoonBeam2011
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is in the heart of downtown Orlando. The art and decor are lovely and the staff is friendly, however I don't think I would revisit. Not recommended for families with children and if you plan on going to the parks, this is not a good location. We did not have either of those, but just as a side note for those considering. Also, we were charged a "Room Tax" and also a "Lodging Tax" (I'd never heard of a place charging both...what's the difference?). We also ordered room service and we were charged a $5 room service fee PLUS an additional 22% automatic gratuity. The couch in our room, though beautiful, had stains. This is a visually gorgeous hotel, but not really worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay, Boheme restaurant was awful”
Reviews.Author: deeriver
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews, but since I am platinum status with Marriott, had a bad experience, and never heard back from the manager, I thought I would have my say on this forum. First the positive. The hotel is centrally located in Orlando. The Starbucks attached to the hotel is really nice, and there are some restaurant options within walking distance from the hotel. The rooms were clean and the maid service was top notch. Valet guys were great, and the general vibe of the hotel was fun. We had a room overlooking the pool. Although the pool was small, it was big enough for a quick dip and the lounge chairs around the pool looked nice. I went to the fitness room and thought it was a touch better than a Marriott Courtyard fitness room, thus, it was a let down. Now the bad. I had breakfast at the main restaurant on Sunday morning. We were seated at 930am and a grumpy, out of it, lady came walking by and said good morning. She managed to serve the two gentlemen sitting across from us quickly, but did not bother with us. By 945a, I had to get up and ask the bus boy for coffee. 10a, no coffee. I got up again and asked the bus boy. Got the coffee. 1010ish, no orders taken for food. I had to get up and walked almost into the kitchen to get someone. Finally, 1030a, got our hot food. You get the picture. It was so awful that I should have left, but I was too stubborn. This experience was bad enough, that I don't think I will return to this property. The crew at this breakfast could give two you know whats and, when I complained, it's apparent that the management could give a crap. Not sure if it's the recession that has taken the spark out of the staff or if they are complete idiots with poor training? Not sure. Overall, solid if you have business in downtown Orlando. Not worth it if you have business in the convention areas. Avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Superb”
Reviews.Author: newyork3476
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Bohemain 2 weeks ago and it was an amazing visit! Valet was professional and trustworthy thanks to John. I loved that front desk always knew my name and had a smile on their faces. James from front desk made sure i was taken care of to the fullest. The food was excellent and addicting. I also stopped by the new spa they have and i just loved my massage from Pam, she was a breathe of fresh air and Sabrina made sure i was relaxed and taken care of at all times with warm tea and a hot neck wrap. Housekeeping made my room feel like home and it's not easy to do that when you travel around alot. I also loved the decor and all the music they had playing. Point blank if your a avid travler, then stay here for a superb stay that will have you coming back for more!

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Alessia67
Reviews.Content: Service was impeccable - the front desk were incredibly helpful on various issues. Valet service was extremely efficient and everyone working in the hotel was pleasant and friendly. Rooms wereabove average for a US hotel and the bed was very comfortable with wonderful sheets, duvets and pillows. Overall the hotel was clean and quiet. Great location - close to several bars and restaurants in the downtown area, yet only minutes from the Mall at Milennia and other places where you may wish to shop. Thankfully doesn't feel like an Orlando hotel as no evidence of Mickey Mouse anywhere! The artwork around the hotel and in the gallery is superb. Enjoyed my stay thoroughly and will be back again next month with my boyfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Hairs in Bathroom and a phone that doesnt work”
Reviews.Author: businesstravel72703
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Sunday, November 28th around 5pm to the Grand Bohemian Hotel. After a long wait in line, I finally got to check in. Fortunately I was second in line, as the line was 6 people deep, with only one front desk clerk on duty. I called downstairs at 6:30 pm and informed them that their was a long black hair on the shelf in my tub, and a long brown hair on the back of the tub. Also my phone did not work. I ask them to fix the problem whenever I left the hotel at 7 pm for dinner. On my way out I stopped at the front desk to let them know I was leaving. Upon my return at 8:55 I was very disappointed to see that they phone was fixed, but the bathroom had not been touched.Since there was not a manager on duty, I had to wait until the night manager came to work. He called at 9:10 and offered to pay for my one cocktail at the bar and a free breakfast. I refused. At 9:15 we agreed he would send someone to clean the bathroom. 20 mins later he arrived. We enough towels for 5 people and to clean the bathroom. NIght Manager, Joe, didnt care at all. I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Orlando”
Reviews.Author: tarheeljd
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Great atmosphere and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great time all around”
Reviews.Author: Pammiem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for the weekend to this hotel for our anniversary. The hotel was top notch, we have travelled a lot all around the world and it takes a lot to impress us. We were happy to find that the same food served in the restaurant could be ordered at the bar, so we could eat casually. The food was fabulous. My husband had the prime rib, and I had the cold meat and cheese plate. The bartender, Ivy, knows her stuff, and is friendly and funny. All of the staff was courteous and would go out of their way to help. The only downside of this hotel is that it is very well sound insulated. We were on the 15th floor, the conceirge floor, and I could hear the traffic on the roadway below, not something I've encountered before, even in the hotels in Manhattan. There were also people hanging out in the hallways on our floor, laughing, talking and slamming doors till 4 in the morning. If you are a light sleeper, or need a good nights rest, this may not be the place for you. I would have been upset if I would have had to get up early for business the next day without a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Okay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: citybeagle
Reviews.Content: Work brought me to Orlando, and this was recommended to me as a more upscale place to stay downtown. The decor is pretty funky; lots of bold, dark colors, artwork on the walls, a random skeleton. The staff was really nice, and the bar and restaurant were good, too. There's a small outdoor pool on the sixth floor. That said, my room was pretty average. Not too big and a little dated; I expected more for the price and the grand looking entrance downstairs, but would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Your eyes will pop out seeing the walls of art, art and more art!”
Reviews.Author: bagsalwayspacked
Reviews.Content: Intro We were shocked to find such a lovely hotel in Orlando, which is known for its theme parks and not for cultural attributes. We dreaded the long trip by car because in previous stays, also for business, all we remembered was the terrible traffic in that area and the lack of activities that interested us. Finding this hotel on the Marriott website made it easy to get a room, and our trip was memorable for the right reasons this time. The Room While my husband attended a meeting in downtown Orlando, we stayed in room 720, a large corner suite, on Wednesday and Thursday nights earlier this month. Throughout this art-themed hotel, the walls are covered with interesting pieces of art , and the colors of the furnishings add to the artsy decor. The light brown walls and heavy purple drapes and furniture were quite pleasant in our room, which was very well laid out with a large living room for working and watching TV. (See photo) As bright and sunny as it usually in Orlando, closing the thick curtains and dimming the light should provide a respite from the summer heat. The only downsides in the room were that it was a bit dark at night and we could not remove items from the minibar fridge and cool the foods we preferred, such as Diet Dr. Pepper and yogurt. (So we left them in our ice chest and just changed the ice twice a day.) The king bed was pleasantly comfortable considering we sleep on a Tempurpedic foam mattress at home. There is a lot of typical city noise outside…sirens, cars, trains, etc., because you are in the middle of a city. So it is a transition for us coming from a very quiet neighborhood where the major sounds are loud birds squawking in the backyard. But the thick drapes help insulate from the city noise as does the i-Pod music player. And we always carry something to help us sleep in big cities. Breakfast in the Upstairs Lounge The food was tasty and well displayed in the small lounge, which was too crowded at times to get a table. The servers were first class, and the atmosphere was relaxing. We also enjoyed visiting the Lounge in the evening. The Pool and Gym It was too windy to use the lovely outdoor pool (see photo) with a beautiful cabana and you guessed it, more outstanding sculpture! In good weather, this would be a nice place to park yourself and a friend for a relaxing day. The gyn looked just okay, but I was too busy beading to use it. The Value We normally spend under $120. per night for business travel rooms at various Marriott properties; this hotel provided good value and a first class experience. After searching a bit online, we took the lowest available rate on Marriott’s site and paid $200. per night plus tax. Weekend nights appear to be more expensive. It was wonderful receiving Marriott points for our stay because that is why we can take long vacations in countries where there are Marriotts. Also the letter welcoming us to the hotel was a nice touch, but they really butchered my husband’s strange name even though our reservation was made through Marriott online with the correct spelling. The Art Wow! We loved looking at the art gallery and paintings throughout the hotel. We understand that the owner ran out of wall space and home and had to build a hotel to house the rest of his collection. In an hour of gawking and taking photos of the art, I managed to view less than half of the walls before getting dizzy, or should I say high on art! There are very few art-themed hotels, especially of the 12 story size. We stayed in the art-themed Renaissance Arts in New Orleans just before Katrina and enjoyed being surrounded by art there as well. It is wonderful that original artists have a built in audience in rare hotels like this one. The gallery on the main floor offers many colorful works for sale. Restaurant The high point of our stay was dinner in the Bohemia restaurant on the main floor. Everything was perfect about the meal from the menus that were backlit to the crab ravioli and grilled romaine lettuce. Nanna from Armenia was our server, and she did a first class job meeting our needs. The prices were reasonable considering the quality of everything, and it was easy spending the evening in the hotel after being out all day. It was fun before entering the restaurant to listen to the Bosendorfer piano being played so passionately. (There is a second Bosendorfer upstairs between the meeting rooms.) We did not stop in the bar for a drink, but it looked inviting as well. Many folks have told us that the hotel’s Sunday buffet is outstanding. Very Minor Issues We really enjoyed our stay at this fine hotel. Our main complaint was that when we called enroute from Daytona, the hotel operator gave us the wrong exit off of I-4, and there is no such thing. Exit 83 was closed, so that was no help. We had to drive around a bit to find the place after taking the next exit. Our GPS was not in the rental car with us, and there was not time to find the exit on my iPhone after we realized the exit they gave us was wrong. Also the letter welcoming us to the hotel was a nice touch, but they really butchered my husband’s strange name even though our reservation was made through Marriott online with the correct spelling. What to do in the Orlando area The last day of our stay, I drove just a few miles from downtown Orlando to Winter Park, the home of the Morse Museum, which houses the largest collection of Louis Tiffany work. This place is a must see especially after February 2011 when their new addition is complete. We have seen Tiffany pieces in many museums all over, but none have such quality and breadth. The gift shop offers a great selection of art books and Motawi tile. This museum is at the top of our list when we return to Orlando. For lunch there are plenty of fine restaurants in the downtown area. We did not have time to see the museum at Rollins College nor the Henry Leu Gardens, but will check see them on our return. If you enjoy making beaded items, there is a wonderful shop, the Bead Bar, a few miles from the hotel. If you are driving from the Daytona area, you can also stop at Imagine That!, my favorite US bead store, just east of I-95 in Ormond Beach. Beading is a wonderful way to relax while on vacation, and you end up having some nice, custom jewelry to wear home. Just beware that your friends will demand that you make jewelry for them as well! Summary We will return to this hotel when we return to Orlando. We despise most things related to theme parks, and this hotel allowed us to forget that Disney is/was Orlando. The hotel makes you feel as if you are in a grown up city, not one that focuses on fun for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic, fun, artsy!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine34467
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Fun location. Eclectic art collection. Great service. Good food. Really nice spa. Excellent treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Now this is what a hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: Surely_U_Jest
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem. The hotel impressed from the moment we were greeted by the valet, to the time our luggage was back in the car. Front desk staff was perfectly attentive. The food in the restaurant was superb. Go ahead, order the meatloaf. It was amazing. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The decor is Versace-ish with original art throughout the hotel. There are no kids, or if there were, they had good parents! Sure enjoy the theme parks like we did, but treat yourself right and escape back into this adult world. Relax by the awesome pool, hang out in the bar or enjoy surprising nightlife nearby. It is well worth the short drive and easy to get to. In my view this is Orlando's finest hotel at any price and I have stayed at several. It is the anti-Disney. Let me share one experience to give you a sense of how the staff performs. I called down to inquire about where I could get a New York Times. The concierge was apologetic that no more were available, they only had Wall Street Journal's left, but offered to go across the lobby to the adjoining Starbucks to see if they had them. I told her that wasn't necessary, that I was going to grab a coffee later anyway and thanked her for the information. I did go to Starbucks's and they did have the paper. I stopped by the concierge on my way up to the pool to grab one of the WSJ's she mentioned and there on the corner of the desk was a NYT with my name on it. When she realized that I had in fact purchased one, she apologized for my trouble and without hesitation went to petty cash and reimbursed me for it. WOW. This hotel understands that it truly is the little things and attention to detail that separate the wannabes from the real thing. They deserve your business.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Bohemian Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: KCORLANDO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in a private ceremony in Negril, Jamaica, this July. We wanted to celebrate our happiness with friends and family by hosting a reception stateside. On September 3rd, we had a cocktail reception at the Orlando Museum of Art. As a treat, we booked a room at the Grand Bohemian for the night of the reception. Firstly, the hotel is gorgeous. Secondly, the service is first class. Our room was well appointed, comfortable and luxurious. Though we live in the Orlando area, we would definitely return to the Grand Bohemian for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay but ...”
Reviews.Author: trollafdf
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the comfort of the bed and the suite was roomy enough to not be cramped. The valet and front desk staff were wonderful and we appreciated their help and service. The pool area was closed on the day of our arrival for a wedding which was an irritation. Drunken guests in the elevator and no evening dip for us. The housekeeping staff was in my opinion thoughtless. While our supply of coffee was refilled only 3 creamers were provided and no artificial sweetener was left for us (If we used it once don't you think we might use it again). It is certainly a minor thing but when I had to get dressed and go to the concierge lounge for cream and sweetener when I didn't want to... something minor becomes larger. One used glass was replaced and the other one left dirty behind the water filled ice bucket. I guess we didn't get a clean one because??? No big deal I can wash a glass but again, I didn't want to. Breakfast in the consierge lounge was nothing special...heavy on carbs and low on protein like most hotels. The art was lovely but not enough of an attraction to recommend this hotel. All in all we slept in comfort however I prefer to use the ameneties at a hotel and not have them rented out and even a 2 star will refill the coffee condiments. I would recommend the hotel for the security and the comfort. I am spoiled and appreciate the finer details...I don't see this as being a first pick hotel on our future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Elegant Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lifesbeachy116
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a girls trip to Orlando. You can't beat this hotel's location, which is right in the heart of downtown Orlando. Their rooms are absolutely beautiful and take care every creature comfort. The bed was heavenly- a fantastic night sleep. The pool is located on the 5th floor and is very posh and relaxing. The Sunday morning brunch is an event all it's own! Wow! This is a great location to enjoy the downtown atmosphere. Definitely worth the visit!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, excellent service and yet unpretentious!”
Reviews.Author: TampaTravelingGal
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here this past weekend for a weekend getaway from nearby Tampa in a jacuzzi suite on the 6th floor. We have stayed in a variety of hotels and whether it is 5 star or 2 star, it always boils down to service for us. From the moment we pulled in for valet, service was anything but less than outstanding minus the "hoity, toity" nature of some 4-5 star hotels. I had requested early check-in online and did not run into any difficulties when arriving half hour early prior to the 3pm check in time. While I had requested to be on a high floor, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the fitness center and the pool was on our floor and the ice machine was within a few steps of our room 617. Check-in MAYBE took 2 minutes at best and checking out was even less. Everyone including the bartenders in the lounge are friendly and made great recommendations for us on wine and appetizers. Our room was beautiful and clean. There was a free concert being held on Saturday night across the street and so the music could definitely be heard and the intersection closed off and drew much foot traffic, but it was shut down at about 10pm or so and didn't bother us since we were headed out for the night ourselves well past that time anyways. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and bars and great people-watching to do. We were on foot the whole weekend and walked around Thornton Park and up and down Orange Ave, trying out different restaurants and doing some light shopping in local boutiques. We will definitely be back! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Disaster”
Reviews.Author: woodley3
Reviews.Content: I blocked a large amount of rooms for my daughter's wedding five months in advance. I confirmed the arrangements several months later and was told not all the rooms had been reserved. Again, reserved the amount of rooms needed. When I received the confirmations, again they were incorrect. I spoke to the manager who assigned Jennifer to assist me. She was wonderful and asked for a list of guest's names to assign to each room. I sent her an email and then hand delivered the information. When I met her, I was notified she was now the restaurant mgr but would still help me. Several days before the wedding I delivered "welcome bags" for each of our guests to receive upon check-in. The person at the front desk took them in the back and stated each of our guests would get one. Day before the wedding one guest had to wait an hour before they were given a room. The bride and groom were both suppose to each have a suite with an adjoining room for the groomsmen and bridesmaids. There was no room for the bridesmaids and the groomsmen were down the hall. The "welcome bags" were never given out until the grooms mother asked about them an hour before the wedding. The night of the wedding the couple stayed in the brides suite which I had asked to be cleaned, it was not done and as a gift from the hotel for their " troubles" a bottle of champagne and strawberries were put on a dirty table. I was also charged $90 for that kind gesture. All the problems were becoming a joke and some of my guests left and went to another hotel in the city. When I contacted the manager about all the problems, she kept saying "how do you think I feel", I could care less how she felt! My family and I will never stay at the Grand Bohemian again!!! I travel alot for my job and I have to say it was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! One bright note - the manager credited the $90 when I brought it to her attention (saw the $90 charge on my credit card statement). If you have a large party, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Art Museum and Hotel all in one!”
Reviews.Author: VJWIndy
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel, featuring stunning artwork throughout the hotel. Our room was a suite format, which was perfect for our infant. The room and bathrooms were sizeable. The hotel is located about 15 minute walk from a city lake and cool neighborhood. We wanted to stay away from the Disney crowd and experience what it was like to actually live in Orlando and this hotel's location actually allows this. The restaurant was on the first floor was excellent. An unexpected benefit was that the Dallas Mavericks were staying at the hotel for a game against the Magic and Dirk Nowitski stayed two doors down from us! Pretty cool. If it's good enough for the Mavs, this hotel is good enough for you. The only downside is that the pool is small and the pool area is shaded most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Suite in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: hcraigr
Reviews.Content: If you haven't stayed at the Grand Bohemian in a while, it is well worth another visit. We stayed at the Grand Bohemian shortly after it's original opening and experienced their opening jitters. When we were to visit friends in Orlando this time, we wanted to try the hotel out again. Marriott just took them under their wing and with points, we stayed in the Spa Suite. The room was way cool. It was well worth the upgrade to the spa suite. The hotel is a short walk to many good restaurants and is conveniently located in the Downtown area. If you haven't stayed, give it a try. If you haven't stayed since it was incorporated into the Autograph Collection, please try them again. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Classy, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leigherton
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the Grand Bohemian Hotel, Orlando from August 16 - 19, 2010. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. We were greeted warmly by the exceptional valet staff who took good car of our two cars. Our check in was quick and proficient. This hotel is arranged by art and sculpture pieces, greatly planned out. When we arrived in our room on the 8th floor, it was very warm and did not cool - when we called to have a member of the maintenance staff, they found the A/C motor was not working. We were promptly given another room with a wonderful bonus (free access to the Executive Lounge on the 15th floor). This was a wonderful surprise - where we enjoyed great snacks, breakfasts and cold drinks and water. Great fitness area and pool area - very classy! The room was beautifully appointed and the housekeeping staff were exceptional. Can't wait to go back to the Grand Bohemian Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional all around!”
Reviews.Author: cath_cat77
Reviews.Content: I had a spectacular experience. This hotel is superb! The lobby is very chic and welcoming, the martini bar on the first floor is comfortable and hip. The rooms are super clean, and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience - Beautiful hotel, comfortable room, superior service”
Reviews.Author: db3737
Reviews.Content: The Grand Bohemian is a beautiful, sophisticated hotel focused around a wonderful art collection. It is located in downtown Orlando close to the local nightlife. The bar and restaurant in the hotel are very nice as well (try the Sunday brunch!). Our room was big and comfortable with a very comfy bed. It is the perfect hotel for a romantic interlude or for a wedding reception (we had our wedding reception here several years ago - it was fantastic!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Orlando nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: mightaswellbaby
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a mini-vacation (I live locally) in Orlando one weekend, and stayed at the Grand Bohemian on a Saturday night. The location is *perfect* if you plan to hit the bars and clubs around Orange Ave. The lobby and bar are uniquely styled - not exactly my style (I find the artwork a little creepy), but the "Bohemian" theme is well carried out. Rooms are spacious and the bed was exceptionally comfortable! Front desk and guest services personnel were friendly and attentive. My biggest complaint - given my plan for a relaxing Sunday morning after a night out - is it was *impossible* to relax at the pool! The pool area is nicer than the average urban rooftop pool - beautiful decor, surprisingly little street noise. There is a large canopied area with tables and chairs to stay out of the sun, and several lounge chairs around the edge of the deck - in my opinion, not enough chairs. After just a few people arrived at the people, it began to feel very crowded (and once one of them started smoking, it was impossible to avoid the smoke...a big deal to me, but it may not bother others). The space might be more comfortable if the canopy was smaller and the chairs were more spread out, but that would apparently interfere with events such as weddings. Which leads to THE WEDDING PLANNERS! I was already not feeling totally comfortable at the pool when a troupe of VERY loud, VERY obnoxious wedding planners showed up and began marching around the pool deck, shouting orders at each other, completely oblivious to the people trying to relax inches away (literally - one of them bumped my feet as she walked past, and didn't even acknowledge it). I was so disgusted that I packed up and left. Bottom line - the hotel is comfortable, clean, and in a great location for Orlando business or nightlife, but not for relaxing at the pool - not even early on a Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: BaileyBird
Reviews.Content: THe hotel was great. Beautiful and stylish, not to mention comfortable. The staff was very helpful in resolving an unexpected problem. Downtown location is very convenient for business or pleasure purposes. Delicious room service. All for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....beautifully appointed hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: luckylex_10
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable time at the Grand Bohemian........the care and consideration given to the rooms by the housekeeping staff was really appreciated........they were on top of everything. We will surely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Circumstances; Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: econ11
Reviews.Content: The Grand Bohemian is my hotel in Orlando. Service is always excellent. Accommodations are opulent, restaurant offerings succulent, and the gallery is a fascinating, unique addition. This last trip was exceptional. Having neglected to pack a neck tie for my MCO meetings I headed for the gallery only to find it had closed for the night. I approached Concierge-extraordinaire Patricia Clifton for assistance. Through some devious means (I am, of course kidding about that description), Ms Clifton managed to acquire a display case key to access an elegant tie that saved my entire business trip. I have visited perhaps half of the Kessler collection hotels. Each has been excellent. Orlando remains my favorite, and a big part of that is because of the over-the-top personal service.

Reviews.Title: “I usually stay here automatically but next time...”
Reviews.Author: SevenSees
Reviews.Content: I have to confess I'm checking out the competition. I wind up in Orlando a few times a year either on business or for triathlons. I agree with all of the recent reviews. The worn rooms, the nickel and diming over other hotel charges, wedding rentals, etc. I don't use the concierge at this location but I see that the hours are limited by their lack of presence, the décor that hits you over the head etc. With one exception, I feel the Orlando area has a lot of authentic things to offer in particular the nearby old Orlando neighborhoods! They are within walking distance or a very short cab ride. The staff is also very helpful. There can also be interesting guests at this hotel... not the typical Disney visitors. Love the gym, bar, food, the bed linens and the roof top pool scene. I am happy with this hotel and will probably be back but my loyalty is faltering. So bottom line, I'm ready to look around and do some homework on my next Orlando visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travelers... But”
Reviews.Author: Bohemia123
Reviews.Content: If i was coming to downtown orlando for business i would stay here. However, i came for a weekend with my husband and i found that the downtown location was not conveniant to parks and other active locations. Parking is awful, you might as well valet which is pricey. The room was large and nice, and the staff was nice ( a few a little pretentious). Honestly felt self conscious because we were dressed casuelly for travel and the staff and other travelers were very dressed up.

Reviews.Title: “Every time I'm in Orlando for business (5X/yr) I'm at the Grand Bohemian”
Reviews.Author: kikipearce
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Grand Bohemian about a dozen times. Consistantly the rooms have been clean and quiet. The food is GREAT and the staff is helpful and friendly. If you join the "preferred" membership (iprefer) you can usually be upgraded to the concierge floor with its own bar (that you pay for) complete with snacks (that are free). I usually don't have time to enjoy the pool but go outside to stick my feet in the hottub while I call home in the evenings. I have also hosted work events here and the service and setting were supurb and affordable. My only gripe is that even though I love the decor, it is very 1990s (lots of red velvet couches and purple walls) and the robes are massive and weigh about 90 pounds. I'm glad to have it - but I don't want to take it home. Downtown Orlando is way more fun than you think. Walkable and good food.

Reviews.Title: “contented customerss”
Reviews.Author: oldtravellerFlorida
Reviews.Content: We considered to have had an excellent room on the 21st which we occupied for 5 nights. There was a minor problem with music from another room which was quickly resolved. The furnishings and general decor were tastful and created a sense of luxury. The meals were excellent and staff were polite andd attentive. The parking valet service was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “a bit snooty”
Reviews.Author: kaljenny
Reviews.Content: i was a bit surprised to see all the guest at this hotel dressed up in suits and high heels. it definately is not a place to go if you want to just have fun and relax. more of an upscale stuffy feel to this hotel. they also charge you $20 per day plus tax to park your car. they also will charge you $13 per day for internet access. if you are looking for an easy orlando getaway, avoid this hotel. if you are looking to get dressed up in formal wear in 80 degree weather and overpay for stuff, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “i see the reviews are not great...but i loved it”
Reviews.Author: aaronAthlone
Reviews.Content: ok..so the decor was a bid dodgy...(wierd pics in room)...i found the service good... the receptionist gave me an umbrella when it was raining & recommended places to eat & where to go out..with good directions..the starbucks coffee was just lovely to wake up to every morn...just one catch....we wer leaving the last morning and we wanted to get lunch as we were tight for time... ( we had a flight to catch) and we were refused entry to the lunch room cos of the way we wer dressed!!!!!!!!!...(we had runners & tracksuit bottoms on as we wer flying that afternoon) ...that is desperate bad behaviour frm a hotel!!!!!!!...i wont recommend this hotel on that reason alone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms oddly decorated and nothing to do in the area”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDiver-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stay at the largest suite for 2 nights in April 2010 (executive jazucci suite). This hotel is located in downtown Orlando and there is absolutely nothing to do in this area. Downtown Orlando is deadly boring. We have been there 3 days and 2 nights and never saw a concierge working at the desk. The staff at reception is not knowledgeable about things to do in Orlando (for 2 adults). They cannot recommend anything. In addition, most of the staff working at the restaurant is lifeless, bored, and feel like they were condemned to service customers. The decoration in the room is questionnable, but a good attempt has been done to make the hotel trendy. The hotel should go out of its way to ensure guests have places to go and see while in town. Next time, I would move to the new Astoria Hotel in the Park Area -- or the Ritz Carleton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Srakred
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the Grand Bohemian the concierge Patricia Clifton went out of her way to resolve a problem for me. My dress for my daughter's wedding two days later had not yet arrived. She contacted the bridal shop from which it was purchased and tracked the package until it arrived. It did arrive less than 24 hours before the wedding and I did have time to get it altered. Ms. Clifton was extremely courteous and efficient. I will highly recommend this hotel to friends and family and will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Roadwarrior76Orlando
Reviews.Content: Its about time to move from idrive to Grand Bohemian, nice place, great service (except pool side) trying to help every time. Christina at sales office was great in assisting us in setting up a few days of training in their conference. I liked the service so much that i moved in for the remainder of my trip. The rooms are clean and generaly nice. Room service prices are reasonable as for previos posts about water...... Every hotel in the world that i stayed at ,that was rated us high was giving me same prices for bar and liquids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a bit of marketing cheese for tarnish.”
Reviews.Author: shawnbatt
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and the bedding a bit nicer than average. However the room was a bit worn out. Also, the persistent efforts at getting more cash out of us annoyed me. Water in the room for $5.95 a bottle. $12.95 a night for internet. Mandatory $21 per day valet parking plus tips every time. We were lucky to have breakfast included in the great rate from Travelocity but the desk was dubious and insisted on making a copy of the confirmation. I liked the breakfast staff and the food, but I'm glad I asked about it on check in and that I had my confirmation. The hot tub never worked while we were there. It's cool to have art everywhere and the restaurant is pretty nice for breakfast. Very convenient to downtown and certainly not trashy cheap, but still they could be better on fit and finish to earn 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience: No Hot Water, Lost Laundry, A Bit Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: poleinahole1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on South Orange Avenue--the main drag. But it´s a strange mix of banks, insurance companies, bars and restaurants serving up snack food. There is a large movie two blocks away. Hotel tries to be a hip joint staffed by folks many who look like models, but it doesn´t quiet achieve this. I´m not sure why, maybe it´s mediocre management. Art work a bit tacky in my view. They charge you $1 on leaving to give to an art charity. You can have it removed, but I dislike hotels that are so presumptive that they want me to fund their pet charities. As many reviewers noted, I had only tepid water. I was here on a conference and most of the folks in my party were fine, so it must only be the rooms in a particular zone. They pretended it was a new problem when I told them. Obviously, a hotel trying to be 5 stars should have hot water. Rooms are fine. Beds comfortable and WIFI fast. Main complaint is the the rooms are very dark. Bathroom is bright though. Nice toileteries. My room was above South Orange (main street). There is a fire station a block and half away and so you can be waken up at odd hours depending on fires. They lost my laundry. I called them two hours after they delivered and response was valet delivered everything and cleaners were closed, but they would be on it first thing in the morning. (I was checking out at noon.) When I called in the morning they knew nothing about this. They did eventually manage to find my laundry in their basement. They said they would refund me if they coulodn´t find my laundry but would deduct a depreciation charge for wear and tear of cloting first! I have never been in a hotel of this class that does this. They don´t seem to get that guests don´t choose to have their hotel lose their laundry and don´t want to have to go shopping for new stuff. Restaurant is very trendy and food is good if you order the main dishes. They have no vegetarian options so they brought me aa bunch of veggie sides. Mushrooms were burned. Waiters at first very solicitous and salad came super quickly, but it then took forever to get entree and I had to ask the hostess to get my bill as the waiters suddenly disappeared for half an hour. I was attending a small conference and the food they served us at lunch was very good. Staff looking after us were excellent. Valet parking also works very well, as well it might at $20 a pop for parking. They have a very small outdoor pool (s trokes if you are lucky per lap) and a small gym with the usual equipment which is kept in good condition. I would go elsewhere next time as I felt the hotel was nothing specail and had too many issues.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but they need a better hot water heater”
Reviews.Author: adiatasha
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando for a wedding and needed a hotel that was close to the wedding venue. Arrived at the Grand Bohemian at 12:00 pm. since the wedding was at 2:00 pm. They let us check in early. We had a king bedroom suite. Lots of room very nice beds, pillows. The hotel has a jazz feel to it. Music was playing in our room when we entered. Hot water never got hot. We complained to the front desk, but they did not fix it. Oh well! 1 night not having scalding hot water was fine. The lounge downstairs was nice and well as the bar.

Reviews.Title: “A pretentious little number – but only tepid water!”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in mid-Feb for a small conference at the conference rate of $169 + $21+ of taxes. I actually quite liked some aspects of the hotel. If you forgive the pretensions of it seemingly trying to live up to the ‘Grand’ in its title, the hotel is pleasant enough and some of the art which adorns the walls is actually very pleasant on the eye. The room is comfortable enough with the standard stuff. Internet is charged per day (can’t recall how much as I used mobile bb). My shower featured two heads both of which did nothing except dribble tepid water. A very poor shower (and shaving) experience. Surely a hotel this grand could sort out its hot water system – apparently not and I know I wasn’t the only one with the issue. The room was very dark – not helped by the decor which was dark. If you are going for a romantic liaison then dark may be good. When you are a business man at a conference, light is preferable. Then there is all the stuff they are trying to sell you in the room. Overpriced CDs of the music playing on the Bose (nice touch), water at $5.95, art at $1,200++!!! Come on. The valet parking was $21.30 per day which actually wasn’t bad given the nearest street garage on South street (just down towards the interstate) was $17 and in walking around I didn’t see a cheaper garage. The gym is nothing special but reasonable with 3 joggers, 2 x-trainers and some free weights. The outside pool a pleasant affair on the 6th floor with a nice terrace. The conference food was good. Location wise its right in the heart of central downtown Orlando near lots of bars and restaurants. However it’s a good 10 minute walk to the nearest grocery store and anything useful. Apart from the water temperature the stay was fine but its not somewhere I’d plan to go back to unless it was for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, quite luxurious, boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: With no sense of "I could be anywhere" you get in the usal chain hotels, this is a great medium-sized hotel in downtown Orlando with a good bar and restaurant and lovely , plush rooms. Was there for an on-site conference with 30 colleagues; all seemed please with the location and amenities, and the conference/meeting facilities were also good. My room was a good size, very plush, clean and nicely designed. Internet access was included in our group-negotiated rate so can't comment on whether it's normally provided free, but almost certain it's not because I had to check "bill to room" although that was discounted on checkout. My usual gripe: hotels should not be charging extra for essentialy a fixed-cost item like internet access any more than for running water and electricity (less so in fact, as these are marginal cost items).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bud0430
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for a fun getaway weekend with my boyfriend. We're from Michigan so we thought a weekend in Orlando would be a nice break from the cold weather, and we were right. Downtown Orlando isn't huge but I felt like the Grand Bohemian was right in the middle of everything - all the bars and restaurants and sites you need are within walking distance. The ambiance and decor of the Grand Bohemian lives up to it's name and to ones expectations - there is incredible artwork everywhere - including the hallways and in your room. The rooms are very nice, with comfortable beds, decorating that I would be happy to have in my home, and a big flat screen TV (great for watching the superbowl!). We stayed on the 6th floor, and that is where the fitness center and outdoor (wonderful) pool, hot tub and sitting area are located. It was great for us because we used the hot tub every day - it was a GREAT place to have a drink and relax while being surrounded by palm trees. However - and in my mind this is minor but I could see how some people wouldn't like this - our window faced the walkway that surrounded the pool (the pool was elevated so you couldn't see swimmers and they couldn't see you) and on that walkway were potted trees and tables and chairs. A few times I saw people walking right by my window, which was startling at first and you definitely need to be mindful of what you're wearing! BUT, again, this was minor, but be aware if you're checking in and they tell you you're on the 6th floor. I would suggest walking to the nearby markets to stock up on wine, beer and snacks, if you like those things - as I think the least expensive glass of wine on the bar menu was 10 bucks. The rooms were so nice, and the fact that they provide good wine glasses in your room made me happy to have a drink there before heading out to dinner. If you like brunch (and you don't mind paying 29 bucks) then you MUST have the brunch at the Grand Bohemian. Shrimp, eggs benedict, crab legs, ribs, and so much more - it was all fantastic!! Best of all, the mimosas were only 5 bucks each, a great deal. The bar area is again very classy, very nice, and they have a great jazz band on Saturday night. We saw a very interesting mix of people staying at the GB, anywhere from families, groups of single guys and girls out to party, to the entire Wizards basketball team. It has a wide appeal because it's a truly unique and fun place to be. Nearby, enjoy Urban Flats restaurant (a great bargin for fantastic food), Corona Cigar, if you're interested in the biggest selection of cigars and scotches one can imagine, Ember, which is a nice outdoor bar that gets a little clubby at night, take a walk around Eola Lake where you can feed ducks and swans, and much, much more........

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinMadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for only one night as I had business meetings the next day. The location of this hotel is the best part as you are right downtown in Orlando. We had an easy walk to a great restaurant (recommended by front desk) and nightclubs. Unlike some other comments for this hotel, the front desk staff was very helpful, they even printed out a google map and delivered to my room when I asked for directions for the following day. There is a very good bar just off reception where we had drinks before going out. Rooms are nicely furnished and beds were very comfortable. The hotel does have some interesting artwork and a quirky feel to it because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: Bobby89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Bohemian for a couple of nights on arrival in Orlando, and it was lovely. Close to airport with big, romantic and comfortable rooms full of fantastic art work. Loved the Starbucks coffee in the rooms and the reception staff were very helpful and friendly with restaurant recommendations and directions. Breakfasts were also great- though not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, had one problem but management was great”
Reviews.Author: MeeshiFLA
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels and the entire trip - from our arrival to the valet to when we were packing our things, was excellent. There was one issue we found right before we left but management was very quick to correct and compensate for the issue. I highly recommend the Bohemian - the location is excellent. The food is great - you have to try the chocolate martini in the lounge - the best I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Reservation Messed Up”
Reviews.Author: pursuefate
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the most beautiful and unique hotels I've ever seen! I had major problems with my reservation though: I booked 5 months in advance for a 2-night stay, and a month before our stay I canceled the second night..I never received an email confirming my revised stay, and something told me to call...sure enough, my entire reservation had been canceled!...I was told that i could "rebook" but they couldn't guarantee the same rate...I ended up getting the original rate, but I thought this was a little ridiculous since they canceled my entire reservation in error...I never received a confirmation email when I re-booked, so I called again and they had me under a different reservation number. Not sure if this a communication issue between booking systems (I talked to reservations and the front desk, which didn't seem to know what the other was doing quite honestly). I am I was disappointed that the pool area was closed..we received a notice upon check in that it would be closed the following afternoon for a private event, but it was also closed presumably in preparation for the next day event, but we were not notified of this. We were there for New Years Eve and appreciated the cover charge comp as well as the efforts the hotel took to ensure guests weren't partying until all hours in their rooms. Within walking distance of a lot of bars and restaurants and was close to all the highways we needed to access during our stay. Overall, I would recommend this to a couple looking for a weekend indulgence in a beautiful environment...but I would definitely confirm your reservation if you make any changes and while the service is genuine, it is not as accommodating as you might expect from a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: MABTraveler
Reviews.Content: We consider ourselves well traveled. (International and Domestic) My husband and I stayed one night at the Grand Bohemian Orlando. We drove there to attend the Champs Bowl Game. The hotel itself is very attractive with interesting art work throughout. The room was spacious and comfortable. However, all staff whom we interacted with were very rude and appeared false. The customer service i.e. Guest Services and Front Desk staff appeared to not really want to be friendly at all. It was as they were forced to be nice. (Cold, fake smiles and ingenuine demeanors.) Also, my hair dryer was not working properly, and Guest Services acted as if they were doing me a big favor by getting someone to repair it. On a final note, my husband and I wanted to view the swimming pool. (Small) We tried to view the pool, but we were rudely several told by engineering/maintainance to "get out" of the area because they were painting. (There was NOT a sign indicating that this work was in progress posted anywhere) On a final note, I discussed the pool issue with the Concierge who offered me breakfast the next time I stay at the Grand Bohemian, but there will not be a next time. Orlando offers a variety of great hotels. Look elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “For Orlando, a good downtown hotel - but not all aspects are equally good”
Reviews.Author: SRBNorthernCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week this Thanksgiving holiday (it was my third time at the hotel, but my first time with my spouse). The positives: 1. They did a nice job with the rooms, and the artwork really does create a cool/interesting atmosphere 2. It took me a few trips to figure it out, but out of all of the staff, the valet parking team are consistently the best: always polite and interactive, hard working, etc. The front desk staff are hit and miss (see below). 3. The live music downstairs can be great, and the bar is casual and has pretty good drinks (during NBA games, it can be packed - visiting teams stay here) The negatives: 1. The guests can be an interesting mix, sometimes a little too young and loud 2. The front desk staff range from good/great to somewhat disinterested, and sometimes borderline offensive (e.g., one comment made to us). 3. The gym is lacking - it would be great to have a more expansive gym. 4. They claim room service is 24 hours, but it's not. 5. In Fall/Winter, the pool doesn't get much (if any) sun. Overall, as long as the prices stay reasonable (which they currently are), it's a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice. Not more, certainly not less.”
Reviews.Author: TOMxxx
Reviews.Content: Traveling mid-week for business, the Grand Bohemian was very nice. After leaving, I am trying to figure out why I am not gushing about this hotel as I have with other seemingly-similar properties. The room was nice, very comfortable bed.bedding, and a good size. The bath was nice but oddly, for such a nice hotel, you do notice small things like the Holiday Inn-quality towels...picky? Yes, but it seemed like a major corner cutter. Internet comes at a fee, unlike with my new favorite Kimpton hotels (they bend over backwards for business travelers and don't nickel and dime for interets or expect you to use their business center on another floor). Fortunately, I had my Verizon wireless and it saved me $12/day for hotel internet (which is usually slow). Room Service for both breakfast and dinner was excellent - kind, quick staff, very good food. The Valets were fast and courteous - be prepared for $20/day plus tips - I don't know if they have a free lot but being downtown, I doubt it. Decent restaurants nearby but downtown Orlando isn't going to score any points for foodies. Honestly, the dinner from the hotel was as good as could have been expected and I heard raves about the restaurant. Front Desk staff was efficient - not particularly friendly but interaction was limited. Visually, the hotel is beautiful...and there's a Starbucks right downstairs -- great for first thing in the morning. Location is excellent for downtown --walk almost anywhere or a quick 5 minute drive to the Arena;.too far for Disney or other attracions. If you have a conference or business at another hotel (I had a conference at the Marriott), stay here -- mid week price was good and the hotel is much nicer than some of the older plain hotels. Definitely recommend -- be sure not to over pay, though - as nice as it is, it wasn't worth more than the $189-$200/night I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, didn't need to leave the premises for anything”
Reviews.Author: nuclearsun
Reviews.Content: Loved it there, had a great stay and was taken care of from arrival to departure Highly reccomended

Reviews.Title: “If you want an "eventful" wedding, have it here...”
Reviews.Author: flgrl88
Reviews.Content: I live in Orlando, but booked a 1 night stay at this hotel as I was attending a wedding that evening. The Valet Parking is wonderful, which lead me to believe that the rest of my stay was going to be equally as great. I called the day before to verify the check in time, and to see if I could check in early. I was told 4 PM was check in time, and early check in would not be allowed. I arrived around 4:30, as the wedding I was attending started at 6. I was told that my room was not ready, and they did not have an estimate as to when it would be ready. As I needed to get ready for the wedding, I was offered the option of either a) the ladies room off the lobby or b) the bride's room as a place to change clothes. I chose option a, and along with another guest trying to check in, we both got ready in the in ladies room, with other guests attempting to use the facilities as well. I was told that I could cancel my reservation, and there would be no penalty AFTER the front desk had already swiped my debit card, thus putting a $ 250 hold on my checking account...with the knowledge that the "hold" would come in in 5-7 business days...as I had already been charged, I may as well stay anyway. I received a call, over 3 hours after I arrived that my room was available. They did offer to take my luggage to my room for me, and gave me a free drink for the hotel bar for my "trouble" and extended my check out time by 1 hour. The wedding was beautiful, but during the reception, there was a malfunction with the fire alarms so the reception was interrupted by flashing lights and a mechanical voice saying we had to leave. I received a voice mail in my room telling me that I had a gift bag waiting for me at the front desk (something the bride and groom left for all their guests staying at the hotel). When I went to check out, I was told that they had given all the bags back to the bride / groom, even though I had a message that there was one waiting. As of today, the actual charges for the room have been posted to my checking account, but there is still a hold for the initial authorization. This is a beautiful hotel, but the check in policies are all but ignored (unless you are a professional basketball player or celebrity...the rooms for them were ready)...the bride's mother could not check into her room when she arrived....and the customer service is lacking. The response when questioned that they had a full turn over between Thursday and Friday and they were not ready....housekeeping came to my room at 9:30 AM, so the explaination does not make sense... Would I stay here again, probably not. Would I recommend it, probably as it is a beautiful hotel, but the customer service is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Bohemian Hotel in Orlando, FL is the epitome of exemplary service.”
Reviews.Author: Orlando_FLHighlander
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orlando's Grand Bohemian in conjunction with our daughter's wedding. From the time of our initial contact with their Sales Department to the day we checked out of the hotel after the wedding, their service was beyond reproach. The sales staff's attention to detail was impressive from beginning to end. No matter what questions we had, they were quickly answered to our satisfaction. The banquet staff's level of service is unparalleled. Rob, the captain, and Patrick, the maitre 'd, couldn't have done more. We had family members from NY, NJ, PA, GA and AZ who stayed for several days at the hotel. All raved about the quality of the rooms and the service. There wasn't an employee with whom we came in contact who wasn't geared to please from the valet parking staff to housekeeping. We have dined in the Boheme restaurant several times (aside from the wedding events) and the food is wonderful. We cannot recommend the Grand Bohemian highly enough to anyone in Orlando who is planning an event such as a wedding, or to someone looking for a place to stay in Orlando. The location is great, providing easy access to downtown Orlando sites (most within walking distance). Thanks to the staff and management of the Grand Bohemian for making our daughter's wedding a memorable experience. You're all wonderful!! Len and Maryanne Kravitz, Orlando, FL

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay in Orlando-No Doubts”
Reviews.Author: stevesanibel
Reviews.Content: Third time at hotel and as usual the staff just "blow you away" with great service. From the valet to the front desk to the happy bartenders and serves, everyone seems to enjoy making the guests happy. No doubt, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations and exceeded it!”
Reviews.Author: elsalawy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for my 40th Birthday celebration. The staff was helpful. The room was nice (what you expect from a Kessler hotel/Stayed at Casa Monica, FL). On Monday night, we were surprised with a very nice live Jazz jamming. The food was superb, especially, the sea bass. Ask for crab cakes and calamari, it is very good as well. Room service was punctual. Spa was very good. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: gatorsgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible! It is fun with friends and very romantic for couples. I was there for a 30th Birthday and will be booking again for my anniversary! Within walking distance of many restaurants and bars for nightlife. Would leave the kids at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Romance Weekend”
Reviews.Author: sport1966
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent at weekend at The Grand Bohemian. We had an incredible stay. From the time we pulled into the valet we realize we were staying someplace special. The check-in was very easy, Jamie was very professional and helpful. Our bellhop was also very nice, We forgot his name. After we got settled in our room, when down to the lounge for a drink. The lounge interiors were nothing I have every experienced before, in a good way!! It was a pleasure to sit and chat with Ivey the bartender. She suggested several places for dinner and places to see in downtown Orlando. We had a couples massage scheduled. Originally it was scheduled for our room but the massage therapist called and suggested using the spa room. I'm not sure why this option was not suggested at the time of booking our massages. It was wonderful to have our massages side by side, with the candles and music it was a great romantic atmosphere. My massage therapist, he was excellent, it was one of the best massage we have ever had. We had dinner in the Boheme, everything the food to the service was great. A little disappointed in the wine list. Great art throughout the hotel. Just some of the pictures were hung pretty crocked, especially on the 6th floor. The only negative with our stay was we could not believe no concierge service on a Friday and Saturday Night. We look forward to coming back to Orlando and have another great stay at the Grand Bohemian.

Reviews.Title: “Did not offer full disclosure”
Reviews.Author: Tiffrinaldi
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the bellsman, vallet, and roomservice attendants. Especially Jose! He was extremely informative, and accomadative. An all around good guy! The reservations/check in staff however should have disclosed, prior to check in, a large wedding that was being held at the pool. So the amenities were not available to myself or my children during our stay! Being the 4th of July weekend...that was VERY disappointing. I was promised a room comp and they NEVER delivered. I would reccomend this hotel for cleanliness, and convenience only, as I have nothing good to say about the amenities or credibility of the hotel or its management.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Comfort and Staff Congeniality”
Reviews.Author: SeminoleLady72
Reviews.Content: I rated the hotel facility as excellent. What I want everyone to know is that not only is a beautiful luxurious hotel, but the staff is congenial and treated me like a member of the family. I did not want for anything. Jose was especially kind and helped me with the usual niceties of a hotel as well as helping me with shopping directions. In addition, his demeanor was such that I never felt like he was rushed, even though I knew he was especially at check out time, nor did I feel like he was working for a paycheck. He was working to ensure that my stay was Outstanding and that I was Comfortable. Thank you Grand Bohemian staff and in particular JOSE. A Florida Teacher of the Year Candidate

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: maryflyner
Reviews.Content: Other than the bell hop and people that parked the cars, most of the staff was very rude and snobby. I guess that is the kind of attitude they portray to make themselves feel important. The hotel is located in a shady area of town, walking distance from homeless asking for money. The rooms were O.K. nothing out of the ordinary. Room was old and outdated and had ants in my room. I thought the hotel was nice from the pictures but I was very wrong. I was there for a wedding and I also noticed the hotel staff being very rude to the people that were hired for the wedding such as the DJ and Photographer, I couldn't believe anyone would take that kind of abuse from anyone. I'm suprised that the DJ kept his cool with these people. I work in the wedding industry in Georiga and never seen a place treet their vendors as bad as I seen at the Grand Bohemian. Would not recommend for a place to stay or have a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1000Usa
Reviews.Content: Wow - from start to finish my experience was fantastic! If you are lucky enough to get Jose to help you with all of your needs you are guaranteed a wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful, clean and friendly, but Jose is the one to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Stay!! The Gem of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: usaguam1
Reviews.Content: Fromt the moment we arrived in the valet area, we were treated like VIP's. The valet staff was GREAT!! The gentlemen were friendly and attentive Upon entering the hotel, we were greeted by the bellman (I believe his name was Luis) who welcomed us and walked us to the front desk. When we got to the desk a very charming young lady (I think Krissy or Kristin) welcomed us (what a smile) and checked us in. She was very nice, gave us a quick verbal tour of the hotel and sent us on our way. Luis helped us with our luggage and was so very nice. We arrived to our Jacuzzi Suite, which at that time Luis gave us a tour of our room. The room was beautiful filled with dark rich colors throughout. The restroom was a generous size and the Jacuzzi tub was perfect. Along with the Bose radio and large flat screen TV all the amenities you would expect in a luxury hotel room was provided. We took a walk around the hotel and everywhere you went was amazing artwork, from paintings, sculptures, busts etc...The hotel is simply a art musuem! We had an amazing time...If you ever want to get away and leave the kids home, this is the hotel for you. What makes this hotel so special are the staff members...Top Notch!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, First Rate”
Reviews.Author: wiscmari
Reviews.Content: Jose, the bellman, is awesome. He helped us with all of our needs, it was like he never went home!

Reviews.Title: “Rehearsal Dinner/Room Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimianis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Bohemian on June 5th 2009 the night before my wedding. We had the rehearsal dinner that night as well at the hotel. What a beautiful and amazing experience! We were in the pool area that evening! It had a canopy to block the rain! what an amazing view from this level! The rehearsal dinner from the staff to the location to the food was excellent! It made the day before my wedding awesome! What a beautiful way to start such an event and biggest day of my life! All the way to starting out my marriage in the beautiful hotel room the night of the wedding to the time we checked out! I would 150% recommend this hotel to everyone! Kim Martinez will make sure that your experience was as awesome as mine!! Thank you Grand Bohemian!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel - Some Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Moonbeam929
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Kessler's Grand Bohemian Hotel in downtown Orlando. My husband and I booked an overnight stay, Saturday, with reservations for the Jazz Brunch at the hotel restaurant, The Boheme, on Sunday to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Since our last overnight stay, three years ago, I have to say the hotel is as lovely as ever, but there are a few areas for improvement. WE paid $138 for a deluxe suite - very affordable for a downtown Orlando 4 1/2 star hotel. I appreciated the discounted price even more after observing a few dissappointents. The doorman and front desk representative were courteous and efficient upon check-in. I was not thrilled when I read a notice at the front desk stating we would not have access to the swimming pool from 10 AM - 3:00 PM and 4:30 PM - 6 PM. The hotel was having not just one special event, but two that day! Perhaps this is why our room was at such a good rate? Not ones to dwell on the negative, we proceeded to our room on the 8th floor with a view of the pool. The rooms are spacious with a bedroom and adjoining sitting area and very clean. We had a king bed with plush down bedding and down pillows, a flat screen TV, stocked refrigerator and snack bar, red velvet couch and a desk and chair. The bathroom is very nice with a marble floor, plush terry robes for two, and a double spa type shower head, large vanity and basic toiletries, shampoo/conditioner, soap, lotion were Kessler's brand. My satisfaction with the room was diminished by the loud thump, thump, thump of the DJ playing top 40 music for the private party at the pool. (I am 44, my husband 51) We are not opposed to people having a good time, especially if they paid the higher rate for a special party, but c'mon!!! We heard the music as clearly as if were there partying with them. Apparently, management tried to keep a control on the sound level as it occassional was turned down, but minutes later was right back up again. So much for taking a nap while waiting for the pool and spa to be free. The bed was plush and comfortable. We enjoyed the Bose stereo and the compilation CD Kessler provides for their guests to play while visiting. If you like the CD enough you may take it home for $15.95. Unfortunately, we could not hear the TV or the stereo over the DJ until he left. At 3 PM we went down to the 6th floor to go to the pool and spa and the temperature of the water was heavenly. I was a bit disappointed by the appearance of the pool and spa, both need resurfacing as they are cracked and discolored from patching and wear and tear. In the meantime, the pool surface needs a good scrubbing. The pool lounge chairs are comfortable, but the ivory colored fabric is turning brown and should be replaced...ugh! I put several towels down as I didn't want to lay on dirty lounge chairs. Overall, the pool area needs a facelift. Although we did not have time to use the exercise equipment in the fitness center, it is very well set up with everything from weights to stair climbers and treadmills with flat screen TVs. They even provide complimentary headphones for their guests. There is not an actual spa on premise, but massage, facials and body treatments are available in room by appointment. We did order room service for lunch. The order was taken courteously and delivered within 30 minutes. Of course, the price was about $50 for lunch for two, but that is to be expected of room service in an upscale hotel. The unique theme of this hotel is Kessler's unusual collection of artwork in rooms and all common areas. There is something for people of all artistic tastes. The hotel possesses one of only two Bosendorfer pianos. On Friday and Saturday evenings, the hotel lounge is a popular place for a cocktail live jazz from 8 PM- 10:30 PM. My cocktail recommendation: The Pomegranite martini is delicious! My husband loves that Crown Royal Reserve is served here. The hotel is very clean throughout with one peculiar housekeeping oversight to mention. Many of the doors in the hotel require a good cleaning as they have fingerprints and other dirt on them. It was a strange oversight that I found on our room door, the bathroom door and on several doors in the common areas. We have frequented the hotel lounge of this artsy, eclectic hotel over the last six years and always have a good time. There was a wonderful love seat in the corner we found with a spacious marble coffee table. From here we could hear the jazz from the other room quite clearly and also do some people watching. The lounge also offers the full room service menu if you care to eat while enjoying a cocktail or two. We have enjoyed the Sunday Jazz Brunch before and enjoyed it just as well today. At $50 a person, it is pricey, but it is a unique brunch with live piano jazz, unlimited champagne and mimosas, shrimp, crab legs, sushi, and several signature meat dishes along with carved ham and new york strip. All in all, we had a fantastic week-end and will return in a year or so. I hope to find a newly refurbished pool, spa, and deck when we return:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not entirely worth the money”
Reviews.Author: LegoJoe
Reviews.Content: I will have to say that my expectations were high coming to the Grand Bohemian because of all the great reviews on Trip Advisor. Honestly, we didn't think it was up to the standards we expected. Valet-fantastic, but expensive. $20/night but that's expected for any downtown hotel. Check in-uneventful-however, they told us the pool would be closed for 4 hours during prime time on Saturday!!! Yes, it was...they apparently schedule events up at the pool, which in my opinion is pretty inconvenient when you are paying for amenities. Pool-Nice, again...they closed it for an event on Saturday afternoon. There is NO pool bar. The look at the pool is nice; however, the white lawnchairs are getting brown, etc. Needs a touch up here. Fitness Center-small but nice. Rooms--they were nice, again nothing spectacular. Don't expect a 5 star Ritz Carlton or 4 Seasons...it's not like that here. The eclectic art is very interesting---a great touch. There was a purple couch in our room! Shower/Bathroom were great-. Everything very clean. Bathroom Amenities nice & we enjoyed that they brewed Starbucks. Bar--very nice, modern. We enjoyed this very much. Very cool lite up menu. Room Service--very good, but expensive. $50 for 2 people. Again, we realize we're going to pay more staying here but $50 for breakfast food is pretty steep. TRY: Wall Street, Spice & Eola Wine Co.
