Reviews.Title: “The staff, especially Jose, was excellent and attended to our needs with expediancy and professionalism.”
Reviews.Author: sjcef
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the staff at this hotel. Very caring and professional. When I had a special request, Jose made it happen. I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “We Wanted to Stay Longer!”
Reviews.Author: vrob125
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, everything was handled well. The front desk was friendly--and extremely professional. The cost of the parking by valet was $20 a day, but worth every penny. We were treated like royalty--and after only one day, the staff was calling us by our name. The beds were soft, plush, and comfy, and the nightlife in and outside the hotel was wonderful. The lounge is great, and the jazz combo was top class. We loved our stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding boutique hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: conferencegirl
Reviews.Content: I just attended a conference at Grand Bohemian Hotel. From the moment of check in with outstanding service from Jose and the valet staff, to the large luxurious room, and great banquet food, it was a pleasurable 2 days. The bar was delightful with great live jazz and the service was always prompt. I would recommend this hotel to a leisure, business or convention traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneAge
Reviews.Content: The Grand Bohemian was the finale to my two week trip to Florida, and a most elegant and impressive way to finish - as long as you mind the extras ! The hotel impresses the moment you pull up to valet parking - an elegant entry & foyer leading to a room that was as beautiful and well appointed as anything I have stayed in for <$200 per night. The impressive thing about the Grand Bo is it manages to avoid feeling like a hotel, or a chain for that matter. Lovely velour, wood and of course the beautiful original artwork really creates a special atmosphere. Location is perfect for downtown Orlando - you are right on Orange Ave where all the nightlife happens on the weekends, and I imagine for business activities during the week. Weekends were very quiet during the day but thats a typical American downtown for you - luckily a fine breakfast diner is located just a couple of blocks up on Park St. The negative ? Well having stayed largely in chains earlier in my stay - I got used to the niceties of your typical Hampton or Ramada - free fast internet, decent included breakfast, free parking, FF miles etc. I guess a hotel as upmarket as the Grand Bo can charge in spades for all these things (and not give any miles) because it is what it is - one of the finest & stylish hotels I have had the pleasure of staying at. An extra highlight being among the Cleveland Cavalier players during their stay for the NBA Eastern Conference finals of 2009 - I think also a testimony to the quality of the hotel. And kudos to the staff especially the parking valet guys - a really nice helpful bunch of young guys. So I would obviously recommend the Grand Bo to anyone staying in downtown Orlando - and if you can find a base rate under $200 a night it becomes very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Artsty, eclectic, city vibe!”
Reviews.Author: SunDollyOz
Reviews.Content: My friends met at the Grand Bohemian Hotel in downtown Orlando for one night in April 2009. We wanted a girl's night getaway. From the minute we pulled up to the valet, we got a cool, city vibe. We entered through white curtains into a darkly lit lobby. Lots of warm colors and funky artwork. Everyone was nice and friendly. We stayed on the 11th floor, but had access to the concierge level on the 15th floor. Our room had 2 queen beds with white, fluffy linens and a purple chaise lounge. We had a nice city view. It was a standard room. We booked with American Express for a discount of $149. We started off at the concierge level happy hour. It was a cash bar (surprised there wasn't atleast wine / beer service) and crackers and cheese. The room was very comfortable though with a nice city view. The attendant was very friendly. Then, we headed to the bar. We loved the vibe there. It's just a lot of fun, and the service was wonderful. We did have an incident with an over friendly hotel guest that crossed the line. Benjamin went above and beyond to make up feel comfortable. Continental breakfast was offered at the concierge club. The highlight is the "rooftop" pool which is on the 6th floor. It reminds me of the Mondrian in LA... lots of white lounge chairs and sofas. Unfortunately, there wasn't a bar there, but eventually, a waitress did stop by to take drink orders. Just a note... the pool is often closed to guests for weddings and corporate events. This can be during the day or evening. There are a lot of weddings held at this hotel on the weekends. The housekeeping staff was great... and special thanks to Kamal. He was so accomodating. Overall, our stay was fabulous. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Esthetics & Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Biztraveler04
Reviews.Content: Had the occasion to visit the Grand Bohemian for a business meeting. Arrangements were made so effciently with Kim Martinez and Danielle Derecola. When we arrived, EVERYTHING was set-up beautifully and in place in the meeting room. Simon, the Banquet Director introduced prior to the start of the meeting and I felt assured that all details would be taken care of. Upon arrival of other meeting participants, that were so impressed with the hotel and the beautiful art work. rDuring the meeting, Nestor, our server was so quiet and efficient, serving dinner as part of our meeting and making sure beverages and rolls were replenished. The service was OUTSTANDING! I would definitely hold another meeting here and try out the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “just like living in a mansion”
Reviews.Author: marcandshelly
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the GB for one night, but it was such a great experience. I wish we could've stayed a little longer. We arrived late but check in was very smooth. We wished that we could've parked our own car, but it seems valet is the only option for $21 overnight. However, it didn't prove to be a big hassle since they run to your car to get anything you might have forgotten. (I had forgotten my cell phone in the unprepared rush to get out of the car) Everyone on the staff are extremely courteous and attentive to your needs. (interesting British accents with the room attendants) Tips are shown appreciation but not at all pressured everywhere. Even when I'm just waiting in the lounge near the bar, the bartender comes up and brings me water with a welcoming manner. Now the hotel feels narrow like most of the Orlando Downtown buildings, but the high celings and rich opulence of the place is very attractive. Maroon lighting, burgundy accents, and mahogany woods coupled with edgy artwork and jazz music nightly made the place feel so swanky. I put the cute black dress on cuz I felt really high class. I also felt very safe because you need to scan your active room key to get to any floor other than Lobby on the elevator. The room itself was very nice though traditionally narrow. However the accomadations were thoughtful. Starbucks coffee with mugs&to-go cups, great cucumber melon toiletries, very comfortable beds, robes, flat screen tv, great view of the pool. You merely need to ask for free neccessities like shoe polish, sewing kit, lint brush, detergent for handwash clothes. They'll provide maps for you and try to read your mind for your next need. I was impressed. However, internet is not free. I saw a few of the other amenities. The pool with whirlpool looked small but nice, located on the 5th floor. It was shadowed by a large permanent tent/pavillion that looked perfect for the wedding that took place the night we arrived. It is a great place to catch some sun because it has a great view of the city. I didn't see what the fitness center looked like. The gallery is just a small hallway but it had great original work featured from local and national artists. Truly the whole hotel is more the gallery because they saturate all the walls on all floors. Your room has at least 4 unique large printed canvas paintings. I looked into my husband's conference rooms and they were adequately sized with a large projector screens for lecture. The service is what it's all about. They provided really great food. Juices, fruit, hot breakfast. For lunch, they had wraps, clam chowder bisque, assorted cookies... just a ridiculous spread. Checking out was absolutely a dream. They gladly extended my check out to 1pm. It gave me time to walk around the city and look at Downtown clubs still slumbering and eateries quietly open on a Saturday late morning. When I had to check out, I still had to wait for my husband still at conference. When I wanted to put my bags in the car, that's when valet posed a slight problem. However, they were happy to put our luggage into "storage" which seemed very secure. I didn't worry about our expensive laptop in their hands. At $127/night, I was very impressed. A few tips with downtown: "look very cute and sexy but high class:" you'll find yourself wanting to look nice for the expensive restaurants (average$30-$40/plate a la carte but worth it!) and then compete with the half-dressed young girls trying to get people into the wild party clubs. "No shopping" Downtown Orlando is certainly a culture/club scene. Nothing else within walking distance. (The outlet malls of Orlando are actually very good if you go just before Christmas.) "Good public transportation" the free Lymmo is a nice, quick bus service that runs up and down the Downtown area (and stops closeby the GB!) However, it's really not a very long walk and if you want to appreciate the place, the blocks are very small. Also they keep the area clean, well kept, and safe. A whiff of sewer can be expected sometimes though. "If you're a nerd like me, check out the library" I walked by a large building that was actually the Orlando library. It was huge and so nice! Who would've thought an eating place would've been inside a library? "Eat at the Breakfast Club:" Located very close to the GB (front desk can give you a map) is a breakfast and lunch place that has reasonable prices. You can order sandwiches, omelettes, crepes to your heart's content. I ordered the Flamingo crepe, which was to die for. For $8, you get hashbrowns, 4 half-slices of large toast, and a sizeable crepe filled with fresh vegetables&cheese, fresh avocado, turkey and bacon pieces, and topped with sourcream and salsa. Soooo good! So this was a great short trip for greaat food, culture and music, and royal treatment. I hope you have a great trip to Downtown Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Orlando A 5 Star Hotel With 5 Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: pengu1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Bohemian for 4 nights in February. We were blown away by the customer service, these people walk the talk! Right from our greeting from Justin at the valet, to our check in with Jose. The service was legendary! If your looking for a world class hotel away from all the theme parks. This is the place to stay. Lots of entertainment, restaraunts and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Away from the Disney Hubbub”
Reviews.Author: davidbruce
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a high-quality hotel in Orlando away from the hubbub of Disney, you can't do much better than the Grand Bohemian. It's a lovely, refined hotel with lots of unique touches. Our room was very nicely appointed, with a comfortable bed and good amenities. It was not a huge room, but big enough. We ate in the hotel restaurant for dinner and breakfast, and the food was excellent. We also relaxed in the funky lounge one night, where there was great live jazz music playing. The lounge is equipped with a special piano (I can't remember the name) that I'm told is top of the line. Did I mention the artwork? There's incredible original artwork throughout the hotel. You could spend an entire weekend just looking at the artwork on every floor and every room of the hotel. It's the most amazing thing I've ever seen in a hotel. As I stated before, the Grand Bohemian is a nice alternative to the hubbub of Disney. But the flip side is that there really is not much going on in downtown Orlando, and not much you can walk to. But there are some nice restaurants a short drive away in the Lake Eola area. The one area where I would say the Grand Bohemian is not five-star is in its service. There was nothing particularly bad about the service, but you certainly don't get the type of top-tier service you'd expect from a five-star hotel. It's nothing exceptional. Still, overall I would easily recommend this hotel to anyone, and I will certainly have no qualms about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Six Star hotel in a five star world”
Reviews.Author: AlexAtlantaGa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is FABULOUS !! I travel weekly and thought I had already stayed at the most elegant hotels . I was mistaken . The Bohemian beat them ALL ! from the moment you pull up in your car the staff of many steps up top greet you , takes your luggage , escorts you to the front desk and takes you to your room . from that moment on they will ALL call you by NAME , every time . This hotel is so elegant in every way .With its on style in this world of cookie cutter hotels .The rooms are EXTREMELY beautiful .Staff : attentive , professional , dressed to exceed , and friendly .The Bohemian has its own CLASSY personality which was so refreshing . I am a past , present , and [ most definitely ] a future guest . The views of the city were FANTASTIC ! Meals I had in their posh Restaurant were 5 star quality , just like the hotel overall . The location is ideal , right in the center of where you want to be ! Five star facility , location , ambiance , amenities , food , rooms and staff .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magnificent”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkAlba
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the GB since Nov. of 2008. Each visit has been consistently great. Everyone in the staff, from the valet guys (Pedro, Justin, Tony), to the bellman extraordinaire (Jose), to the front desk folks (Alex and rest of you), the concierge, the business center (Cindy has done miracles in helping ship stuff back to my office), room service, etc., is there to make our stay flawless. The gym has up-to-date equipment (not Equinox, but you can go to a really incredible gym across the street) which works for me. There are even earphones for the individual TVs on the machines. The pool is olympic-size, but gorgeous and spotless (as is the jacuzzi). I am writing this review because I travel all over the US and I'm really fussy about where I stay. I always read trip advisor and trust what is said here. If you want to be pampered, to be catered to and made to feel special, and to stay in one of the top hotels in the US, you have come to the right hotel. As a bonus, there is a Starbucks right off the lobby, next to the hotel's own art gallery. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Place for Wedding”
Reviews.Author: akurmang
Reviews.Content: The service, is really bad: waiters were rushing guests to finish their meals by taking food away. . Food was very poor quality, hotel cut costs everywhere. The rice was slimy the stairs had minor repair work, unsightful, not for the wedding mood.

Reviews.Title: “Jose's service was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: liztd33
Reviews.Content: I had a lot of rooms blocked for my wedding and Jose was our bell man and he was so professional and curteous....you just don't find service like this anymore. He delivered gifts on my behalf to all of my rooms, showed up immediately to assist me with my bags, and did it all with a genuine smile. Ricardo in group sales was also great, very accomodating. The hotel was great, beds amazing, and the food at the bar was top notch. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, professional, relaxing...romantic!”
Reviews.Author: contentFlorida
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary at the G. Bohemian and it was wonderful...the staff was professional, attentive and friendly! Food at the Boheme Restaurant was delicious and the atmosphere was very relaxing and romantic. We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: miamidoc78
Reviews.Content: I had to come to orlando for a family emergency and didn't plan to enjoy any of my stay there. I got a very last minute room at the Grand Bohemian and I've never stayed in a better place-- the staff was incredibly attentive and helpful (and sympathetic), the room was gorgeous and the food was great. I've never felt compelled to write a review of a hotel before (and have stayed in more than I could possibly count), but these people deserve some praise. A fantastic place with the best service!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE”
Reviews.Author: prstyle
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception on the grand bohemian hotel in January 3, 2009 we stayed there too, it was the best experience, the staff is nothing but the best, the hotel is super elegant and beautiful, our guests dont stop telling us that this is the best wedding reception they been to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Service”
Reviews.Author: NIceHotelsNeeded
Reviews.Content: First I had one of the best deals through Hotels.com to book one of the Jacuzzi suites. Our stay was to celebrate our engagement, and I wanted my fiance to see Orlando, FL since she has never been there before. The Grand Bohemian took care of all our needs. The service is excellent and they are more than happy to answer any questions. One particular employee, Joseph Herbet, made our stay truly relaxing. Do keep in mind this hotel is a luxurious/business hotel, and there are certain charges such as valet parking. But I believe one should expect this while staying at a hotel like this. You do get service with the price you pay. I would advice anyone to stay at this hotel if they are visiting Orlando, FL for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Best business hotel in Orlando, but...”
Reviews.Author: RoamingMenehune
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very courteous, friendly and eager to please. The hotel itself however leaves much to be desired. It is billed as business hotel, however the common spaces and rooms are dimly lit, the business center is virtually non-existent, the faxes to send/receive are egregiously expensive (i.e. - $25 for a 10 page fax) and the fitness facility is adequate but small. I couldn't imagine staying at this hotel for anything but business, however it is among the least business-friendly hotels I have stayed at and I am on the road around 150 days/year. WRT the restaurant - it is very tasty however it is expensive. So much so that my colleague and I have to eat "off campus" because we cannot afford to stay within our per diem. Considering the price they charge for the room and the fact that the hotel is looking slightly dated and worn, I am not sure that I would recommend staying here though they have a captive audience since there aren't many other options in downtown Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Bohemian is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: JWOJackson_MS
Reviews.Content: My current stay at the Grand Bohemian ends today, and is just like each of the other 5+ times I've stayed there.....a tremendously great experience! The rooms are large, attractive and comfortable, the restaurant is top notch, the location is perfect, but most of all, the personnel of the hotel are consistently competent, helpful, friendly and accommodating in every respect. In particular, the chief concierge Patricia Clifton is truly the best I've ever encountered and no one could be more helpful with normal and unusual guest needs as she has been for me. The head bellman Jose' has likewise endeared himself to me through the special assistance he has given me on several occasions. So, in summary, the accommodations, atmosphere and people of the Grand Bohemian will have me staying there every time I am in Orlando. JWO

Reviews.Title: “Grand Bohemian, a different Orlando”
Reviews.Author: thefoureyedpanda
Reviews.Content: I think the Grand Bohemian is a great alternative for Orlando. Downtown is actually pleasant even if small. You can walk around and try out a few restaurants and pubs that are very decent. The hotel has excellent service all around including parking. Room: good size, excellent mattress, nice red velvety couch, TV needs update (actually given where the prices are for TVs any hotel that doesn't have flat panel TVs is a joke), decent cable selection, good Internet connection. Nice updated bathroom with quality toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Flashy but Worn”
Reviews.Author: ROBERTLOUISSTEVENSON
Reviews.Content: Great concept, and great way to write off your million dollar Art collection (by hanging it on the walls). Of course the location is central to downtown, and offers a boutique hotel atmosphere, but the ammenities need an update: Towels, Bed Coverings, Rooms, etc.. Oh, The restaurant is Fabulous for Orlando (I lived there for 10 years), Sunday Brunch especially! I would pay up to $200, but no more (Then I would go to the Four Seasons or Universal Properties!)

Reviews.Title: “Very Artsy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tadler351
Reviews.Content: We came to the Grand Bohemian Hotel for a wedding and loved the hotel. Great bed and fabulous pillows. I hate not having a good pillow and they were fabulous and plentiful. I also loved that they had a coffee pot in the room with Starbucks coffee. Doesn't get any better then that, along with they also had a Starbucks cafe in the hotel with free WiFi. The service was good and pool area was very nice along with the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Ramatash
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a 'nicer' hotel in Orlando. I've stayed at Disney many times and wanted to see what downtown Orlando was like. This hotel exceeded my expectations. The hotel was extremely nice, the staff was very attentive, and the room was very nice. There was a lot of cool artwork in the rooms and throughout the hotel. The location was very central - near the night scene on Church street (but not too close). There's not a ton to see in downtown Orlando but this was THE place to stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Rare gem in d/town Orlando”
Reviews.Author: andrenj
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical travel experience. A really a rare find in downtown Orlando. Many amenities (restaurants, clubs, etc.) within walking distance. Trust the concierge (Mersiha) to take personal care of you. Let her setup your dinner arrangements and trust her menu recommendation! It only takes one visit for her to remember your name (I don't know how she does it?). She knows all the "off-the-beaten-path" (a.k.a non-tourist) spots in Orlando. As long as she is there I'll keep going back. First class concierge attention. The rooms are great; very comfortable and chic! GB makes business travel easier. I have no reservations (pun intended) recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best”
Reviews.Author: EdGNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a premier hotel. The experience is grand, from the minute you drive up to the minute you drive away. It is all about service and respectful friendliness. There is really nothing more to say other than it was a wounderful experience, and I would recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Gaia1TallahasseeFL
Reviews.Content: I travel on business quite a bit, and usually just stay at a convenient chain that offers government rates. However, someone tipped me off about this downtown hotel. It was gorgeous, in the old world European style, and the staff were very accomodating. I have a gluten allergy, and needed an afternoon snack. Since there was nothing I could eat on the room service menu, the chef prepared a wonderful snack plate just to my specifications. The next morning, I had quite possibly the best bacon and eggs I've ever had. The hotel is filled with art, the bar is great, and the concierge wonderful. The location is good too, and there are many restaurants in the downtown area within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasent Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: JMDHSMIAMI
Reviews.Content: We were enroute back to Florida from the Northeast and were waiting to see what was happening to Hurricane Ike before going home to Miami Beach. We were in Jacksonville with cabin fever and thought we would move south to Orlando to be closer to Miami. We were with a dog so had restrictions on where we couuld stay. The pricepoint was great, the hotel looked good on paper (their website was impressive) so we booked them. We could have got a rate for $140 for our room if we booked thru hotels.com, but you could not amend your trip after booking specific dates so we went with the higher rate of $190 (we ended up checking out two days early) which was good considering the hotel and what it offered. Valet was attentive, professional and very welcoming. Front desk, from what I could tell as I did not do the check in, was good. The room was spectacular. We had a view of the pool, sitting area, desk, and a king size bed. Based on previous reviews of this hotel (I did research it) we did also find the snack/mini bar strange with their "remove it, you bought it" policy. It offended my friend, but I guess I could understand as why do you have to touch a Snickers bar to see what it is? Only problem was, we had open cans of dog food that we couldn't make room for in the fridge out of fear of being charged for whatever we moved. Needs some work for guests with dogs or special needs of a fridge. We deposited the dog and wanted to grab lunch. I asked the concierge after we got to our room and left our dog in it and asked her where to go to eat. She directed us to a lunch place OUTSIDE of the hotel. My friend asked the front desk and referred us to the dining room and had a very good lunch. Staff was a tad overwhelmed as it is "off season" and staff was minimal. We also did breakfast in the dining room instead of the brunch, though I hear good things about the brunch. My one negative of our stay was the front desk. I feel they deserve their various Diamond Awards over the last 4 years. However, it didn't come from the front desk. I have stayed at Mandarin Oriental, Four Seasons, and Peninsula Hotels. The front desk at these locations always acknowledge you on the way in or out of the hotel, especially on the way in, welcoming you back. We were acknowledged more by the valet/bellmen than the front desk staff. Everything else about the hotel says Mandarin, Four Seasons, except this aspect of the hotel. Also, when asking the front desk person what was in the area of the restaurant we were going to, she had no clue where it was or the restaurant we were going to. My experience is the front desk should have as good a knowledge of the area as the concierge, the same concierge that was telling us to go outside the hotel for lunch! Would stay here again in a heartbeat. I am not sure what their normal in-season rate would be, but I would return! Valet Parking price is normal for any city. Location is downtown and lends itself to a business trip, however to get anywhere in Orlando, you need to drive unless you stay at a hotel on the property of a theme park. Prices are inline with what you would pay to stay at any hotel of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Charge Was a Terrible Way to Welcome Guests”
Reviews.Author: dsmi512
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. We had to stay there for a wedding in August. What really bothered us was the mandatory valet parking fee of $22 per day. I asked if we could park the car ourselves and was told no. They could find better ways to nickel and dime their guests. That is a terrible way to welcome folks.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff...”
Reviews.Author: sophielamothe
Reviews.Content: I just want to thank José who was very helpfull to help me find, after my check-out, precious earings I had forgotten in my room...Thank you again for your diligency and your smile!

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding Day”
Reviews.Author: ngreenNy
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding in the Grand Bohemian Hotel in May 2008. As I live in New York I only got to see the hotel the night before the wedding. It is the most Fantastic hotel ever. Everything is so clean, Beautiful and modern. Everything you would expect from a hotel. We had the intimate wedding package. The hotel took care of everything all I had to do was show up. Every thing was perfect. The staff were excellent they could not do enough for all of our wedding party. We even purchased the same make of bed from the hotel as it was the best night sleep I have ever got . I would highly recommend this hotel it is a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jimerwin
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff...Jose and Patricia - know the city well - good in sights and advice.

Reviews.Title: “There's More to Orlando Than Disney”
Reviews.Author: QRB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Grand Bohemian 4 times the past couple of years when he has to be in Orlando for work. We always have such an amazing time while there, and I am always sorry to leave. On our most recent visit, I had to work in NYC for several days while my husband was in Orlando. I had planned to fly into Orlando to meet him and then we would drive to pick up our children from their visit with their grandparents. My husband surprised me by reserving a room at the G.B. so that we could have some time to ourselves before the kids and the long drive home. I should mention that I had the opportunity to stay at the Four Seasons while in NYC, which was a first for me and it was fantastic. My husband even said when telling me about his "surprise", "Well, its not the Four Seasons, but I know you always enjoy the G.B.". After the luxury of 3 nights in NYC, I was pleasantly surprised that our stay at the G.B. was just as delightful as the Four Seasons. It did not seem like a 'let down" in the slightest. The rooms are beautifully appointed, with a touch of whimsy. Very "Moulin Rouge". The mix of velvet, satin and tapestry is just lovely. The rooms are so large, the shower is luxurious, the bar downstairs is hip and a great stop for drinks and convo before heading out for dinner. The rooftop pool is super chic with its sleek furnishings, red pillows and chandeliers in the permanant tented lounge. We like to take the family to Disney just as much as the next family, but do yourself a favor and take a little getaway to O-town, sans children, and enjoy the fun city life, great restaurants of Thorton Park, boutique shopping of Winter Park, and fabulous stay at the Grand Bohemian!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: triptracker01
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and myself) were in Orlando for business and stayed at the Grand Bohemian at the suggestion of the conference staff. It was a wonderful experience. From the moment we arrived, we were treated with such warmth and professionalism. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and appreciated. The room was lovely, wonderful bed linens and spacious seating area with a wonderful view of downtown Orlando. The bathroom was nice as well with all amenities replinsihed daily. The only setback was the the $21 daily charge for valet parking which was the only option unless you found other parking on your own. Overall, our week long stay was wonderful. We even had room service and that too was wonderful and delivered in a timely mannner.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 or 5 star property - May be 3 if at all...”
Reviews.Author: Max1959
Reviews.Content: Let me start by admitting my mistake when I booked this property by first checking them out on the Internet and then calling them directly to book the advance-purchase non-refundable room. During all that process, I was under the impression that I was booking a property near Downtown Disney not realizing that hotel was located in Orlando downtown area. Need an eye checkup… Property was OK. Staff was attentive and courteous. The atmosphere however; was dull and almost boring. We (my wife and I with 6-years-old-son) stayed in a king size bed with a sofa bed located on the 15th-floor concierge level. We had the swimming pool view which is located down on the 6th floor. Room was bit cramped and furniture worn-out. Room doesn't have a flat-screen wall-mounted TV but an old analog machine. Bathroom was clean but very ordinary. The bathroom amenities were three small bottles and single a sink. The shower did have two showerheads however; water-pressure was pretty weak. Friday night, they had a fashion show thus; pool usage was restricted to staying guests. People were smoking virtually everywhere. One of the perks of being on the “concierge” leave was usage of the exclusive lounge which servers breakfast and happy hours in the evening. The breakfast was pretty pathetic with fresh fruits, cereals, muffins and pancakes. There were no eggs and conventional bread. It was the same on Friday thru Sunday. We did go to the pool area and my son swam. He was happy. For grownups however; the pool is rather small, and less than 4 feet deep which doesn’t provide true swimming pleasure. Saturday night, the smoke alarm in our room went off. We all got up and left the room thinking that alarm was going off everywhere. We then returned and I called the front desk who sent a maintenance staff along with 2 security guards. The guy replaced the bettery and everyone apologized for the inconvenience. Stuff happens so no big deal... To end my review, I would say that it’s not a 4-star property and for the money one pays can do better in Orlando in a much better location. Sorry Grand Bohemian: we are not coming back…

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ellenburgq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the GB for 3 nights. We enjoyed our stay particularly because of the outstanding service. Everyone was very nice, prompt and professional. I would like to single out the receptionist, Erica Cash and the bell captain, Jose. Both went out of their way to make our stay special! Thank you, Erica and Jose. Susan

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to a perfect evening”
Reviews.Author: TheHiggsTravel
Reviews.Content: Living in Orlando already, we obviously do not utilize the local hotels for over night stays. However, for our wedding night, we wanted to stay close to our reception site. Co-workers had purchased us a suite at the Boheme which was appropriate since we had our first date at the hotel in the Bosendorfer lounge, which we still frequent (great jazz). The suite was georgous! Most importantly though, the staff reminded you that customer service, although hard to come by these days, is still existant and makes people feel really special. We felt like everyone went the extra mile! Our guest that stayed at the hotel were as equally impressed. It was the perfect end to our perfect evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: NCGirl07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, the service excellent. I want to thank Jose for going above and beyond to resolve an issue I had. He went out of his way to help me, and I truly appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the Hoopla!”
Reviews.Author: DivaVee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Bohemian on a business trip back in Feb 2008 and I was not impressed. The reason I chose it was because as a business traveler, it was a preferred hotel for my company. I read reviews and was expecting elegance at it's finest, but that isn't what I received. First of all the hotel itself is beautiful. Check in was great, except for the dead fish in the fishbowl that they have on the counter. The elevator sucks because you need your room key to get anywhere in the hotel. The room was nice, but not what I expected for the price. The bed was great and the dual shower heads were also high on the list. But my first room was located right next to the fitness area so I awoke to people running on the treadmill at 4am. I was successfully transferred to another room with no problems. Same type of room, nothing spectacular. The cleaning service didn't do a good job and I was charged for a $6.95 bottle of water that I didn't drink, so I assumed one of the cleaning staff took it. The only good things about this place was the bed, shower and the Starbucks in the lobby. I'd never stay for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: NJones28
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a Valentine's Day gift to my husband. I purchased tickets to a concert and decided to treat him (and myself) to a nice hotel in downtown Orlando. I received every bit of my money's worth! The hotel was outstanding - very luxurious. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive - even when we ordered room service at 3 AM. If you want a 5-star hotel in downtown Orlando that is close to everything (my husband and I didn't have to go further than a mile away from the hotel for anything), then this is your spot!!

Reviews.Title: “First class great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrCro
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The staff was exceptionally friendly. Everything was spotless. The decor is unique. The food in the restaurant was fantastic. When we stay in downtown Orlando, this is where we will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the Grand Bohemian previously on March 28th. I returned to Orlando this week and decided to stay here again. It is still my favorite Orlando hotel. Some pluses & minuses: (+) The room was spotless, well furnished, and nicely sized. (-) I had some trouble controlling the temperature. It took me three attempts to find a setting that made the room comfortable for me. How about a thermostat with an actual temperature setting? (-) As others have mentioned, the TV ought to be upgraded. (+) The valet parking was quick and friendly (-) I felt like an idiot parking my Ford Focus rental after seeing Audi's, Porshe's, and Mercedes all over the place. (+) The bar makes a fantastic white chocolate chocolatini. It was slightly entertaining to sit in the corner and watch some couple make out at the bar. It was even more interesting to watch them leave the bar and take their make-out session into the bathroom. (-) The wireless internet was horrible. I had to call the front desk to get it up and running (a first for me). They had to call their IT department who had to reset the access points. Once connected, the service was spotty and slow. (+) The ambiance and atmosphere is unique and a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much on point”
Reviews.Author: I95RIDA
Reviews.Content: The Grand Bohemian seems to be the hallmark luxury hotel of the downtown Orlando area. Not at all to say it is THE place to stay in the city, but probably the best option for downtown. I like the overall aura/décor and by enlarge the service is what one might expect from a four star establishment. My only issues were with individual employees who struck me as incompetent. I went to smoke a cigarette by the pool one night at around 11 and security bothered me whining about how the pool closed at 11. Another instance was some less than satisfactory services at the Boheme resturant , but I do believe that was.the exception rather than the norm. These inequities were far offset by the many other outstanding staff members. Principally among them I would place the gracious bell captian Jose. From the time I exited the car at arrival he has stopped at no length to ensure my comfort. Overall I'd rank the Grand Bohemian about a 8 or 8.5 our of 10 for a downtown type hotel, and probably the best in Orlando. Oh yeah and the really need some flatscreens the tvs are from like 1996

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mrtwtraveler
Reviews.Content: Went for a birthday get-away on our way to Tampa. Chose hotel after reading reviews, and liked the idea of the jazz bar. Unfortunately, we have to agree with the review by JAXTRVLR. The room was very ordinary. There was not even a flat-screen TV which does not jibe with the image they are trying to portray. The TV cabinet was deep, and there was not much room between the cabinet and the foot of the bed. The hotel touts their art work, but the pictures in the room were cheap, dated prints. The bathroom was ordinary. No separate shower nor enclosed commode. Only 3 towels were provided. Very basic amenities. The soundproofing was inadequate. Not only could we hear groups of noisy people in the hallway at all hours, we could even hear the ice machine. They advertise they do not rent rooms to people under 21, but we encountered very young people in the elevator in sloppy clothes, carrying on loudly and drinking alcohol. We had a reservation at the dining room for 8 PM, but found it empty except for one couple. Thinking that was not a very promising sign, we decided to go elsewhere. The small pool area was closed for a private function. The function board indicated many more future private events at the pool, depriving the hotel guest of an expected amenity. As JAXTRVLR mentioned, the car entry is very awkward and congested. The hotel does not compare to the Kessler property in Savannah. It is more a typical 2 1/2 or 3* business hotel. At over $200, we did not feel it was worthwhile. Would rather have paid a bit more for Hyatt Grand Cypress or Ritz Carlton. When we told our friends in Tampa where we had stayed, they said, "We don't like that hotel. It is very odd."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, wonderful staff and facility”
Reviews.Author: valerie1985
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend trip to The Grand Bohemian. We were there for business and pleasure. It is a big city hotel, lots of ambience and character. We immediatly felt at home when greeted by the pleasand valet staff and the best of all, was Jose. If you are lucky enough to be greated by Jose when you arrive, he will take care of you as if you are family. Very secure hotel, wonderful and lively bar, relaxing and private pool area. the hotel is warm and sexy...great for business or a romantic get away. I suggest staying for the sunday brunch!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Bovi33
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through the GM's office (Mr. Newmark) - who was very helpful. The hotel was amazing from top to bottom. Great food, great scene, we had an amazing room on the concierge floor. The service was also very precise. Can't think of one complaint about this hotel. For a young person the proximity to the Downtown Orlando Nightlife is perfect - I'll recommend as long as I'm around. Rob

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything!!”
Reviews.Author: Goffgirl777
Reviews.Content: We took a group there from our company for a three day conference. Everything was top-notch! Everyone was so friendly - called us by name, and the conference went off with out a hitch. Special thanks to Jose the bell captian and Sheila my banquet captain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service as usual at the Grand Bohemian, Orlando...”
Reviews.Author: GucciTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very attentive service from the moment I arrived and throughout. The bell captain , Jose, even shined my shoes on the spot for me as the shoe shine person was unavailable.. now that's service. He also offered to shine the one's I had back in my room... this gives new meaning to the question: "will there be anything else sir?"

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Very relaxing and romantic.”
Reviews.Author: Becks08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Bohemian for 4 nights last month, and it was amazing! We were upgraded at no charge to the Club level on the 15th floor since we are member's of the ipreferred network. They do this when there is plenty of availability. On the club floor, they have free breakfast, everyday, as well as cocktails (not free) and hors d'oeuvres each night. The lounge is very posh and the music is amazing. The staff at the front desk was fast, friendly and very efficient. We did eat at their restaurant (Boheme) one night, which was a very good meal, though extremely pricey. We actually had one negative experience while dining, which was resolved the next morning. The server described the specials of the day (around $35), and I asked to have one of the specials be modified slightly. The server said she would have the chef accommodate that request. When the bill came, my entree cost $60!! My husband and I were shocked, as all of the other entrees in the menu were in the $30-40 range, and the one she described was $35. The bill was charged to our room, and we didn't make a fuss that night. The next morning, I stopped at the front desk and explained the discrepancy in the prices, and the fact that the server never mentioned that my meal would be $60. The front desk clerk immediately spoke with the restaurant manager and credited our account $30, which I thought was fair. The food though, was very fresh and they gave us huge portions. The concierge made several recommendations for seeing some local sites (not Disney related!). The hotel is in walking distance to Church Street Stations, which has some great bars and restaurants. We went to the Cheyenne Saloon one night, and it was a very exciting experience. Even if you don't enjoy country music, you must see the amazing architecture in this place. The valet staff are very friendly and efficient. As for the rooms, the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I enjoyed having the Bose radio on the nightstand with the relaxing jazz cd playing when we arrived. It was a really nice touch. They had robes in the rooms, and the toiletries were high end. Overall, this was a very positive experience and we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: italianbeagle
Reviews.Content: My twins and I had a fantastic stay at this Hotel. The staff was super friendly and the hotel was clean and beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay in downtown Orlando. Everyone was great! We had a terrific bellman named Jose who took care of us and all the baby gear. Highly, highly reco! A+++++++++

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: sopafl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very helpful and customer service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: comedyhill
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend ti attend the Winter Park Art Festival. We couldn't have picked a better hotel since we love art and good service. The hotel is an art musuem itself! The staff was incredible...Jose, Ivey we love ya. DT

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern with Arts & Music”
Reviews.Author: Mother-in-law08
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Exceptional bell man is Jose. He took care of everything, every question and anticipated our needs before we did. We had functions at the hotel, the service was excellent but the food was better. Even with a mix up, they did a fabulous job of apology and converting a disappointment to a wonderful experience. As host, we were the only ones who knew of the mix up. I would not think twice about having a function there again.

Reviews.Title: “Short, but wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: cosmokazi
Reviews.Content: I only had the pleasure of spending a single night here, but what a great hotel! Check in was easy and quick, even though late at night, the staff were friendly, cheerful and helpful. My room was very comfortable, the bed was a dream to sleep in. Everything about the room was first class and top notch. Elegant comfort. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Experience”
Reviews.Author: ebehere
Reviews.Content: We just had a most fabulous weekend, Mar. 7-8, at the Grand Bohemian Hotel in downtown Orlando, Florida. We enjoyed the total committment and caring shown to us by the entire staff. It happened that on the Saturday nite, Mar. 8, the famous band, Foreigner, played a free concert for thousands of people who showed up on a quite windy and cold night on the corner area next to the hotel. It was an electrifying experience sitting in the concierge lounge on the 15th Floor taking in the sounds and view of this occasion. We met Stuart R. Newmark, the Senior Vice President and General Manager, of the hotel and was greeted with much courtesy. During our stay, Zachary Martin, the Executive Chef, who reigns from New Orleans, served us a delicious shrimp creole in the concierge lounge which conveniently changes the hors d'oeuvres daily and was so gracious in meeting us on the Saturday evening. The Boheme Restaurant in the hotel has excellent cuisine as well. The quality and quantity of the various dishes is outstanding. The Bosendorfer Lounge offers unique drinks, especially their Martinis, and has a wonderful and friendly staff. This hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to the best night life scene possible in any metropolitan area. We once again visited the club, Antiqua, and enjoyed the music and dancing. If you seek class, stay at the Grand Bohemian Hotel in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mployed
Reviews.Content: Hands down, this is the best hotel in Orlando (excluding some of the fancier Disney hotels). I stayed here for a wedding in April of last year and was pleased with the whole experience. The room was HUGE and the bed was super-comfy. The bathroom was very clean and also large. The decor in the common areas was really funky and artsy, which I loved. It didn't feel like your average international contemporary hotel that we've all stayed in a million times. The bar downstairs was also awesome and the drinks were great. The valet area was a little crowded but we never had a problem getting in and out quickly. Next time I'm in Orlando, I'm booking a room here, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoodCompany2000
Reviews.Content: I arrived late (after midnight) without my bags (lost by airline) and was greeted warmly by the evening clerk. When he noticed I did not have bags he offered complimentary toiletry items, which I accepted. The room was larger than I expected and the bed VERY comfortable. The room and bathroom were extremely clean and tidy. I was impressed most by two things that I haven't seen before in my relatively limited travels - dual wake up calls and a dual head shower head. I didn't want to get out of bed on the first call, and I knew I had a second call coming, so I went back to sleep and caught another 15 minutes sleep. Then I didn't want to get out of the shower. I was only in the hotel about 8 1/2 hours, but I enjoyed my stay very much and will stay there again when in Orlando next.

Reviews.Title: “Not Grand and Not Bohemian”
Reviews.Author: JAXTRVLR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, but nowhere near the level I expected. First the positives. If you want something in downtown Orlando, the location is good. The pool area is very nice with a "tent" seating area. Now the bad news. The valet parking area is very small and crowded. It's often mass chaos/congestion out there. The lobby is small, and the front desk service was mediocre (everyone seems pretty aloof). The rooms are very normal and average. For this level hotel, I expected more. The closets are tiny and the bathroom is just a single sink, tub/shower combo, and no toilet closet. Okay, this really doesn't matter in the big scheme of things, but it bothered me -- the paint job was very poorly done. There was paint all over the towel hooks and even onto the bath tile. Also the on demand movie system wasn't working. My two biggest complaints. It was very noisey -- the room didn't insulate against noise in the halway and from neighboring rooms. Lastly, there was inebriate people out front and in the very small lobby. Overall disappointing for this level hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At Your Service”
Reviews.Author: AHBAlabama
Reviews.Content: I was caught in a Florida rain shower while running in Downtown Orlando from the Grand Bohemian. When I returned to the Hotel, I was a rain-soaked mess. I stopped by the valet desk and asked for a towel, so I wouldn't leave a trail of rain water through the lobby. Jose promptly retreived a towel from housekeeping. When I thanked him for his trouble, he replied "I am at your service." Before this experience, I would recommend this Hotel based on the luxe accomodations and delicious food. Now, I would also recommend this Hotel based on the outstanding guest service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Grand Bohemian”
Reviews.Author: MeetingPlanner6
Reviews.Content: I recently organized a three-day meeting for about 50 senior business executives at the Grand Bohemian Hotel in downtown Orlando. I travel all over the world, and as a result my expectations for customer service are high. I was very impressed with the service mindset of everyone we encountered, from the front desk (Carolyn and Carmen, who arranged additional meeting space at the last minute despite being full) and bellman, Jose, to the concierge, Patricia and business center (Troy, who printed and photocopied hundreds of pages for us at 2:00 a.m. so we could be ready for an early-morning meeting). Food and beverage service were excellent, both in the lounge (where we had a cocktail reception), in our meeting space and with in-room dining. The hotel rooms were clean, comfortable, and artfully decorated. We had an excellent experience from start to finish at the Grand Bohemian and I can recommend it without reservation to anyone planning a stay in downtown Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Grand Bohemian”
Reviews.Author: MathiasStockholm
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at The Grand Bohemian as our first stop on our Honeymoon. Check in went smoothly. Nice staff!! We had a deluxe Room with a king Bed with nice view of the fantastic Pool terrace. Just terrific. Nice champagne arrived to our room just minutes after check in. But prepare to give 30-50 dollar. We loved the nice lounge and Boheme Restaurant . Every single night they had live Jazz with superb artist. We enjoyed every evening we had here. Try the Cheese platter with some nice white wine. It is excellent. Hotel is located on a really nice and walkable street in downtown Orlando. We love this hotel!! We also enjoyed the Swan boats ride in Lake Eola located just 10 minute walk or less from Grand Bohemian.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Bohemian is tres chic!”
Reviews.Author: aenimnicht
Reviews.Content: My husband I planned a last minute stay at the Grand Bohemian for New Year's Eve and booked a concierge king that morning (we live 2 hrs. away). I love this hotel! The ambiance is so lush and creative. The bar and restaurant are such hot spots that security is tight - you must have a room key to go up to your floor - good safety for female solo or business travelers. Not a good family hotel though - only food is fancy Boheme restaurant, the bar & a Starbucks. Good upscale room service menu too. The pool & hot tub, which are on the 6th floor terrace, have a very serene and elegant atmosphere. All white patio furniture (with cushions), covered area with sofa & chair seating areas with chandeliers. Room service food & drinks can be ordered and delivered to the pool although there is no bar/cafe out there. Fitness center looked well equipped. Our room, which was on the 15th floor (concierge level), was more like a mini-suite with a large purple velvet sofa (which is standard I believe). The bathroom is a decent size with 2 shower heads. Shallow tub. For women - lighting isn't great, but hair dryer is hi powered. Plush robes provided. I heard no noise from the hall or other rooms (and it was New Year's). The concierge lounge is beautifully decorated relaxing space with different seating areas and has great service. The breakfast was continental (breads, cereals, fruit, etc..). Being in my mid-30's I did feel a bit unhip compared to the young crowd - but it was New Year's Eve too. When not traveling to Orlando with the kids I'll definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “This is NO 5 Star Hotel...it's not even a 3!”
Reviews.Author: draluth
Reviews.Content: The Grand Bohemian is the most overrated hotel I have ever stayed at. The pool gets NO sun whatsoever. The restaurant and bar will NOT let you eat there if you are wearing polo shirts and khaki shorts. However they were letting people with polo shirts and JEANS eat and drink there. They charge 25$ a day for valeting your car. Room service charges for gratuity are 22% plus an additional 3 dollar surcharge! The glasses in the room we had were simply wiped out with a cloth, you could see the lint on every one of them (including the coffee cups). I have stayed at Sheratons and Marriotts ten times nicer than this. Even the arsty fartsy scented candles didn't sweeten our experience within the darkly subdued lights, red velvet and abundance of foo-foo art hanging on the wall. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “great for adults, romance, business travelers., and a popular nightspot”
Reviews.Author: SuperPicky
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night midweek to attend a seminar at a nearby corp. I arrived at 11:30 PM and the place was buzzing. the bar /lounge seems a popular spot. The front desk was fully manned, it could have been mid-day. Check-in was efficient, although no one offered to carry my carry-on bag to the room. You are immediately struck by the unique atmosphere. Plush Red decor; an art gallery; Starbucks. Cozy feel. Artwork for sale is hung tastefully in the corridors, adding to the ambiance. Oil paintings in room too. Room on 11th floor was clean, with a sitting area/sofa. the bed was super comfy. Two terry robes in closet. The movie selection on the TV did not work Used the sixth floor rooftop lap pool. Did not see any attendant. but the area was spotless, plenty of towels. Conclusion: This place is great for adults, romance, business travelers., and a popular nightspot. Would not recommend for travel with children, the snack selection includes a condom kit, so you get the idea. Nothing like a large chain hotel BTW, you need a room keycard to get up to the guest rooms in the elevator. A local told me the bar is a bit of a hangout (her words). A chaffeur said this is standard at the Disney Properties. Seems good idea for security.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Downtown Orlando”
Reviews.Author: pointfermin
Reviews.Content: The Grand Bohemian, formerly managed by Westin and now part of the Kessler Group, is still the best hotel, by a long shot, in downtown Orlando, and Kessler seems to have done a nice job freshening the decor. As a classic luxury hotel in a grand older building, the Bohemian is a welcome exception to the cookie-cutter business hotels in town, and a far different experience from the numerous resort and vacation properties in the outer Orlando sprawl. Although the small lobby is decked out in bold colors and features bright contemporary artwork, both for show and sale, at heart, the Grand Bohemian is a serious, old-style city-center business hotel, and if you are in town on business, or just plain sick of resort hotels full of loud and sunburned hordes in t-shirts and flip-flops, there's no better place to stay. This is decidedly not an Orlando fun, sun and boat drinks sort of place: the staid ambience feels far more of Chicago or Philadelphia than anything remotely Floridian. The Bohemian's rooms are very large, comfortable, and very attractively furnished and decorated. The air conditioning - - all important in Orlando's swampy climate - - is strong, efficient and blessedly quiet. Beds and bedding are first rate. The work-out room is nothing special, but the pool, on a 6th floor outdoor terrace, is beautiful and pure bliss. For runners not afraid of serious humidity, the pathways around Lake Eola, just a couple blocks from the hotel, are exceptionally pretty jogging grounds. Hotel staff are mostly well trained, eager and helpful. The parking valets were quick to offer cold, bottled water when I returned from a run, and also quick to retrieve my car when needed. The concierge is very helpful. The front desk had a little trouble retrieving my reservation from the hotel's web-site, but recovered quickly and professionally. As others have noted, downtown Orlando is something of a work in progress, but there are plenty of nearby places to eat and drink. If you want a splurge, the hotel's restaurant, Boheme, is a beautiful and romantic spot, with very good food and a creative wine list (including good excellent offerings by the glass).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: LosingLuggage
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Bohemian for 3 nights in July. Right from the start it was a very pleasant experience. The staff is friendly, professional and helpful. The rooms are very clean and nicely furnished. I loved the bathroom with it's above average shower. The bathroom, too, was spotless. I did not take advantage of the dining facilities since I spending most of my stay with friends, so I cannot say anything about the F&B part of the hotel. The nearest exit to the hotel was closed during my stay, so it was a bit inconvenient getting to the hotel, but obviously, that was not the hotel's fault. Sea World and Universal are a 15 - 20 minutes drive from the hotel. The recreational facilities are limited, but absolutely lovely. I was expecting mail to be sent to the hotel and informed the concierge/front office agent accordingy. Again, they were extremely helpful and I received everything in a timely manner. Overall, I can really recommend this hotel for everyone coming to Orlando on business and without little kids. A big 'Thank You' to the staff at the Grand Bohemian and compliments to the Management. I am looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Bohemian Not Worth the Expense”
Reviews.Author: Ashlee G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend at the Grand Bohemian on his recent business trip. We heard the GB was the best hotel in downtown Orlando. In fact, it has won some "Best of" awards from Orlando Magazine. We had an executive suite and the accomodations were fine. The room was pretty quiet and the bed was comfortable. But for $350 a night, I expected a bit more in the way of service. We tried to have drinks in the bar upon arrival; it took the waitress nearly 25 minutes to locate the wine we had ordered. Since she had disappeared, there was no way to tell her that we had changed our minds and wanted to go to sleep instead! No worries as she never did locate the bottle. Service at lunch was also remarkably slow (and there were only two other guests in the bar at the time). I spent a small fortune on lunch at the hotel because the concierge had told me that nothing was open for lunch on Saturday in downtown Orlando within walking distance of the hotel. When I later told this to friends who have lived in Orlando for 12 years, they told me how wrong that information was. In fact, the following day, I enjoyed breakfast and lunch within several blocks of the hotel on a friend's recommendation. I also waited a half hour for a cab when departing for the airport. The valets struggled to find me one, and it was I who suggested they call and then call back dispatch when the cab had still not arrived. It's not as if they were understaffed -- there were five valets on at the time, and on a Sunday afternoon, it wasn't busy. Also, our entire floor smelled of paint...and we actually saw open paint cans and brushes on a cart on our floor. Locals told me there just aren't that many accomodation options in downtown Orlando. That may be, but when spending this kind of money, a guest should expect a certain level of service. In this case, we would have been better off lowering our expectations and finding a rate at a less expensive hotel to meet them.

Reviews.Title: “Not All Its Cracked Up to Be, Plus Hidden Charge$”
Reviews.Author: TakeCare212
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews for the Grand Bohemian and thought this would be the perfect place for us to stay. Having stayed at the Viceroy and Mondrian in Los Angeles, we expected much the same - an upscale boutique hotel. Unfortunately, it was just an okay hotel, and not worth the money. All 5 lamps in our room were broken. One didn't work at all, while the others were extremely difficult to turn on. We just kept spinning the switch around and around. It became a huge joke, but in truth it was annoying. The room was large and clean, but the windows were a sliver, and when we tried to open the drapes the pull broke off immediately. We left the pull on the floor and no one ever fixed it. There were other things in the room that were shotty - the base of the showerhead was broken off and the wireless connection ($13 a day) was so weak we had to sit at the desk to use it. As far as value goes, we had long days, so we ordered room service. Of course, this is not an inexpensive choice, but even with a 22% gratuity added automatically and a $3 service charge, the waiter told us that he did not receive this money, implying that we should tip him further. Also, to park your car at this hotel, you must use their valet service (no self park) at a whopping $20 a day, plus tips. In all it was just a big disappointment. The saving grace was the access to a Starbucks store in the lobby, which at least got our days off to a nicely caffeined start. On the upside, the pool and pool area looked great, though we never made it down there.

Reviews.Title: “Artistic Splendor!”
Reviews.Author: hapitrvlr
Reviews.Content: My overnight stay was 9/5/07 for Business. I was excited to get a chance to stay at such a beautiful property & I was not disappointed! It's perfect for the business trip. However, it's also excellent for a Romantic Getaway! The room, decor & the nightlife is awesome! The lobby, outside by the valet & in your room you were surrounded by soothing Jazz/Bohemian style music. I even had the chance to buy a copy of the CD offered in every room (great souvenir!). I stayed on the 14th floor & had no problem with noise; not even with the Construction going on a few doors down in the newly renovated Suites. During the day you can catch the Free Bus called 'Lymmo' right outside the the Hotel & can get a quick tour of Downtown. No need for a car rental (save the money for a Spa Treatment at the hotel). The "Lymmo" goes to the Bus Depot & you can get all the regular "Lynx" Buses to go to places like all the Parks, Mall & even the Airport. I will be back for PLEASURE next time!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review by younger couple- 2.5”
Reviews.Author: JAXGATOR
Reviews.Content: Boy, where do I start. I guess I will begin by saying that we were really looking forward to staying at the Grand Bohemian. Being from Florida, and visiting Orlando many times, I have heard such great things about this hotel. Being a frequent vistor of trip advisor, I was aware of the parking, internet charges...but not the nickel and diming for everything. First off, couldnt find street parking, so we had to fork over $21.25 a day for parking. How ridiculous, it should be FREE when staying at the hotel. It costs $11 a day to have internet access, all the food in the room is ridiculously overpirced. We are a younger couple (late 20's), and are not picky at all. We appreciate the little things and like to have a good stay when forking over some heavy money for a hotel room. Upon arriving for check in, we given are keys and not told about the location of the pool, spa services, gym, etc. No mention of anything- heres your key, have a nice stay. We get to our room, two queen beds. Of course we booked a king. Call down to the front desk and they tell us there are no kings left. Great start, no mention of this when checking in, so you can imagine my frustration already. They come up with a plan and tell us there is one king available, but it is handicap. I give them the ok just as long as we are switched the next day. Enough with my story, let me tell you about the hotel. The hotel is very nice and the rooms are quite honestly, nothing spectacular. Nothing better than, say a Embassy Suites. However, the bar and pool are fantastic. I would describe the hotel as a gothic, artsy setting. The location is fantastic if you will be hitting up the bars on orange ave and church st. I will quickly summarize the problems. 1. Given handicap room, so shower was the same level as the bathroom floor. There was a flood like a damn levee broke every time we took a shower. 2. The shower had no hot water, with the exception of one time. What ajoke that was. 3. No fan in the bathroom (are you serious, yes I am). So if you frequent the bathroom like I do, your traveling companion will smell your stinky booty for an hour. 4. $21.25 a day for parking (had to repeat this) 5. Called down for fresh towels, took 45 MINUTES to get them. Absolutley unacceptable, especially when you are waiting to take a shower. 6. Construction above us from 9am-6pm, constant hammering thump. Of course, we were not told about this when checking in. And when your trying to sleep off an Orange Ave hangover, hammering at 9am is no fun. 7. Overbooked, didnt get the room we should have. 8. Greeted horribly at check in, treated like a second class citizen bc we didnt roll up in a porsche or bentley. 9. Charged by the minute to use the internet in the business center. Everywhere i have ever used the business center in the United States has been free; nickel and diming again. 10. Supposed to get a newspaper at your door every morning. Well guess who's room was the only one to not have a paper either days of our stay? One last thing too mention, the tv is a 26 incher from 1995. This high of hotel class, you would at least expect a flat screen. So would I stay here again? No way, not worth the price in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding night!”
Reviews.Author: uberleslie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Bohemian the night before and night of our wedding. Had a wonderful experience. Staff was friendly and courteous. Room was beautifl, clean and cozy. I highly recommend the Jacuzzi Suite! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience...luxury in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: hollyrn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Bohemian one night. Beautiful room, comfortable bed, spectacular views of the city beautiful (Orlando!). The guest services were as you would expect for a luxury hotel; very curteous and helpful. Went out of their way to make your stay memorable. Didn't utilize any services while there...the prices are pretty steep ($8.59 for gummy bears in the room - holy moly!). My husband and I would like to go back soon and make use of the room service, spa and gorgeous restaurant on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Unique; must check it out once”
Reviews.Author: Lily78
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed in this hotel 2 times this year. Top reason I like it is the decor- sort of dark and gothic looking, which is an excellent change from all the Asian /minimalist / contemporary decor which is so prevalent in hotels these days. Although the lobby is rather small, there's a nice bar adjoining and also some beautiful artwork. All the staff are my age (20's, no older than early 30's), which made me comfortable. Do not valet your car- there are plenty of garages nearby, one directly across the street that will cost you $5. Rooms are comfortable, bedlinens/bathroom, ect... are clean enough, though I would not call them immaculate. Rooftop pool and lounge are very nice, though the pool is a bit small. Rack rate on hotel website is about $250. I have paid more than that (it was New Years), and I once also got a rate for about $132 on priceline. I would say this hotel is a gem in Orlando- because of it's uniqueness. For this reason, I always recommend it to my friends. It's hip, but not so hip that you cannot relax. Highly recommended for couples (especially younger ones)- I suggest everyone stay here once.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Worth FIVE Stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: QRB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Bohemian for 4 days/3 nights while he was in Orlando on business. I tagged along for a little R&R and quality time without our children. We are both originally from central FL and realize that there is more to Orlando than the Big Mouse, although the options have always been a bit limited. More times than not I opt to stay home when heads to Orlando. That said, we could not have been more impressed with the Grand Bohemian. We are semi-frequent travelers and can say we have stayed in some pretty nice places over the years. What I generally find is that regardless of how much we spend, the "better" hotels are all pretty much the same...nice, but not stellar. This hotel was different. EVERYTHING about it was great. The staff was attentive, the valets were quick and courteous, the sounds of live jazz permeated the sleek lobby...even the elevators are comfortable!!! (Who ever heard of "comfortable or even hip elevators??!!) Our room was on the 12th floor. Based on info we acuired from previous reviews, we requested a room facing away from the fire department. Our room overlooked the chic pool area and onto the growing city. We heard sirens one time, and it was briefly around 8PM. As we entered the room, we were met with more beautiful music quietly playing on the bedside Bose radio. The bed was so comfortable (clearly a hold-over "dream bed" from the days when the hotel was a Westin). And even though I loved the convenience of the Starbucks next door to the lobby, I also enjoyed the comfy robe and complimentary starbucks coffee that were both provided for me IN the room! The hotel is very centrally located to everything that is NOT theme park related and made it very convenient for daily shopping and evening dining (try anything in Thorton Park!). In the end, we didn't want to leave. The "negatives"? I can only think of two: 1. In this day and age NO ONE should have to PAY $9.95/day for internet access in a hotel. 2. Same goes for the exhorbitant amount of $$ required to keep the car parked in the parking garage! I try to be loyal to posting reviews on TripAdvisor, since I rely on it so much in my own travel planning. But I have to admit that this time, as I lay by the pool at the Grand Bohemian, I seriously weighed the consequences of posting our experience...This is one hotel that I would really like to keep our own personal little secret to ensure we can continue to stay whenever we want to!! LOL Either way I will definitely be dropping the kids off at Grandma's the next time my husband has to head to Orlando for work and booking a room at the Grand Bohemian! I already can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Bohemian is Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Ketmakay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Orlando during the peak of summer. Since we are Floridians yet not from Orlando, we knew that we needed to stay in Orlando before our cruise the next day. In looking for a mature and romantic atmosphere where we wouldn't have to worry about Disney tourists(no offense) we found the Grand Bohemian. I had almost given up looking for something chic in Orlando considering that the town mainly caters to families coming for Disney. We stayed on the concierge level and loved it. The staff were really accommodating. The design prompts you to feel like you aren't in a hotel so much. All in all, I would suggest this hotel to anyone, but ESPECIALLY to those who are looking for something that isn't homey or caters to tourists. Very chic and sophisticated with plenty of room for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeHoosier
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. This is the hotel where the NBA teams stay when they are in town. I saw Kwame Brown in the lobby when I stayed because the Lakers were in town to play the Magic. There is a charge for internet. The rooms are amazing. My room overlooked the pool. Have to valet park your car. Not much in the way of walkable eating locations at night at a reasonable price. Although there is a good steak restaurant next to Makos on Church St. Be sure not to jar the mini-bar because it automatically charges your room when an item is slightly moved.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Bohemian provides "okay" experience not Grand”
Reviews.Author: rodbowski
Reviews.Content: Booked reservation through priceline and was excited to see that my hotel was the grand bohemian. hotel is great with good decor and a good front desk staff. took over an hour to get toiletry kit from housekeeping which was a little disappointing. and also room service took FOREVER but the deliveryperson apologized for the long wait. i was upgraded to the concierge level suite which was a nice surprise. it was great with good food and great atmosphere. overall it was a pleasant stay. the service across the board needs to be improved upon but the hotel itself is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff; upgraded to suite”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherPrusaski
Reviews.Content: My review is based on a one-night stay booked directly from the hotel's website (standard room--$249 night). Upon arrival, I was greeted by the smiling young man and woman at reception and told that my company has a $199/night rate and they gave me a suite for that price for no reason other than to be nice, so this was a tremendous start. LOCATION: The Grand Bohemian Hotel ("GBH") is a design hotel located in the heart of downtown Orlando and within walking distance to numerous cafes and bars. Like most of Orlando, downtown is a safe area in which to walk at all hours. The building itself is beautiful, as can be seen from the hotel's website. Due to its location downtown and away from WaltDisneySeaWorldMGMUNiversal-de-Soleil, it appears to cater mainly to (i) businesspeople and (ii) locals looking for a posh getaway. It is by no means a "touristy" hotel (you won't see the kids with the mickey ears running around the GBH). And, yep, there's a Starbucks downstairs, which is great! COMMON AREAS: The lobby is quite a work of "art." The hotel contains original artworks, many of which are for sale. There is an enormous and unique piano in the lobby, as well as a posh bar and restaurant which appears to be the place to be at night in this neighborhood. Cool jazz music is piped in all over the hotel/elevators/hallways. THE ROOM: As stated, I was given a lovely suite (Room 934), which contains a separate living room and bedroom. The bathroom had a tub/shower whcih was quite large. Starbucks coffee and a little coffee maker were in the bathroom with the appropriate coffee condiments. Also lots of nice Gilchrist & Soames toiletries. (As an aside, I read the reviews below about the bathroom tiles. I don't know what the fuss was about. This was a non-issue for me). The living room was appointed with a large red sofa, a red armchair, and table and chairs. It had its own huge armoir containing a TV (tons of recent "in theater" movies for a charge) and mini bar. Two pieces of original artwork hung in the living room. The bedroom contained a california-king-sized bed with white duvet and linens. This used to be a Weston Hotel, and I believe the bed is one of the Weston beds, as it was extremely comfortable (the origin of the bed is purely speculative; the bed being very comfy is fact).
