The bedroom also contained a similar large armoir with TV and lots of drawers. There are two separate and spacious closets, which was a bit of a waste for me since I only spent one night but otherwise plentiful room for anyone spending a few days. Two bathrobes were provided. A Bose Wave CD radio was on the nightstand in the bedroom. The bedroom contained a large work desk with a high speed internet connection that was very fast indeed (but a $9.95 charge). ROOM SERVICE: The suite was so nice that I chose not to leave it, so I ordered room service from the expansive menu. Delivery was within 30 minutes and everything was cooked to perfection. (Try the wedge salad). Room service deliveryperson was, like all other staff, extremely friendly. 22% tip included + delivery charge (this was overlooked because of the suite upgrade and I shall not look a gift horse in the mouth so for the record I'm not complaining). STAFF: This is the category for which the hotel really shines. From valet parking, to check in, to room service, the staff were terrific and should be commended. Smiles, smiles, smiles. Staff can really make or break a hotel and they were the primary reason that I gave GBH a 5-star review. NOISE ISSUES OR LACK THEREOF: Reading the other reviews below, I was prepared to be located next to a firehouse. Yes, right outside my window indeed is the esteemed "City of Orlando Fire Station No. 1". There were emergency vehicles pulling out of the station quite frequently sirens blazing but I just ignored it (it's common city noise). This issue didn't disrupt my stay whatsoever. Otherwise, the room itself was very quiet and I did not hear my neighbors. In sum, this will be my new hotel of choice when in downtown Orlando. Here are the pros and cons to wrap things up: PROS: Staff; design of the hotel; room service menu; room appointment. CONS: Pretty steep valet parking fee; $9.95 charge for Internet access (kind of unecessary for a hotel catering to business guests).

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay at the GB for a Night”
Reviews.Author: Sunskin
Reviews.Content: I recently had the distinct pleasure of styaing at the Grand Bohemian Hotel in Orlando, FL. Classy, elegent, eclectic, we could go on & on. The staff are very courteous, professional, and helpful. The hotel is the only AAA 4-Diamond hotel in the downtown (City Hall District) area of Orlando. However, the price is not at all bad. At just $249 per night for a standard, but very spacious & beautifully decorated room, I find it a good deal. For an additional $40, one can stay on the Concierge(15th) floor, as I did. It was well-worth the total of $289, as I found the complimentary Concierge lounge breakfast on that floor to be wonderful. Plenty of fresh fruits, yogurt, muffins, pastries, fresh-squeezed juices, and Starbucks coffee. The main attraction in this hotel with many gorgeous artifacts, is a very old, expensive Bosendorfer Grand piano. It's one of only two like it in the world. The Bosendorfer lounge is not only beautiful, but perfectly designed from an acoustical standpoint. The evening's entertainment this particular night was the Sunnie Paxson Group. Very, very good Jazz music played for hours. We had a very fun stay, and I am going back St. Patty's day weekend! The bar staff were also very friendly, and had a very good knowedge of the hotel's extensive wine selection. The hotel is also just a short, two-block walk to Historic Church Street for more nightly entertainment & fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MO_Blues
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was one of the best place to stay. The bed, style, color was so nice and especially the bed was comfortable enough to ease the fatigue. I guess it's comfort was equivalent of Sheraton's. Location is right in the downtown and just off I-4 Highway. - Tips - 1. You need to be careful when you drive a car in Orlando downtown because there are so many confusing one-way roads. 2. This hotel offers only valet parking at $22.00 plus tip. It's expensive. And from some reviews, you might know that the valet parking is run by external service provider and putting your items in the car is never safe. 3. If you stay during weekends, the next bldg across orange ave offers overnight parking at only $5.00 during weekends. (Lincoln Plaza) Actually I used it and I think it's a good deal. You can find the entrance to the parking garage on South St. when you make a right turn from orange ave to south St. in front of G.B. hotel. Good Luck~

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Valentine's Day... I give it 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Brainy_Babe
Reviews.Content: Last minute change of plans (and weather) had us going to Orlando for Valentine's Day. I couldn't think of a better suited hotel than the Grand Bohemian. I love the red decor in the lobby, rooms and fantastic lounge downstairs next to the restaurant (where I'd dined before, but this was my first stay) I didn't think they were exceptionally nice when I checked in but it was V day and they were very busy..... and at least polite. Room was clean and quite nice for standard room. I'd read others complimenting the Westin bed but actually it was a little too hard for my taste. Bathrooms were nice (except the tiny tubs but I understand it's a very old hotel) Loved the decor and colors and accents. Room was clean and I did the little note cards they had apologizing for a flaw in bathroom floor tiles but saw no dirt or flaws in our at all..... Staff was nice and pleasant when we called about a few things. Got our cars in a timely manner....all that good stuff. I'd read that the fire station can be loud but we overlooked the pool on the 14th floor and could hear distant sirens but barely... not loud at all... I am so tired of hotels that housekeeping starts slamming doors when they clean rooms early in the morning but heard none of this. Actually didn't hear a sound from any other rooms... Loved the fact that there were no connecting doors to the next room (that always causes more noise) I didn't hear much of anything and we slept in the next day. Hotel was sweet and gave us late check out... for no extra charge... It was all in all a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Downtown Orlando Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: LabsRule
Reviews.Content: This is an unique hotel with beautiful art shown throughout the building. It has a definite Cirq de Soleil feel to it. It used to be a Westin hotel and was recently purchased by Kessler. This hotel is ideal for business travelers having meetings in downtown Orlando. If you are going to Orlando for vacation, there are better alternatives with the Disney hotels, Gaylord Palms (gorgeous), Marriott World, etc. This hotel is about 25 minutes from all the vacation activities and lacks the beautiful grounds the other hotels have to offer. It is in a convenient location for those attending an event at the TD Waterhouse venue - but not the Convention Center as the last reviewer experienced. The rooms are a bit pricy and I really did not feel it was worth the money. We stayed in a Jacuzzi suite and it was very spacious. The bedding is very comfortable. However, the overall feel of the hotel is a bit dark and our view was of a parking lot and construction. The bar is unique and it is fun to have a drink and listen to the piano player. The restaurant serves wonderful food and locals like to go there for a romantic dinner. They have a fabulous brunch set up on Sundays. Overall, it is a unqiue and wonderful hotel for business travelers - but for leisure travelers it is a too expensive, dark and not convenient to vacation activites.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful!”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: There are pros and cons to this hotel. Since I feel as though I was mislead when we booked the room, I will start with the cons. Prior to booking the room my wife asked if the hotel was close to the Orange County Convention Center. The person my wife spoke with said yes, it's a couple of blocks away. Great news, so I thought. I'd walk to the convention, make my rounds, go back to the room and relax for awhile and then return to the convention for the second part of the day. Well, that's not quite how things worked out. The morning that I geared up to go to the convention center, I stopped at the front desk and asked how to get to the convention center. I was told to take a taxi. I explained that I was told I could walk there, but the woman behind the desk told me I would want to take a taxi as it wasn't within walking distance. However, she assured me it wasn't far. So I jump in a taxi and the cabbie drives a number of blocks and then proceeds to enter the expressway. He drives for about 15-20 minutes and $37.00 (with tip) later I am at the convention center. The reality is that the convention center is in excess of 13 miles from the hotel, so don't be fooled like I was. So much for going back to the hotel for a little R&R and then returning to the show for the second part of the day. I spent over $70.00 in taxis each day going to and from the convention center. I was pretty ticked off that they reeled me in by telling me they were close to the convention center. One other thing to note, the complimentary convention shuttles do not service downtown hotels. Morale of story: if you stay downtown, be prepared to pay hefty taxi fares. To continue with the cons of this place, there are freight train tracks close to the hotel -- and those tracks are utilized 24 hours a day. I heard a locomotive's horn several times a night as I was trying to sleep. If that wasn't enough, the hotel is one block away from a fire house. You got it. Throughout the night, when the fire house received calls, I was awakened by sirens! If that wasn't enough, I could hear the couple in the adjacent room talking and sneezing. Another issue is that the ceramic tile floor in the bathroom didn't look clean. The hotel addresses this by having a card in the bathroom explaining that the tile really is clean, but it's defective and they are addressing the problem with whomever they bought it from. Whatever. It looks to me as though the installers didn't do a very good job cleaning the grout and/or mortar and it left stains on the white ceramic. Nevertheless, for the money this hotel charges, I expect better than ceramic tile in the bathroom. On to the good comments, or at least the things that appealed to me about the hotel: it's located away from the chaos of the touristy areas and hotel/motel row. This hotel appears to be geared toward business travelers, so you are not dodging kids running through the hallways and lobby. The room was clean and was a decent size. It accommodated a king sized bed, armoire, couch for lounging, a desk, a table, current pay-per-view movies, a Bose Wave radio, in room internet access (for a fee) and the television remote had a sleep timer. The room also had an iron and ironing board, if you are so inclined. There were various condiments and drinks available, for a fee, in the room. There was a complimentary newspaper each morning and a coffee machine with complimentary Starbucks coffee packets in the room. Nevertheless I preferred to go downstairs to the onsite Starbucks for my morning jolt. I needed an extremely potent concoction as a result of my interupted sleep. The business center is okay, it's open 24 hours. It has a copy machine and a couple of computers, all available for a fee. The bar was nice, had decent food and live entertainment (jazz). It was comfortable and staffed by friendly people. You can sit at the bar, a table or relax in a comfy chair or love seat while enjoying a couple of drinks. There's an outdoor pool, hot tub and cabana as well. However, the pool is only about 3' deep. I'm not much for public pools or hot tubs, but it was nice to relax outdoors in the cabana area. It was a good place to unwind after sitting through rush hour traffic from the convention center. The pool area and cabana is actually kind of attractive and not a bad place to chill. Each time I was up there, there was only one other person hanging out there -- so it evidently doesn't get too crowded especially considering the hotel was at capacity. The hotel security is good in that you need a key card to access the hotel's upper floors (where the rooms are located) when you enter the elevator. The neighborhood the hotel is located in is urban contemporary and has several restaruants that are worth trying. The area is not overrun with people. In fact, after about 5:00, it quiets down quite a bit as the people who work in the offices leave the area and go home. There are some condominium developments currently underway that should bring more people to the area after hours, but right now it's a low keyed, safe area that offers an escape from the chaos that one can experience in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a quiet night don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: freqtravelerTampa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff was great. The only thing wrong with this hotel is it's location. It is situated across from THE BUSIEST fire station in Orlando. So, if you plan to get some sleep while at this hotel forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Could (and should) be better!”
Reviews.Author: VAJ&l
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Bohemian January 16 – 20th for a business trip. I had selected this particular hotel because I thought that there would be fewer kids (Which turned out to be accurate). As stated in other reviews, the lobby, bar, and common areas are very well appointed. The trouble is the same level of detail has not been expanded into the rooms. We stayed in an Executive Suite – the room was very dark, dark colored walls and trim. Someone had been in the room and turned on the radio for “ambiance”, but didn’t bother to leave any lights on for us. We stumbled through the room since none of the light switches actually powered anything (You had to still switch the lights on and off manually). Normally this would not be that big of an issue, but the light switches glow brightly, so it was annoying to have it glaring in the dark when you are trying to get to sleep, especially since they did not control anything anyway. All of the furniture in the sitting area was heavily stained. In fact, someone must have had quite an evening in that room – you could see stains on the walls from where full plates of food were thrown at the wall. They had obviously tried to paint over the stains, but the paint only made the streaks “shiny”. The bathroom did not have a fan, so the entire room felt like a sauna after each shower. In addition, they had recently (and poorly) re-grouted the tile – grout was smeared everywhere, making the floor look dirty. The tub was very small with a shower curtain. Room service and valet are very expensive. Valet is $22.00 and room service charges a $3.00 “delivery fee” and a 22% gratuity on top of the already high prices (We paid $30 for ice cream and fruit). The big positive to this hotel is that the service was excellent. Everyone at the front desk, concierge desk, business office, and bar was extremely attentive. Bonus – Starbucks on the ground floor if you are a coffee addict. There are a few very good restaurants, both casual and upscale, within walking distance. Note: Hotel is between a Fire Station and Church, on a busy intersection. Frequent sirens, church bells, traffic noise, etc. Not a good hotel for you if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come to lay in the sun - pool's in the SHADE!”
Reviews.Author: busyfeet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were invited to a wedding in Orlando. The bride recommended this and another hotel. We decided to wing it and bid online for a 4* in Orlando (its the only one) and got this hotel for a GREAT price. The whole place is quite beautiful and well appointed. We liked the art, the lobby bar, the look and feel of a fancy artsy hotel. The room seemed clean, internet was fine. There were a few things that we didn't like. The first room they gave us was in the interior corner. It had one window in the far corner about 8 inches wide and 6 feet tall. I felt like we were in a coffin, it should not have been a room, more like a storage closet. We called down and told them that it would not do. They moved us right away to a better room. Do not come here if you plan to lay in the sun and get some color. Their major flaw in designing the hotel is that they built the hotel to block the pool area from the sun. We were there in November, and there was some sun on the pool area until about 10am, and then it was shade all afternoon - very frustrating when you've come to see the sun. The pool area is just beautiful, white padded lounge chairs, a canopy with chandeliers, tons of towels - but no sun. Also, the key card system in the elevator was a bit pedestrian. It seemed only to slow the system down, and its all the secure as all you have to do is wait for someone else to get in the elevator, and then you can press any button once they've entered their key card. Valet was pricey - and not very informed. We took a cab one night, asked the valet to give the cabbie directions, and the valet's directions took us in the completely wrong direction, cost us 20 min and was super frustrating. Don't ask them for directions. I know the hotel was about to leave the Westin family when we stayed there. Not sure how this transition will affect the overall hotel, but I think I would read a number of trip advisor reviews before I stayed there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrtrn
Reviews.Content: We probably should have stayed in a different hotel just because the Grand B is such an elegant hotel. We felt underdressed 99.9% of the time. We were there for a football game (Go Badgers!) and we didn't exactly bring our Sunday Best. The staff was very accomodating and no snobbiness was percieved, I just wasn't expecting a dress code for the restaurant. We ate breakfast there the day of the game and the staff could not have been nicer! They sat the Arkansas fans on one side of the restaurant and the Wisconsin fans on the other! What a riot!! Very secure hotel, key cards were required to use the elevators and paper wrist bands were required New Year's Eve to also use the elelvator. The pool was on the 6th floor and was just beautiful. There were several areas for lounging on these padded Chaise (Sp??) lounge chairs in or out of the sun. The covered area reminded me of an Arabian tent with fabric and chandeliers..just so pretty. Rooms were clean, linens/towels were crisp and clean and very inviting. The Grand B is right in downtown Orlando and is very close, walking distance, to some really nice restaurants and drinking establishments, which was nice...no driving required! We recommend "Kress Chophouse" awesome food/drinks! The only complaint I have is that there is manditory valet...$22.00 a night. I think that parking should be included with your stay. That did not include gratuity for everytime you used your car. I am not a penny pincher but that seemed odd to me? It just seemed like such an elegant hotel should just put that in with everything else in the price of the stay. There were many amenities that we just did not get a chance to enjoy, like the spa. But the rooms were quiet, comfortable and intimate, even on New Year's! This place would be great for intimate weekend getaway, or honeymoon. It's pretty close to all the major attractions without being Disney-a-fied.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly misleading!!”
Reviews.Author: HungryOwl
Reviews.Content: Westin hotels have always been our favorite destination accomdation. When I did a web search using the keywords: Westin, Orlando, Florida, the search returned links which appeared to be those of a Westin hotel in Orlando, specifically the The Westin Grand Bohemian Hotel. The hotel, however, is no longer associated with Westin hotels, a point which is left to the traveler to discover. As the name "Westin" is to us tatamount to room width and length being approximately equal, it was no small matter when we discovered after having arrived, registered, and entered our room, that the approximate distance from the bathroom door to the opposite interior wall seemed to be no greater than the same measurement within a much less expensive hotel...certainly a small matter, but understand it is not a Westin room. The price for an evening stay seemed quite reasonable when associated with the photgraphs of the hotel and it's rooms at the Grand Bohemian Hotel website. Color me unintelligent, but when I viewed the pictures at their web site, I still had no knowledge that I was not looking at a Westin hotel...obviously an oversight on my part, but buyer beware...if you are expecting a typical Westin hotel room with an abundance of space, the two queen rooms are little larger than other less expensive hotel rooms. Per their website, the food served from their restaurant is some of the finest food severed in all of Florida. That statement could be true If form over substance is the system by which you measure quality. If substance over form, however, is the system by which you determine quality, then I believe you will judge the food from their restaurant to be simply above average. The price of the food though, is strongly above average, and the servings are noticeably small. The staff at the front desk are some of the best I have seen in any hotel. All of my questions regarding places and directions were answered with precision and without appearing "rushed". Our room was exceptionally clean

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gina5592
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I stayed at the Westin Grand Bohemian from October 27-30, 2006. This hotel is pure luxury. Starting with the hotel staff - the valet attendants were very polite, informative and good-looking. It was nice to see so many good-looking guys in one place. The front desk staff was nice and kind as well. There was not one thing that I needed that I didn't get. The staff at this hotel takes good care of their guests. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The dark wooded rooms were very elegant to me!! I am a fen for nice, clean and spacious bathrooms, and this hotel met all of the requirements. I felt clean going in and coming out of the bathroom. AWESOME!!!! The beds are big, comfortable and inviting. I looked forward to going to sleep every night. The only bad thing about my vacation was the location. There is really nothing around the hotel for the average traveler. There are some bars, clubs and restaurants, but there isn't much shopping. There is really nothing to do during the day around this hotel. It is located in the business district so that alone should tell you something. I spent most of my money on taxicabs. Whether I was going to Univeral Studios or a souvenir shop, a taxi is what I needed to get around. Oh well -- I guess I can't have everything!!! This hotel is in a class all by itself. GREAT, GREAT HOTEL!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: watchful1
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel and a pleasant relief after 3 days at the mouse house. The decor was amazing, especially in the club floor lounge. The most superb club lounge I have ever seen including many in 5 star resorts. The "snacks" were gourmet -- sushi and pate, eclairs, napoleons,... nothing common. The absolute best sour apple martini I have ever had. We could've spent a few days in our hotel room and been happy. Room service food was excellent and our room was lovely -- no cracked items as another review mentioned, but we were on the club floor. Far better than the Disney concierge rooms and a lot less expensive -- the downside is that it isn't as convenient. From the hotel staff and decor, I would've thought I was in a much more cosmopolitan city than Orlando! Quite sophisticated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that takes itself way too seriously”
Reviews.Author: TooManyFlights
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Orlando almost every week for seven months, so please consider this an overall review from my many stays. Here is a breakdown of some pros and cons that I experienced during my stays- Pros: -Great bed=great sleep: Fantastic beds!! This is the biggest reason that I kept coming back... very comfortable. -Nice rooms: Clean, quality furniture with nice lighting and roomy bathrooms (even though the floors and pipes currently look cracked and broken- there's been an apology note for that in every bathroom I've had) -Very unique ambiance: Love the theme. I haven't seen that anywhere else and enjoy the dark colour schemes as well as the art work and mannequins- a very nice touch. -Hotel bar: Great place to relax over a cocktail after a long day. -Location: Great downtown location, most offices and restaurants are nearby. -Staff: Helpful when needed.....but.... (see 'Cons' below) Cons: -Staff: One or two seem like genuinely nice people; the rest rubbed many of us the wrong way. Most of the staff give off a and unapproachable vibe. I have the feeling that many of the staff believe this is the Four Seasons.... its not (and the staff would be a lot warmer if it was!) -Feeling of 'nickel and diming': I understand that quality costs money. What I don’t understand is the need to charge ridiculously high rates for rooms (see Four Seasons reference) while continuing to charge for **everything** Although it wasn't my own money, the fact that the room service prices were higher than any other hotel I've stayed at in Orlando (and actually worse tasting than them) and business center pricing was thru the roof ($1/page printing, $5/page fax) turned me off. -Required valet parking at $20/day: Seemed like a good idea at first, but 20 minute waits in the morning (even when calling ahead) as well as the fact that it is MUCH higher priced than other hotels in the area turned me off to it later on. This could also be filed under "nickel and diming" -$10/day internet fee: Again, this could be filed under 'nickel and diming' but I felt like it deserved its own point. To be fair, other hotels in the area have this fee, but they are much less expensive than the ~$250/night we were paying at the Westin. Overall, it’s a very nice hotel and I'm glad that my company recommended it. I did not appreciate the vibe that many of the staff gave off or the unusually high costs for everything compared to comparable area hotels (which doesn't make this a value by any means), but the great bed and ambiance kept reeling me back in.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: AuntieEm
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline.com, along with a flight from Iowa. We stayed there from a Thursday-Sunday & had a good experience. We never would have stayed at this hotel if we had to pay the full price per night - we got a great deal through Priceline. It was super swanky, and for two young adults from Iowa, who aren't used to such a fancy place, this was a nice change! We stayed on the 14th floor and had a beautiful view of the downtown area. From our room, we could see the pool on the 6th floor. We did use the pool - 3 feet across the whole way. It's good for cooling off after laying out, which is what we used it for! We had drinks in the hotel bar/restaurant one night before going out. There was a live 3 piece band playing - piano, singer, & saxophone. It was a bit loud, but our bartender was very polite. Drinks were expensive, but everything at the hotel was. Room service was out of the question for the price they were asking, but we don't usually use room service anyway. We thought about grabbing a sandwich from the restaurant for lunch one day, however, my husband was wearing shorts & a baseball cap (both of which were prohibited by their "dress code." So, we decided to take our business elsewhere. I really liked the "heavenly" shower & bed, but my husband said he didn't care for the pillows (which were feather & quite soft). Our room was equipped with a spacious bathroom, full length mirror, mini bar, armoire hiding the television & drawers, a desk, a Bose clock radio & a "bohemian" jazz CD, King sized bed, and a large couch. Just having a room with painted walls (as opposed to the usual white of hotels), a fancy headboard, and paintings other than the regular ho-hum that you usually see, it was a nice change to feel like we were living in the lap of luxury for a few days. The room came with 2 robes, however, on the day of check out we were "missing" one of the robes. I had worn one down to the pool & back up to the room, but we weren't sure where the 2nd one had gone (perhaps it was taken by the maid, but never replaced)? I called the front desk & explained that I didn't want to be charged for the robe, and she told me she would contact the executive housekeeper. When we checked out, I mentioned again the issue & said we didn't want to be charged for something we hadn't taken. So far, we have not been charged for the robe, which I appreciated very much. I'd stay at this hotel again, especially if we got such a great deal as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely a GRAND hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: TravelChickVirginia
Reviews.Content: Truly an amazing hotel especially for the great deal we got from priceline which includes airfare, hotel accommodation and car. The bed was truly heavenly, we feel very at home. The decor was amazing, the room was excellent, the food was great, the staff were simply outstanding especially the vallet parking staff, they always make you feel welcome, there's a huge price tag that comes with it but hey, you're in one of the first class hotels in Orlando so we loved the attention, they provided us with great recommendation on where to eat, the hotel restaurant was excellent, everybody has to try their Sunday brunch. The hotel also house one of 2 grand bosendorfer piano in the world, to some people this isnt a big deal, to us it was. I couldnt say enough praise when it comes to this hotel. Also try the restaurant near your hotel called HUE, if you want to die for food, this is the place to go. We didnt even see or hear any kids screaming while we stayed here which was really really nice. Now, the only problem we encounter was the lady who gave us direction set us back an hour and a half in finding the hotel, which wasnt cool at all, you know who you are, get some direction classes before you get on the phone. We gave this hotel a 2 thumbs up. Great great great hotel, will definetely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not World-Class”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuySeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group prior to taking a cruise out of Port Canaveral. The Bellmen at the entrance (once you find the entrance)were genuinely friendly and efficient. Front Desk staff were also efficient, but, as noted in several other reviews, they DID come off as "snooty". The Lobby itself is very small, and is literally the entrance to their Lounge and Restaurant. Best thing about the lobby area, in my opinion, is the Starbucks (very efficient and friendly crew!). My room was on the 11th floor, and looked out onto the street. There was an Orlando Magic baskeball game down the street on the night that I stayed, and when it let out, there was LOUD noise (kids, loud cars / music)coming up from the street until the wee hours of the morning. Like other reviewers, I'm also not impressed by the $10/day charge for DSL Internet, but at least it worked with no problems. The dual-headed shower was nice, but the shower curtain was insufficient, and there was a large pool of water on the bathroom floor after my shower in the morning. Heavenly Bed was just that - Heavenly. The decor and lighting of the corridors seemed a bit on the dark side to me. Overall, the facilities seemed alright, but the staff in general did not seem genuine / sincere, which is not my normal experience with Starwood properties, which I stay in approx. 30 nights per year.

Reviews.Title: “Too much nickel-and-dime for a "luxury" hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the double showerheads and heavenly beds, but the fact that room service incurred a delivery charge PLUS a 22% "gratuity" PLUS a tip seemed rather tacky. Service was generally great, but every little thing had added charges, which made me feel that they were trying to squeeze every penny out of me. Not exactly a classy approach for a "luxury" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be something it's not”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The main problem I had with this hotel is that it is trying too hard to be something it's not. It's trying to be a world-class hotel full of art and excitement, when it's actually just a corporate place to rest your head. The attitude of a girl at the front desk was so snobbish that I think it ruined my stay. I apparently made the horrendous mistake of wearing a baseball cap while I was checking in. Maybe she was having a bad day, but the overall feeling of the staff creeped me out with their snobbish attitude. I'm in the corporate world and stay at starwood hotels often, and a couple of my favorite hotels are in their W chain. While I've encountered a little snobbishness here and there, the attitude at this Orlando location took top spot. The grounds of the hotel are all right. It's not a high rise, and two of its four sides are dwarfed by high rises, so if you like a view, your chances are slim of getting one from your window. The pool is on the "rooftop" of the sixth floor (the hotel is 12 or 13 floors). It may have been a nice idea if they didn't put a 7' wall around the pool area so that you can't see anything. The pool is very small and only 3 1/2' deep. The spa/whirlpool didn't work, and had a sign stating such with a "frown" face. I'm pretty sure it was written by a guest, because I think a staff person would have wrote something like, "You're not good enough for the spa, so we turned it off." The workout room, although very small, was equipped with modern equipment and was very nice. The room was decent, and the beds were okay. They are supposed to be their "heavenly" beds, but I really didn't find them to be anything great. I love the beds at W hotels, but these were a little too firm and the pillows were far too small. The bathroom was large, but the shower was retarded. Although it had two showerheads, the shower curtain is much too short so that when you try to take a shower, the entire bathroom floor gets soaked (I had to use all my spare towels each time to soak up the water). They indicated, via a small sign, that they were having issues with their bathroom tiles. I wonder if they're smart enough to add the two together. Also, the shower head came out of the wall and the pipe was exposed. I don't really care and probably wouldn't mention it, but since they gave me so much attitude, I figure what the heck. As for the food served through room service, it was pretty tame. I ordered a few appitizers for myself and my guest. Two of the three were decent and both priced at around $13, which I thought was fair for room service. What really ticked me off, however, was the $11 order of "crispy potatoes" which I swear were Ore Irda microwave fries. They were really gross, which cracked me up since their description on the menu sounds very gourmet. It's a theme of the hotel. As for the room overall, it was adequate. The pictures posted on this site sum it up. It's corporate, plain, with a few pieces of art thrown here and there. If you don't know too much about art, but like to think you do, you'll probably love it. The review about Orlando being a cultural wasteland likely sums up the hotel: pretentious, snobbish, arrogant, ignorant, blah, blah, blah. If you have no concerns about money and you like to travel to mid-size cities and complain about how they aren't NYC, stay here and find others at the bar who will complain with you. For the rest of you who obviously realize Orlando is not New York, is not Miami, but is its own city, consider staying somewhere that's not so expensive, and spend your money on the culture that dwells outside of Orange Ave. If you do stay here, try to deal with the young Asian-American male who works at the front desk. He was the only one who seemed genuinely nice. My hotel bill incorrectly had $105 of extra charges, and he corrected it and apologized. I'm pretty sure the other woman would have told me it was a fee for being subpar to her.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent (for Orlando)”
Reviews.Author: winterWaiting
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at this hotel last week. Was an excellent stay for the discount rate we paid. A few of the other posts here highlight the issues. The hot tub isn't hot. It's probably 85 to 90 degrees which is fine when the air is over 70 but a little cold at night when it's 55. The bathroom floor looks dirty but they have a little sign saying it's the tiles, not dirt. I tested a little and believe them, but a bad choice. We parked our car on the street (free from 6pm-8am and on Sunday) having read the valet complaints. It was a rental so I didn't care. Probably could have parked in a garage down a few blocks away for $10 a night or so. Here are the pluses: This is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in Orlando. Great rooms and the awesome Heavenly beds. There is no Disney crap anywhere to be seen. They have art which makes the hotel stand out from the cultural wasteland that Orlando is. It's an easy walk (two to three blocks) to bars that while not the best on earth, are better than other places I've been out in the area. They have a nice bar themselves but could use a more diverse wine list as they only offer one or two of many varities (i.e. not Cab or Chardonay).

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grand bohemian is very true to its name....a very bohemian experience right from the lobby - the elevator to the heavenly bed in the room. the shower is really world class....and the most of the appointments across the hotel quite nice. Negatives: - No wireless internet connection...you have to plug the ethernet in to go online (reason the design doesn't help their cause....very silly for a hotel of that class)....The outdoor hot water Spa was dissapointing as the temprature was not as high as you would want. ****Be careful with your bill.....opening the refrigerator will create a ripple in your bill...I was constantly charged for a certain Jack daniels and Toblerone that I never consumed..looks like the sensors are too sensitive......Well they take it off but you have to go through the hassle.... Also you are charged twice for the internet connection in the same day.... Otherwise still "THE PLACE TO STAY IN DOWNTOWN"...shall stay again anyday

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Moe_Ipak
Reviews.Content: This place was great. My wife and I would definitely stay there again. The service was amazing. The conceirge was great. The location was absolutely wonderful. It has a great contemporary look, and the room was huge. The only one complaint I do have was on the Bathroom floor there were some kind of works. They do leave a note in the bathroom saying that they are working on cleaning it up. But overall a great four day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: astrodoto
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is seeking an excellent place to stay away from Disney and the busy attractions area. The lobby is filled with artwork, shiny marble floors, comfy furniture, and a beautifull grand piano. The hotel is also popular for its fine dining restaurant The Boheme that serves a delishous cuisine with live music as well as a local favorite Sunday brunch. There is also a hip martini lounge, a Starbucks coffee, and a concierge lounge on the top floor. Some hotel amenities include a roof-top pool and jacuzzi, meeting facilites including a beautifull moderatly-sized ballroom, and direct access to Lymmo, a free downtown bus transit system. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overated!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I’m not one to normally complain about service, but I feel the $300 dollars I spent the other day on a standard king room at the Westin was a total waste. My major complaint is the staff at the hotel. Everyone seems so plastic and disingenuous. They have these spiels that they always say that make you roll your eyes, especially when it’s delivered in a Ben Stein monotone voice. “Thank you for calling the Westin Grand Bohemian, an experience in art and music, where may I direct your call?” was one that grew old very quickly. Also, every time you happen to run into an employee in the hotel, rather than just saying good day or something, they feel the need to go into detail about the art in the hotel or tell you how great the property is. I felt more like I was on a museum tour than in a hotel and my wife and I quickly learned to avoid all contact with employees if possible. We didn’t eat in the restaurant so I can’t comment on that, but out of everyone at the hotel, the best employees that we encountered were the valet drivers. They made excellent dinner recommendations and gave great directions. Earlier when I asked a front desk agent how to get to the TD Waterhouse center I was told that they weren’t sure, but they would get someone to help me out, 10 minutes later a manager came out and gave me directions, but one would think someone working the front desk would know where a local attraction 4 blocks from the hotel is. On a good note, the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room was of adequate size and was clean, but I suppose the Embassy Suites has spoiled me with its extra touches. For instance, when I stay at an ES, I have complimentary water and Milano cookies in the room, at the Westin they wanted to charge me $5 for a bottle of Evian. The bathroom was spacious and had very nice amenities; the only gripe with it was how tiny the bathtub was. They call the thing a heavenly tub, but my standard bathtub at home is larger. We did however enjoy the double-headed shower. Like I said before, I’m not one to normally complain, but I was really mad when I left this hotel. For the same amount of money, I could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton or the Grand Floridian and gotten much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Orlando? STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: FLcs
Reviews.Content: Let's remember that this is Orlando and not NYC or SF. That being said, I have no idea what that reviewer who talked about a "theme" meant. What theme are you taking about, chief? An elegant theme? Certainly there is no disney theme going on at this hotel. His review also mentioned that downtown is under construction. The entire downtown area is not under construction, but Orlando is growing, so there are a few new buildings going up. As far as having only frat bars, he apparently only walked down Orange Ave. and followed the frat looking people. The irony of his complaint. There is a lot of diversity in downtown Orlando bars...just veer off Orange Ave. and you'll find plenty. The bar at the hotel is pretty decent as well, especially once the live jazz gets going around 9pm. If you're going to stay in downtown, stay here. It's by far the best. Orlando has five star resorts out near disney, but if you're here for business, this is a great hotel, and the best you're going to get for now.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: biora
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Westin about five times on business. It is very nice with great rooms and service. I don't know what other reviews are complaining about. If you want to be downtown this is the best spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but perhaps a tad over-rated”
Reviews.Author: p_sf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin for a week on business. The hotel is quite nice, very tastefully appointed in my opinion. I had a very large room with a king bed and a couch. All in all it was a fine stay, but I do agree with some of the negative reviews on this hotel. Not to nitpick, but: The "heavenly bath" is a joke. The tubs are your basic ordinary (small) bathtubs, and there isn't even any bath bubble powder in the rooms. About the only thing that stands out is the dual-head showers, but if you look closely you'll notice that even those (as well as the sink fixtures and toilet) are cheap "pretend-elegant" fixtures. It's a bit incongrous with the marble sink and floor, but maybe they were running over-budget on the bathrooms. The place absolutely has a "renovated motel" feel to it. The doors slam loudly and can be heard in the rooms, and the corridors are low and dark, and there are definitely too many signs directing guests to the ice machines. One other strange experience made me feel like I was staying in a hotel which was trying to prove its merit: EVERY staff member whom I encountered was quick to tell me how wonderful the hotel was. Whether it was the waitress in the restaurant explaining to me (unprompted by any inquiry) that the artwork was all original and from the personal collection of the owner and then going on to explain to me how wonderful the presentation of my salad was, or the bartender chatting me up and reminding me I was in the best bar in Orlando, it's clear the staff is coached on reminding guests how lucky they are to be staying here. It was unsettling to me, as if they were all trying to hide some insecurity the place has about its place in the hotel world. A note on the restaurant: it's good, very good even, but it's extremely expensive - disproportionately so. Dinner for one with salad, dessert, coffee and two glasses of wine ran me $100. I'm no cheapskate when it comes to dining, but this place just wasn't worth the price tag. A much better dining option is the short menu in the bar - sandwiches and appetizers like spring rolls and calamari run around $10-$12. I had a great burger and an even better tenderloin sandwich. Breakfast at the restaurant is adequate, but at the usual exorbitant hotel prices. I would definitely stay again, and have no real complaints about the hotel. But I do think it's pushing the envelope with the 5-star rating. A definite 4-star, but it lacks the finishing touches and the humility to be a truly outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice but adds on for business are ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: sailsail
Reviews.Content: Nice, comfy hotel. But UNLIKE every other place - from the scuzzy to the elegant - I have stayed in the past two years, there is no complimentary Internet access or business center...This elegant joint is charging 10 bucks a day for in room, wired DSL access. The business center rates for using their computers are 10 bucks an hour plus one dollar per page printed. That's per page! I heeded the warning of other reviewers here and avoided the valet parking. Parked at a city lot about 3 blocks away I think it's 10. a day. Apparently lots of people love this place, and I like that it's quiet. but I think Westin needs to wake up and smell their own coffee.... I will be making an unscheduled pit stop at Kinkos early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “elegant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. With the exception of having to use a valet everytime I needed my car, the experience was grand. Beautiful lobby, restaurant and rooms. Other dining options within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Westin in June 2005. We stayed at the hotel for a romantic, relaxing weekend and the Westin definitely fulfilled that need. The rooms are quite large and decorated modernly with dark wood furnishings, royal purples and browns, and great art on every wall. The bathroom was luxurious with 2 shower heads (great water pressure), marble countertop, large shower & mirrors, and comfy bathrobes. My room also had a nice table/sofa area and a large tv, but by far my favorite thing was the BED. It was the most comfortable bed ever...tons of pillows, soft sheets, and a great feather comforter. Our view was of the pool located on top of the parking garage. It was surreal to be swimming around these huge buildings. The pool is a medium size pool with an attached jacuzzi. My only complaint was the jacuzzi was a too hot and it was a bit annoying to be swimming and see pepole watching you from their room. The area is clean and there are lounge chairs to lay out and a shaded area under a canopy w/ chandeliers (a nice touch). The hotel is located near clubs, bars and resturants in the downtown area, which was nice b/c we could walk everywhere. It is also a few blocks away from Lake Eola, which is a lake in the middle of downtown. It's a nice, relaxing walk around the lake and surprisingly very quiet. I did find a few negative things about the hotel such as parking, it's ONLY VALET PARKING and it's quite expensive - about $19 a night (more if you have a SUV). There aren't many parking spaces in downtown, so you're forced to park there. The entrance is difficult to find, in the pictures it appears to be on the corner but really it's next to the valet enterance in the back (watch out when you're trying to find it b/c there is bus only lanes and lots of one way streets). Also something I found a bit annoying was the hotel sponsors an art scholorship and adds $1 to your bill, this was not told to us beforehand and I found out our last day when I got my valet bill. Granted it's only a $1 so you feel obligated to leave it on there, and it does mention if you don't want to participate you can take it out, which by then you feel cheap since it's only $1. It's a "sneaky" way of getting people to contribute, even though it's a worthy cause. Regardless of a few negative things, I had a wondrful stay there and would recommend it to anyone hoping to have a relaxing stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Bohemian Hotel is truely one of the very best hotels in Downtown Orlando. The hotel was even featured on the Travel Channel and has won many local and national recognitions and awards. The hotel is very upscale but dont let that scare you away, its truely worth the stay. I love the nice decor and fine artwork featured throughout the hotel, there is even an art gallery near the lobby filled with fine artwork including some pretty valuable pieces made by popular artists. The hotel restaurant is another reason why this hotel is so well renowned, especially locally, The Boheme restaurant offers a delishous fine dining experience with nightly live music and also a delishous Sunday brunch. Some of the hotel amenities include a nice roof-top pool, a fully-equipped fitness center, a business center, an upper-level concierge lounge, and much more.. I recommend this hotel to all, especially couples seeking a romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated is the word! Dont open that wallet.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say, other than this hotel is rather overrated and *certainly* not worth the asking price. Don't imagine it's cockroach infested or any such thing, its got nice features, the bed for one is absolutely gorgeous. However, I couldn't help but feel there is a certain amount of disingenuity here... Firstly, take a standard mid-range Orlando hotel, paint on a thin veneer of class (as in add a few framed pictures, throw in some above average furniture), then, add lots of overpriced extras to make people feel like they are staying somewhere super special and voila, you have The Westin Grand Bohemian. I do understand the building's size & location has limited what they could do with the place, so i'll excuse the tiny low ceilinged corridors. The ice dispensers on every floor feel a little motelish, but thats just being picky. It's when I enter the bathroom and find that the "Heavenly Bath" they proudly advertise on their website has turned into a "Heavenly Shower", that I begin to feel a little let down. Oh, it's a bath to be sure, but one that would scarcely fit a midget amputee. I then move to the back of the room and spy a large bottle of Evian water sitting on the desk. "Complimentary! What a wonderful touch." I think to myself, as it is located nowhere near the mini bar, however I am disappointed to find that a $5 price tag hangs from the kneck. After suffering the midday heat of Orlando, this is a cruel blow indeed. So I take a shower in the Heavenly Shower, and the double shower heads are really doing my body a great service, and after that pleasentness, I slip my body into a bathrobe which I feel I must purchase for myself, because it is *the* best bathrobe that has ever had the pleasure of being wrapped around my shivering form. Moving from the bathroom I throw myself onto the bed, sink in, and view the entertainment system that I had used before in La Quinta Inn. "There's that motel feeling again, I guess this place really is for those with more money than sense." Breakdown: One night, Two small bottles of mineral water, Total cost: approx 360 dollars

Reviews.Title: “Great get away!!”
Reviews.Author: hdefx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bohemian for a weekend get away. The food was wonderful. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The lounge was so comfortable to sit and enjoy a few drinks. Everyone on staff was very pleasant and friendly. We had a great massage, not your typical hotel massage that they just spread lotion on your back. We would highly recommend the Westin Grand Bohemian to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel and Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Restaurant. We had a reservation for the hotel and restaurant. We were celebrating our anniversary and the service was great all over. From the check in to the restaurant at dinner everything was flawless. Great food and outstanding service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An awful dining experience”
Reviews.Author: woodwhit
Reviews.Content: Three of us had an awful meal there. The "Collage of Duck" was virtually inedible; the salad was limp and swimming in dressing and the foie gras was inundated with what appeared to be blueberry pancake syrup. Only the Kessler Collection Cabernet was what you would expect from a restaurant with these prices. Service was marginal, at best. This is not a Day's Inn. Every meal must be outstanding, even if it is Monday night.

Reviews.Title: “A Masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Bohemian in downtown Orlando, Florida, is *the* alternative to kitschy Disney motels in the crowded tourist corridor. This urban grand hotel is the epitome of art and design, displaying a valuable art collection in public areas through the hotel, and prints of these same works inside individual rooms. It has a private rooftop pool in the center or Downtown Orlando and two Bosendorfer Grand Pianos (1 in the Jazz bar, and another upstairs). The lobby contains an art gallery, Starbucks coffee, Jazz bar, and five star restaurant (also full of art). The main attraction for the hotel, is its location (within walking distance of all of downtown Orlando), its decor (vibrant and risquee without being weird), and an amazing restaurant. I dine here frequently, typically ordering an array of gourmet appetizers as my meal: Baked Brie in Philo, Blue Cheese Wedge Salad, and the Spring Salad in Pear dressing . . . all amazing. Last note of interest, is that on Friday evenings after work, the jazz bar is crammed with young professionals (bankers, lawyers, and financiers) from surrounding businesses. For music, art, cuisine, ambience, and vibrant southern cosmopolitan culture, the Westin cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow ... just wow! I've travelled far and wide and stayed at some nice hotels, but this one is definately one of my favorites. The hotel doesn't feel like a hotel ... doesn't look like a hotel ... and, above all, doesn't smell like a hotel! The rich woods and materials used throughout the hotel are very non-typical. I could live there.

Reviews.Title: “This place doesn't suck”
Reviews.Author: essvee
Reviews.Content: That's what my boyfriend said when we got there. Hilarious! It really is an awesome hotel. It's very "adult" - don't bring your kids here and spoil it for everyone. The decor is dark and exotic. The bathroom awesome - especially one small detail - the shower curtain rod bows away from the tub, so it never touches you. Brilliant! Room service was superb at both 2am and 9am. I didn't hang out in the bar downstairs, but it was hoppin' on a Thursday night. Valet parking is $19/night...kind of steep, so just be prepared for that. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that my "final" bill included a room charge even though I redeemed my Starwood points. This was an obvious error that I brought to their attention. They said I wouldn't be charged, but I haven't received a copy of the bill in the mail.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled all over the world and stayed at many excellent hotels. We found the Westin Grand Bohemian to be just as wonderful as the other hotels around the world that we love. The service was first class, everyone was friendly. The resturant and bar are wonderfull. The decor is elegant and warm. There is not a lot to walk to , but if you are looking for some nightlife without Mickey Mouse you are in luck. Two blocks from the hotel there are many bars and clubs that are packed on the weekends. Like the other reviews say, this is also a great spot to see some NBA players! A team was staying there the same time we were! Our stay here was perfect and I would highly reccomend it to anyone who is looking for a fun, first class place to stay without the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Dark and unventilated”
Reviews.Author: TomKyd
Reviews.Content: Read all the wonderful reviews here, and checked in for a week in December 2004. Very disappointed -- it's a typical Westin, with a very comfortable Heavenly Bed, but with three real weaknesses. First, the rooms are really dark -- with all the lights on, it's still like being in a dimly-lit drawing room. It's nice to have the ambience, but it would be better to at least have the option of being able to see when you wanted to. Second, and more importantly, there's one small air vent at one end of the room, and the air just doesn't circulate. There was a strong burning-plastic smell in the room that never went away the whole time we were there, even with the fan set on high. Third, downtown Orlando is a ghost town, and as a result, this hotel has nothing attractive in walking distance. That, along with the poor air quality and dark rooms, means that you'd be far better off staying in Winter Park near shops and walking streets, or in the Disney area where you'd at least have a nice view out the window. Personally, I wish we'd stayed at the Westin Swan near Disney -- still would have had the Heavenly Bed, with cheaper rooms and a much nicer atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: dodo333
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 month old and I stayed at the hotel for the weekend. Wow, what a beautiful hotel. The service was great, the room service was good, and the hotel itself is beautiful and very artistic. The hotel is geared more towrads adults, but our child enjoyed the comfortable atmosphere, and all attendants and guests were very kind to him. I must say that this hotel is awesome, especially for any couples looking for romance in the city, the bars are up and down by the hotel and the hotel jazz bar is very nice and upscale. We stayed here for business reasons, but if you are looking for a child's hotel this one is more geared towrds adults which we knew in advance although it is in noway child unfriendly. I give it 5's all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Downtown Orlando”
Reviews.Author: orlandohelper
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, well recognized locally as well with its excellent restaurant. The Westin Grand Bohemian is nestled in a convinient corner directly across from the Orlando city hall in Downtown Orlando. A nice pearl-white hotel building with exterior decor, the interior of the hotel has a nice upscale lobby with an art gallery and a fancy martini lounge considered one of the best in Orlando. The hotel staff is very friendly and cooperative, all the rooms are very tidy, clean, quiet, well-decorated and spacious, a great setting for couples. The hotel pool located on the hotel roof is very relaxing and has a pleasant view. The hotel is well known for its spectacular restaurant "The Boheme", the restaurant features a good menu of delishous well-made entree's and desserts, the restaurant also features nightly live music enterntainment that further enhances the nice restaurant atmosphere. The hotel also has direct access to the Lymmo service, a free downtown public bus services that transports your throughout downtown and connects to the Lynx Central Station where you can catch a bus to anywhere in Central Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for adults”
Reviews.Author: finalpiece
Reviews.Content: I am in Orlando frequently for business. I always stay here. Great room, bar and privleges for gym at Citrus Club. No kids....perfect for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected big city feel!”
Reviews.Author: GatorDocs
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly and courteous. The common areas are attractive. There is artwork everywhere. The food is good and the bar is excellent. The bar has a very rare piano (apparently there are only two in the world). The jazz music at the bar was good. The room was large and had a separate sitting area. The bed was wonderful and the room furnishings were delightful. The finishing touches around the hotel are carefully, tastefully, and artistically done and make you feel special. Other than the Ritz, this is the best hotel in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the concierge level for 3 nights. Room was comfortable. Heavenly bed and shower are very nice. Two glaring problems- 1.) The entrance to the hotel is not well marked. There are no signs indicating where the valet is. The driveway looks like a delivery entrance. 2.) To walk in and out of the hotel, one has to go through the lounge. The lounge does not allow shorts, T shirts, or sandals. Technically, you cannot wear shorts, T shirts, or sandals when entering or leaving the hotel on foot. In Orlando. I agree with some of the reviewers that some of the staff can seem snooty. We found that most were nice, however. It's a small hotel. The pool is small. The business office is cramped. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Misspurplereign
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and it was fantastic! The hotel staff was excellent and responsive. I was on the Starwood floor and also had access to the concierge floor. This is the only place I will stay in Orlando (I am a former resident). I adore the lounge and the jazz. The pool and massage service was excellent as well. I just had one issue with the maid service. This is an excellent hotel for couples and singles who appreciate art, jazz and a hot spot. The location is great if you like the hang out in the downtown area without a hassle. It reminded me of my stay at the W in NYC.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Bohemian Hotel Orlando, Autograph Collection
HotelInfo.Address: 325 S. Orange Ave, Orlando, FL 32801
